original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra m'a na barti k'a ri k'a /
analyzed: pra m'a na barti k'a ri k'a /
translated: Pramana-vartika-karika

original: bod skad du /üîΩtshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: bod skad du / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: In Tibetan:üîΩTshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume one

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One.

original: gang zhig shes rab mtshon rnos nyon mongs dra ba mtha' dag rab dral brtse ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: gang zhig shes rab mtshon rnos nyon mongs dra ba mtha' dag rab dral brtse ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The one who, with the weapon of wisdom, has cut through the entire net of afflictions, the embodiment of love,

original: shin tu dri med blo gros gang gi thugs ni shes bya kun la thogs pa mi mnga' zhing //
analyzed: shin tu dri med blo gros gang gi thugs ni shes bya kun la thogs pa mi mnga' zhing //
translated: whose stainless mind is unimpeded in all knowable objects,

original: gang zhig bskal pa grangs las 'das par gzhan la phan pa mdzad la skyo bar ma gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zhig bskal pa grangs las 'das par gzhan la phan pa mdzad la skyo bar ma gyur pa //
translated: the one who, for countless eons, has worked for the benefit of others without weariness,

original: 'jam dbyangs de la phyag 'tshal nas ni gzhung 'grel lugs brgya ldan pa rnam par dbye bar bya //
analyzed: 'jam dbyangs de la phyag 'tshal nas ni gzhung 'grel lugs brgya ldan pa rnam par dbye bar bya //
translated: having paid homage to that Manjushri, I shall now analyze the treatise endowed with a hundred systems.

original: ya rabs dag ni phal cher bstan bcos rtsom pa la 'dod pa'i lha la phyag byed do //
analyzed: ya rabs dag ni phal cher bstan bcos rtsom pa la 'dod pa'i lha la phyag byed do //
translated: Most of the righteous ones, when composing treatises, pay homage to the deity of their choice.

original: de bas na slob dpon 'di yang bdag nyid dam pa rnams dang spyod pa mthun par bstan par bya ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i lha la bstod pas bsod nams 'phel la /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon 'di yang bdag nyid dam pa rnams dang spyod pa mthun par bstan par bya ba dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i lha la bstod pas bsod nams 'phel la /
translated: Therefore, this master [Haribhadra] composed this [commentary] in order to demonstrate that he himself is in accord with the conduct of the holy ones, and that by praising the exalted deity, merit increases.

original: bsod nams 'phel bas kyang bstan bcos bgegs med par tshar phyin pa dang 'chad par byed pa dang / nyan par byed pa rnams sngar bstod nas zhugs pa las @2a * //
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel bas kyang bstan bcos bgegs med par tshar phyin pa dang 'chad par byed pa dang / nyan par byed pa rnams sngar bstod nas zhugs pa las @2a * //
translated: And because merit increases, the treatise is completed without obstacles, and those who explain and listen to it, having first praised [the deity],

original: bsod nams skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don gzigs nas /
analyzed: bsod nams skye ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don gzigs nas /
translated: generate merit. Seeing the benefit for others,

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnams bsal zhing //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnams bsal zhing //
translated: he removed the webs of conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i lha la mchod pa brtsams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i lha la mchod pa brtsams so //
translated: Thus, he began the praise of the exalted deity.

original: gang gi tshe kun du bzang po zhes pa'i sgrar grags pas byang chub sems dpa' yin par mi gzung ba de'i tshe ni 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun du bzang po zhes pa'i sgrar grags pas byang chub sems dpa' yin par mi gzung ba de'i tshe ni 'di sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa yin no //
translated: When the sound Samantabhadra is renowned, if it is not taken as a bodhisattva, then this [praise] is an offering to the Blessed Buddha.

original: de yang bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold: praise and homage.

original: phyag 'tshal zhes pa'i sgras ni phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal zhes pa'i sgras ni phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúhomage‚Äù is homage.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni bstod pa'o //
translated: The rest is praise.

original: bstod pa yang rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs dang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bstod pa yang rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs dang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Praise is threefold: the perfection of one‚Äôs own aim, the perfection of others‚Äô aim, and the means to the perfection of others‚Äô aim.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs na gzhan gyi don bya bar nus par 'gyur bas dang por phyed gong mas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs na gzhan gyi don bya bar nus par 'gyur bas dang por phyed gong mas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bshad do //
translated: Since one who has the perfection of one‚Äôs own aim is able to work for the perfection of others‚Äô aim, the first half verse explains the perfection of one‚Äôs own aim.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa sku gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyang sgrib pa spangs pa'i khyad par dang / zab pa'i khyad par dang / rgya che ba'i khyad par dang rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags par bstan te /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa sku gsum gyi mtshan nyid kyang sgrib pa spangs pa'i khyad par dang / zab pa'i khyad par dang / rgya che ba'i khyad par dang rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par du 'phags par bstan te /
translated: The perfection of one‚Äôs own aim, which has the characteristic of the three bodies, is shown to be superior by three aspects: the special abandonment of obscurations, the special profundity, and the special magnitude.

original: rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung pa khams gsum pa bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / @2b gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung pa khams gsum pa bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / @2b gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: Conceptualization is the mind and mental activities that have entered into the three realms, and have the aspect of self and what pertains to self, and have the aspect of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de nyid dra ba ste 'ching ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dra ba ste 'ching ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is a net, because it has the nature of bondage.

original: sku gang dag la de rnam par bsal zhing /
analyzed: sku gang dag la de rnam par bsal zhing /
translated: Those bodies in which that has been removed

original: bag chags dang bcas te yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas te yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: and has become the nature of non-production, together with the instincts, are said to be ‚Äúwithout conceptualization and without a net. ‚Äù

original: 'dis ni sgrib pa spangs pa'i khyad par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgrib pa spangs pa'i khyad par bshad do //
translated: This explains the difference in the abandonment of the obstacles.

original: zab pa dang rgya che ba'i khyad par dag ni zab cing rgya che ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: zab pa dang rgya che ba'i khyad par dag ni zab cing rgya che ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: The difference in profundity and vast extent is indicated by the words ‚Äúprofound and vast. ‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das gang la rtog pa'i dra ba rnam par bsal ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa dang / shes bya mtha' dag dang / sems can gyi don mtha' dag la khyab pa'i phyir rgya che ba'i sku gsum po ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang la rtog pa'i dra ba rnam par bsal ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa dang / shes bya mtha' dag dang / sems can gyi don mtha' dag la khyab pa'i phyir rgya che ba'i sku gsum po ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: and vast because they pervade all that is to be known and all the welfare of sentient beings.üîΩHe has the body which is called the essential body,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa zhes bya ba yod pa de ni /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa zhes bya ba yod pa de ni /
translated: the body of enjoyment, and the emanation body.

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnams bsal zhing /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnams bsal zhing /
translated: The net of conceptual thoughts is removed from him,

original: zab cing rgya che'i sku mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che'i sku mnga' ba yin no //
translated: and he has the body which is profound and vast.

original: bzang po ni dge legs te /
analyzed: bzang po ni dge legs te /
translated: The good is excellence,

original: mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of high rebirth and the auspicious.

original: gang las de don du gnyer ba rnams la de kun du ste ma lus par skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba de ni kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: gang las de don du gnyer ba rnams la de kun du ste ma lus par skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba de ni kun du bzang po'o //
translated: The universal good is that from which all that is desired by those who seek it arises in its entirety, according to their fortune.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma tshang ba med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma tshang ba med par bshad do //
translated: This explains the perfection of the welfare of others.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'di 'grub pa'i thabs ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'di 'grub pa'i thabs ni /
translated: The means of accomplishing this perfect benefit for others is

original: 'od zer dag kun nas 'phro zhes bya ba 'dis bshad de /
analyzed: 'od zer dag kun nas 'phro zhes bya ba 'dis bshad de /
translated: explained by the line ‚Äúradiating light rays.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'od zer dag ni 'od zer rnams so //
analyzed: 'od zer dag ni 'od zer rnams so //
translated: Light rays are rays of light.

original: 'dir ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin rab tu gsal bar byed par chos mthun pa'i phyir chos ston pa mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs par sgrub pa'i yul can dag kho na 'od zer dang 'dra bas na 'od zer dag ces bya'o //üîΩgang dag gis mtha' dag ston pa'i phyir gdul bya rnams la gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i thabs kun nas ma lus par 'phro bar byed /
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin rab tu gsal bar byed par chos mthun pa'i phyir chos ston pa mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs par sgrub pa'i yul can dag kho na 'od zer dang 'dra bas na 'od zer dag ces bya'o // gang dag gis mtha' dag ston pa'i phyir gdul bya rnams la gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i thabs kun nas ma lus par 'phro bar byed /
translated: Here, the teaching of the Dharma is like light rays because it is similar to light rays in that it illuminates things as they are.

original: khyab par byed pa de dag ni 'od zer kun nas 'phro ba'o//
analyzed: khyab par byed pa de dag ni 'od zer kun nas 'phro ba'o//
translated: They radiate light rays in every way because they radiate light rays in every way to disciples in order to accomplish the benefit of others.üîΩThey pervade all.

original: gang la chos ston pa'i 'od zer de lta bu yod pa de ni 'od zer dag kun nas 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: gang la chos ston pa'i 'od zer de lta bu yod pa de ni 'od zer dag kun nas 'phro ba'o //
translated: They are the ones who have the light rays of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir na bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i sgra sbyor ba'i phyir na bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The fourth line is for the sake of euphony.

original: gang gi tshe grags pa la ltos pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe grags pa la ltos pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When it is dependent on fame,

original: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di thag pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa'i khyad @3a * //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di thag pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa'i khyad @3a * //
translated: this word ‚ÄúSamantabhadra‚Äù is famous in the Mahayana scriptures as a particular bodhisattva.

original: par zhig la grags pas 'di byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa yin te /
analyzed: par zhig la grags pas 'di byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is an offering to the bodhisattvas.

original: tshig ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The words should be applied as before.

original: khyad par ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is this difference:

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam par bsal ba nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i sgrib pa spangs pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam par bsal ba nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i sgrib pa spangs pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: The removal of the net of conceptualization should be seen as the bodhisattva‚Äôs elimination of obscurations, as taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: zab pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa nyid las so //
analyzed: zab pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin pa nyid las so //
translated: It is profound because it is not the domain of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and ordinary beings.

original: rgya che ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i che ba'i bdag nyid las so //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i che ba'i bdag nyid las so //
translated: It is vast because of the greatness of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang rjes su mthun pa'i sku gsum ni yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang rjes su mthun pa'i sku gsum ni yod pa kho na ste /
translated: And the three bodies are indeed suitable for the bodhisattvas.

original: mthar phyin pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin par rnam par gzhag par mdzad do //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i phyir na sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin par rnam par gzhag par mdzad do //
translated: and because it is perfected, it is posited as being that of the Buddhas.

original: bstan bcos rnam 'grel zhes bya ba 'di len par byed pa ni mkhas pa dag kyang yod pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam 'grel zhes bya ba 'di len par byed pa ni mkhas pa dag kyang yod pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: Although there are indeed some scholars who are capable of comprehending this treatise called the ‚ÄúDifferentiation of the Middle and the Extremes,‚ÄùüîΩnevertheless, because the faults of the listeners are many, even though it is beneficial, it is as if it were not, and so it is taught that the mind that is imbued with the cultivation of good explanations is the only cause for composing treatises.

original: 'on kyang nyan pa po'i skyon mang bas phan pa yod bzhin du yang med pa skad du byas nas legs par bshad pa la goms pas bsgos pa'i sems kho na bstan bcos rtsom pa'i rgyu yin par bstan par bya ba dang / don chen po las nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i nyes pa 'di ni dor ba'i rigs so zhes bya bar 'di yang tshig zur gyis bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyan pa po'i skyon mang bas phan pa yod bzhin du yang med pa skad du byas nas legs par bshad pa la goms pas bsgos pa'i sems kho na bstan bcos rtsom pa'i rgyu yin par bstan par bya ba dang / don chen po las nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i nyes pa 'di ni dor ba'i rigs so zhes bya bar 'di yang tshig zur gyis bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa /
translated: In order to teach that it is appropriate to abandon the fault that is the cause for falling away from the great meaning, the second verse is stated:

original: skye bo phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skye bo phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúMost people are not interested in the profound, and even those who are interested in it are few.‚Äù

original: 'dir nyan pa po'i skyon rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir nyan pa po'i skyon rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: Here, four faults of the listeners are taught.

original: shes rab ngan pa nyid dang / mi shes pa nyid dang / don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / gzu bo ma yin pa nyid dang / skye bo phal cher zhes bya ba ni skye bo mang du'o //
analyzed: shes rab ngan pa nyid dang / mi shes pa nyid dang / don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / gzu bo ma yin pa nyid dang / skye bo phal cher zhes bya ba ni skye bo mang du'o //
translated: Bad wisdom means the absence of wisdom. Not seeking means not seeking the Dharma. Not being a vessel means not being a vessel for the Dharma.

original: phal la chags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phal la chags zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase attachment to the many means attachment to the many.

original: phal ni phyi rol pa'i bstan bcos rnams so //
analyzed: phal ni phyi rol pa'i bstan bcos rnams so //
translated: The many refers to the treatises of non-Buddhists.

original: gang la de la chags pa yod pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩgo par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la de la chags pa yod pa zhes bya ba ste / go par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase whoever has attachment to that means whoever has attachment to that.

original: gzhi tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhi tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po par bya ba yin no //
translated: The word many is used because it is a collective term for a plurality of bases.

original: yang na chags pa phal pa gang la yod pa zhes gzhi mthun par bya ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na chags pa phal pa gang la yod pa zhes gzhi mthun par bya ba kho na yin te /
translated: Or, the phrase whoever has attachment to the many is a collective term for whoever has attachment to the many.

original: phal pa'i yul can gyi chags pa yin pa'i phyir phal pa'o //
analyzed: phal pa'i yul can gyi chags pa yin pa'i phyir phal pa'o //
translated: The word many is used because it is attachment to the objects of the many.

original: 'dis ni nyan pa po'i skyon shes rab ngan pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyan pa po'i skyon shes rab ngan pa nyid bshad do //
translated: This explains the fault of the listener: bad wisdom.

original: gang la shes rab rtsal med cing bstan bcos 'dzin par mi nus pa'i shes rab yod pa ni shes rab rtsal med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la shes rab rtsal med cing bstan bcos 'dzin par mi nus pa'i shes rab yod pa ni shes rab rtsal med pa ste /
translated: The phrase whoever has the absence of wisdom means whoever has the absence of wisdom that is unable to retain the treatises.

original: skye bo phal cher zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye bo phal cher zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor the most part‚Äù should be supplied.

original: 'dis ni mi shes pa nyid @3b bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi shes pa nyid @3b bstan to //
translated: This line indicates ignorance.

original: legs par bshad pa don du mi gnyer ba kho nar ma zad kyi legs par bshad pa mngon par brjod pa la /
analyzed: legs par bshad pa don du mi gnyer ba kho nar ma zad kyi legs par bshad pa mngon par brjod pa la /
translated: Not only do they not seek well-spoken speech, but they also become filled with hostility toward well-spoken speech.

original: phrag dog da mi dag gis sdang bar yang yongs su gyur cing ldan pa yin te /üîΩdon du mi gnyer ba yang yin la /
analyzed: phrag dog da mi dag gis sdang bar yang yongs su gyur cing ldan pa yin te / don du mi gnyer ba yang yin la /
translated: They are filled with hostility because of jealousy.

original: sdang ba yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdang ba yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey do not seek‚Äù means that they do not seek it and they are hostile toward it.

original: 'dis ni go rims bzhin du don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / gzu bo ma yin pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni go rims bzhin du don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / gzu bo ma yin pa nyid bshad do //
translated: This line explains, in order, their lack of seeking and their lack of purity.

original: 'dir yang skye bo phal cher zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩphrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang skye bo phal cher zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o // phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Again, the phrase ‚Äúfor the most part‚Äù should be supplied.üîΩJealousy is the agitation of the mind that occurs when one is confronted with another‚Äôs good fortune.

original: de nyid sems dri ma can du byed pa yin pa'i phyir dri mas te /
analyzed: de nyid sems dri ma can du byed pa yin pa'i phyir dri mas te /
translated: It is a stain because it defiles the mind.

original: gsal ba'i bye brag gis mang po'i tshig smos so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bye brag gis mang po'i tshig smos so //
translated: The plural particle is used because there are many different kinds of stains.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na bdag la ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na bdag la ste /
translated: For what reason?üîΩ

original: kho bo la ni rnam 'grel zhes bya ba'i gzhung rtsom par 'dod pa 'di ni gzhan la phan pa yin zhes bsam pa'ang med do //
analyzed: kho bo la ni rnam 'grel zhes bya ba'i gzhung rtsom par 'dod pa 'di ni gzhan la phan pa yin zhes bsam pa'ang med do //
translated: For that reason, I have no thought that this composition of a treatise called the ‚ÄúCommentary‚Äù is for the benefit of others.

original: gzhan dag gi phan pa ste 'dis phan pa byed pas te byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi phan pa ste 'dis phan pa byed pas te byed pa yin no //
translated: It is for the benefit of others, because it is beneficial to others, because it is an activity.

original: yang na gzhan dag la phan par byed pas na gzhan la phan pa ste las yin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag la phan par byed pas na gzhan la phan pa ste las yin no //
translated: Or, it is for the benefit of others, because it is an activity that benefits others.üîΩBut how does one engage in composing a treatise?

original: 'o na ji ltar bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug ce na sems ni yun ring zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩyun ring ni dus ring po'o //üîΩlegs par bshad pa la goms pas bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug ce na sems ni yun ring zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / yun ring ni dus ring po'o // legs par bshad pa la goms pas bskyed pa ni /
translated: For a long time, the mind has beenüîΩgenerated by habituation to eloquence.

original: legs bshad goms pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: legs bshad goms pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: Habituation to eloquence is the generation of habituation to eloquence.

original: lhur len pa ni zhen pa dang / ched cher 'dzin pa nyid de /
analyzed: lhur len pa ni zhen pa dang / ched cher 'dzin pa nyid de /
translated: Zeal is attachment and great regard.

original: gang la legs par bshad pa la goms pas lhur len pa bskyed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la legs par bshad pa la goms pas lhur len pa bskyed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who has generated zeal for habituation to eloquence is called that.

original: rgyu de'i phyir rnam 'grel bya ba 'di la dga' ba skyes shing sems la mngon par 'dod pa skyes so zhes kha cig ni de skad du 'chad do //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir rnam 'grel bya ba 'di la dga' ba skyes shing sems la mngon par 'dod pa skyes so zhes kha cig ni de skad du 'chad do //
translated: For this reason, I have taken delight in this work and have developed a strong desire to compose it.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de /
translated: Others explain this passage differently.

original: slob dpon chos kyi grags pa 'di ci'i phyir tshad ma kun nas btus pa rnam 'grel gyi tshul du 'chad par byed kyi rang dga' kho na'i bstan bcos ni ma yin zhes 'dri ba'i skabs 'dir /
analyzed: slob dpon chos kyi grags pa 'di ci'i phyir tshad ma kun nas btus pa rnam 'grel gyi tshul du 'chad par byed kyi rang dga' kho na'i bstan bcos ni ma yin zhes 'dri ba'i skabs 'dir /
translated: When the question is raised, ‚ÄúWhy does the master Dharmottara explain the NyƒÅyabindu in the manner of a commentary, and not as an independent treatise?‚Äù

original: skye bo phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skye bo phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMost people . . .‚Äù

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni bdag ni sems pa dang / snying rjes tshad ma kun nas btus pa bshad par sems la 'dod pa skyes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni bdag ni sems pa dang / snying rjes tshad ma kun nas btus pa bshad par sems la 'dod pa skyes so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The condensed meaning of this verse is that he has developed a strong desire to compose the NyƒÅyabindu because of his compassion and his wish to benefit others.

original: @4a * // sems pa dang snying rje dag ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad pa'i bstan bcos phan pa chung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / phan pa chung ba yang nyan pa po'i skye bo'i nyes pa las gyur pas so //
analyzed: @4a * // sems pa dang snying rje dag ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad pa'i bstan bcos phan pa chung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / phan pa chung ba yang nyan pa po'i skye bo'i nyes pa las gyur pas so //
translated: Compassion and the mind of enlightenment are not taught in the treatises composed by Master Dignaga, because they are of little benefit, and little benefit comes from the faults of the person who listens.

original: tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the words should be stated.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mang du ste /üîΩphal pa la chags pa'i skye bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mang du ste / phal pa la chags pa'i skye bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Most means many.üîΩThe word people is supplied.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ma rabs la bya ste /
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ma rabs la bya ste /
translated: Most means ordinary people.

original: gang zhig rgyu ngan pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu ngan pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: They are of little benefit, because they arise from bad causes.

original: de bzhin du mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos dag dang / gzhan gyis byas pa slob dpon gyi lugs kyi bstan bcos sun 'byin pa rnams kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa las byung ba yin pas rgyu ngan pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos dag dang / gzhan gyis byas pa slob dpon gyi lugs kyi bstan bcos sun 'byin pa rnams kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa las byung ba yin pas rgyu ngan pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the treatises of the tirthikas and the refutations of the treatises of the Master's system composed by others arise from mistaken knowledge, and so arise from bad causes.

original: de'i phyir phal pa dag yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phal pa dag yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are ordinary.

original: gang la de dag la chags shing rjes su chags pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de dag la chags shing rjes su chags pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: One who is attached to and delights in those is called that.

original: yang ci'i phyir phal ba la chags she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phal ba la chags she na /
translated: Why is one attached to the ordinary?

original: shes rab rtsal med pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shes rab rtsal med pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because of the absence of the power of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir na 'di nyes par bshad pa la yang legs par bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar bzung nas phal pa la chags par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di nyes par bshad pa la yang legs par bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar bzung nas phal pa la chags par byed do //
translated: Therefore, one is attached to the ordinary because one thinks that what is badly taught is well taught.

original: shes rab kyi mthu med pa nyid kyi phyir na bdag nyid kyis slob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par mi nus pas /üîΩslob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa de dag don du mi gnyer zhing slob dpon la yang zhe sdang bar 'gyur bar ma zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mthu med pa nyid kyi phyir na bdag nyid kyis slob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par mi nus pas / slob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa de dag don du mi gnyer zhing slob dpon la yang zhe sdang bar 'gyur bar ma zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because of the absence of the power of wisdom, one is unable to understand the well taught by the masters just as it is.üîΩNot only does one not strive for the well taught by the masters, but one also hates the masters.

original: slob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa rnams don du mi gnyer ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa rnams don du mi gnyer ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does one not strive for the well taught by the masters, but one also hates the masters.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la phrag dog dri ma rnams kyis sdang bar yang yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la phrag dog dri ma rnams kyis sdang bar yang yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, he became thoroughly hostile to Master Dignaga due to the defilement of jealousy.

original: ji lta bu zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig la zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: legs bshad goms pas lhur len bskyed pa la'o //
analyzed: legs bshad goms pas lhur len bskyed pa la'o //
translated: He generated a strong interest in the study of the good explanations.

original: bar du chod kyang 'brel pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bar du chod kyang 'brel pa kho na yin te /
translated: Even though there was an interruption, there was a connection.

original: lugs las / gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa ni //
analyzed: lugs las / gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa ni //
translated: As it is said in the scriptures:

original: ring na 'dug kyang de dang nger //
analyzed: ring na 'dug kyang de dang nger //
translated: Even if one is far away, one is certain

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: to be connected with that with which one is connected.

original: bshad pa bzad pa ni legs par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa bzad pa ni legs par bshad pa ste /
translated: The good explanations are the good explanations.

original: de la goms pa'o //
analyzed: de la goms pa'o //
translated: One becomes accustomed to them.

original: de la lhur len bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de la lhur len bskyed pa ste /
translated: One generates a strong interest in them.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po gang la de kho na la shin tu zhe na pa nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po gang la de kho na la shin tu zhe na pa nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is directed toward Master Dignaga is a strong interest in him.

original: 'dis ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po bsod nams dang ye shes bsags pa nyid yin par bstan @4b te ;
analyzed: 'dis ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po bsod nams dang ye shes bsags pa nyid yin par bstan @4b te ;
translated: This shows that Master Dignaga was one who had accumulated merit and knowledge.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes bsags pa dag kho na legs par bshad pa la goms pas lhur len pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes bsags pa dag kho na legs par bshad pa la goms pas lhur len pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Only those who have accumulated merit and wisdom will develop a keen interest in the practice of the good explanations.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi mthu med pas slob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa dag don du mi gnyer zhing phal pa la chags pa de'i phyir tshad ma kun nas bsdus pa 'di mchog tu phan pa min pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi mthu med pas slob dpon gyis legs par bshad pa dag don du mi gnyer zhing phal pa la chags pa de'i phyir tshad ma kun nas bsdus pa 'di mchog tu phan pa min pa'o //
translated: Because those who lack the power of wisdom do not seek the good explanations of the masters and are attached to the ordinary, therefore this compendium of valid cognition is not supremely beneficial.

original: phan pa ni phan pa ste ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: phan pa ni phan pa ste ngo bo yin no //
translated: Beneficial means benefit, which is the nature.

original: 'dis phan ba mchog dam par mi 'gyur bas na mchog tu phan pa min pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis phan ba mchog dam par mi 'gyur bas na mchog tu phan pa min pa'o //
translated: Since it does not become the highest, supreme benefit, it is not supremely beneficial.

original: phan pa cung zad ni yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: phan pa cung zad ni yod pa kho na ste /
translated: There is only a little benefit,

original: de ni phal cher zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phal cher zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: which is indicated by the word mostly.

original: des na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu yin pa ste /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu yin pa ste /
translated: The word therefore is the reason.

original: rgyu des na bdag gi bstan bcos 'di don chen po yin yang mang po rnams la phan par ma gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu des na bdag gi bstan bcos 'di don chen po yin yang mang po rnams la phan par ma gyur te /
translated: By that reason, although this treatise of mine has great meaning, it has not become beneficial for many.

original: de bas ji ltar na 'di shin tu 'bras bu dang bcas par bya snyam pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: de bas ji ltar na 'di shin tu 'bras bu dang bcas par bya snyam pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems pa'ang yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also the thought, ‚ÄúHow can I make this most fruitful?‚Äù

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni slob dpon byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra ba la cung zad cig zhe sdang ba yang phung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni slob dpon byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra ba la cung zad cig zhe sdang ba yang phung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that even a slight hostility toward a spiritual master who is like a bodhisattva is a cause of ruin.

original: de bas na bdag gis slob dpon gyi lugs phyin ci ma log par rab tu bstan pas /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis slob dpon gyi lugs phyin ci ma log par rab tu bstan pas /
translated: Therefore, I will teach the unerring system of the spiritual master.üîΩHaving generated respect for the spiritual master, I will turn away from that cause of ruin.

original: slob dpon la gus pa bskyed nas phung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu de las bzlog par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i snying rje ba yang yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon la gus pa bskyed nas phung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu de las bzlog par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i snying rje ba yang yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is also compassion, the desire that they be free from suffering.

original: phyir 'di la dga' ba skyes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir 'di la dga' ba skyes zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of that, joy arises in me.

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas ni sems pa dang / snying rje dag rgyu nyid yin par bstan te /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas ni sems pa dang / snying rje dag rgyu nyid yin par bstan te /
translated: The second ‚Äúbecause‚Äù indicates that thought and compassion are the cause.

original: sems pa dang snying rje 'di gnyis kyis na sems yun ring zhing dus ring po nas tshad ma kun las btus pa'i rnam par bshad par gyur pa gzhung 'grel bya ba 'di la dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: sems pa dang snying rje 'di gnyis kyis na sems yun ring zhing dus ring po nas tshad ma kun las btus pa'i rnam par bshad par gyur pa gzhung 'grel bya ba 'di la dga' ba skyes te /
translated: Because of this love and compassion, I have taken delight in this text, the commentary on the Pramanavarttika, for a long time, for many years.

original: 'dod pa rgyun chags par byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa rgyun chags par byung ba yin no //
translated: The mind, which is long-lasting and enduring, is delighted by this treatise, the commentary on the Compendium of Valid Knowledge, and so this desire arises continuously.

original: gal te slob dpon chos kyi grags pa tshad ma kun nas btus pa 'chad par bzhed na /üîΩci'i phyir rang dgar rjes su dpag pa 'di rnam par 'jog snyam pa'i the tshom bsal pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te slob dpon chos kyi grags pa tshad ma kun nas btus pa 'chad par bzhed na / ci'i phyir rang dgar rjes su dpag pa 'di rnam par 'jog snyam pa'i the tshom bsal pa'i phyir /
translated: If the master Dharmakƒ´rti wishes to explain the Compendium of Valid Knowledge,üîΩwhy does he posit this autonomous inference?

original: don dang don ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To dispel that doubt, he says ‚Äúthe distinction between what is meaningful and what is not meaningful,‚Äù and so on.

original: don ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: don ni phan pa'o //
translated: Meaning is benefit.

original: don ma yin pa ni mi phan pa ste /
analyzed: don ma yin pa ni mi phan pa ste /
translated: Not meaningful is not beneficial.

original: de dag rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: That is the distinction.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is based on inference.üîΩThat which is based on what?

original: gang la brten rjes su dpag pa @5a * //
analyzed: gang la brten rjes su dpag pa @5a * //
translated: Inference.

original: yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
translated: The words are connected in that way.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni don dang don ma yin pa dag gtan la phab nas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni don dang don ma yin pa dag gtan la phab nas /
translated: And by inference, having determined what is a meaning and what is not a meaning,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rjes la 'byung ba'i shes pa rgyun chags par 'jug pas don dang don ma yin pa dag go rims bzhin du theb pa dang spang bar bya ba'i phyir bye brag tu rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rjes la 'byung ba'i shes pa rgyun chags par 'jug pas don dang don ma yin pa dag go rims bzhin du theb pa dang spang bar bya ba'i phyir bye brag tu rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: one subsequently engages in a continuous consciousness that arises after inference, and one determines the particulars in order to accept and reject what is a meaning and what is not a meaning, respectively.

original: de lta bas na don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the discernment of what is a meaning and what is not a meaning is based on inference.

original: de la log par rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa de la log par rtog pas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes kha cig ni de skad du 'chad do //
analyzed: de la log par rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa de la log par rtog pas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes kha cig ni de skad du 'chad do //
translated: Some explain that the phrase ‚Äúdue to a misconception about that‚Äù means that the determination of that is due to a misconception about that inference.

original: 'dir 'di ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, this is to be considered:

original: re zhig gal te 'di skad don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa kho na rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar nges par gzung na ni de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: re zhig gal te 'di skad don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa kho na rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar nges par gzung na ni de ni mi rung ste /
translated: If you were to hold that the statement ‚Äúbecause it is based on inference‚Äù is to be taken as meaning that the discernment of the meaningfulness of a statement is based on inference, then that is not correct.

original: don dang don ma yin pa dag las gzhan pa gsum po btang snyoms su bya ba'i yul rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa de yang rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa dag las gzhan pa gsum po btang snyoms su bya ba'i yul rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa de yang rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the discernment of the object of indifference, which is a third category other than the meaningful and the meaningless, is also based on inference.

original: don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa yang ma nges pas mngon sum la brten pa nyid yin pa ma bzlog pas gang gis na de dang por bstan par bya ba rjes su dpag pa khyad par du 'phags par brjod pa yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa yang ma nges pas mngon sum la brten pa nyid yin pa ma bzlog pas gang gis na de dang por bstan par bya ba rjes su dpag pa khyad par du 'phags par brjod pa yang ci zhig yod /
translated: Since the discernment of the meaningful and the meaningless is also indefinite, you have not refuted that it is based on perception, and so what is the point of your saying that inference is superior to perception because it is taught first?

original: 'on te yang 'di skad du don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa kho na yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar nges par gzung na /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'di skad du don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa kho na yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar nges par gzung na /
translated: If you were to hold that the statement ‚Äúbecause it is based on inference‚Äù is to be taken as meaning that the discernment of the meaningful and the meaningless is based only on inference, then that is not correct.

original: de lta na yang nges par gzung ba'i rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩdon dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni mngon sum la brten pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang nges par gzung ba'i rigs pa ma yin te / don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni mngon sum la brten pa yang yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, it is not right to hold that it is a means of valid cognition.üîΩThe distinction between the real and the unreal is based on perception.

original: 'di ltar don dang don ma yin pa rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo dag ni mngon sum la snang ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dang don ma yin pa rnam par phye ba'i ngo bo dag ni mngon sum la snang ba nyid yin la /
translated: The nature of the distinction between the real and the unreal is the appearance in perception.

original: mngon sum de yang shin tu goms te /
analyzed: mngon sum de yang shin tu goms te /
translated: And that perception is very familiar,

original: gsal bar gyur pas 'khrul pa'i rgyu spangs na don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa phyis 'byung ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pas 'khrul pa'i rgyu spangs na don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa phyis 'byung ba skyed par byed do //
translated: and it becomes clear that the cause of error is eliminated, and the subsequent occurrence of the conception that distinguishes the real and the unreal is produced.

original: don dang don ma yin pa so sor nyams su myong nas ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de la nges pa bskyed pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rten byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa so sor nyams su myong nas ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de la nges pa bskyed pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rten byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Having experienced the distinction between the real and the unreal, and having generated certainty in it just as it was experienced, that itself is the basis for the distinction between the real and the unreal in perception.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog @5b pa kho nas don dang don ma yin pa dag rnam par phye'o zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog @5b pa kho nas don dang don ma yin pa dag rnam par phye'o zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: And it cannot be said that the distinction between the real and the unreal is made later by the very same conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pas ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because conceptualization does not grasp the intrinsic nature of an entity.

original: 'on te 'dzin na ni rnam par rtog pa nyid nyams te rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa la don gsal bar snang ba nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'on te 'dzin na ni rnam par rtog pa nyid nyams te rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa la don gsal bar snang ba nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: If it did grasp it, then conceptualization would be undermined, because it is contradictory for something connected with conceptualization to appear clearly as an object.

original: / yul 'ga' zhig la gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / yul 'ga' zhig la gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: And because there is no clarity with respect to some object,

original: mngon sum gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu bsal bar mi nus pa de la ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu bsal bar mi nus pa de la ni /
translated: the cause of error in perception cannot be removed.

original: rjes su dpag pa las nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, ascertainment would come from inference,

original: thams cad pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from a universal.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid ni rang dang gzhan las nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid ni rang dang gzhan las nges pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the validity of perception is ascertained from itself and from others,

original: don 'di ni le'u gnyis pa las gtan la 'bebs pas 'dir mi spro'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni le'u gnyis pa las gtan la 'bebs pas 'dir mi spro'o //
translated: but this point will be settled in chapter two, so I will not elaborate on it here.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu spangs pa'i mngon sum ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin nges pa skyed pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar rang gis don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu spangs pa'i mngon sum ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin nges pa skyed pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar rang gis don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin par 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: Direct perception that has abandoned the cause of error is certainly to be accepted as the cause that distinguishes what is meaningful and what is not meaningful, because it generates ascertainment just as it is experienced.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa yang rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then inference would not be established,

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason such as smoke would not be established.

original: du ba la sogs pa yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs na ni thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs na ni thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If smoke and so on are understood by inference, there would be an infinite regress,

original: de la yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis rtags gtan la dbab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis rtags gtan la dbab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in that case another inference would establish the reason.

original: yang gal te mngon sum don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rten ma yin na de'i tshe bstan bcos mdzad pas rab tu byed pa gzhan las phan pa dang mi phan pa 'thob pa dang / spang ba dag ni gdon mi za bar yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang gal te mngon sum don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i rten ma yin na de'i tshe bstan bcos mdzad pas rab tu byed pa gzhan las phan pa dang mi phan pa 'thob pa dang / spang ba dag ni gdon mi za bar yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if direct perception is not the basis for distinguishing the real and the unreal, then it would contradict the explanation in another treatise chapter that obtaining benefit and non-benefit and abandoning them definitely have correct knowledge as their antecedent.

original: de bzhin du 'di gnyis kyis don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang de dag mthong ba nyid mthong nas myong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di gnyis kyis don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / yang de dag mthong ba nyid mthong nas myong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, it would contradict the explanation that ‚Äúhaving ascertained the meaning through these two‚Äù and so on, and ‚Äúhaving seen them, memory arises from the power of experience‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta bas na gzhan du rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan du rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be explained differently.

original: don ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa yin te rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa yin te rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that which is composed by the master Dignaga, such as the Nyayapravesa, because it is endowed with reasoning.

original: don ma yin pa ni mu stegs kyis byas pa yin @6a * //
analyzed: don ma yin pa ni mu stegs kyis byas pa yin @6a * //
translated: The non-meaning is that composed by the tirthikas,

original: te ; rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not endowed with reasoning.

original: de gnyis rnam par 'byed pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa dang / rigs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis rnam par 'byed pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa dang / rigs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: The differentiation of those two is the establishment of what is endowed with reasoning and what is not endowed with reasoning.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is because it is based on inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa khon la brten nas mtshan nyid kyi tshig rnams rigs pa dang ldan pa dang / rigs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa khon la brten nas mtshan nyid kyi tshig rnams rigs pa dang ldan pa dang / rigs pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The words of the definition are to be established as endowed with reasoning and not endowed with reasoning based only on inference.

original: mngon sum la brten nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum la brten nas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not based on direct perception,

original: de ni rnam par dpyod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par dpyod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not an analyzer.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the definition of inference has already been explained,

original: de las log par rtog pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las log par rtog pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúbecause of the misconception about it.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa de la rmongs pas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa de log par rtog pa bsal bas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de la rmongs pas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa de log par rtog pa bsal bas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas bshad pa'o //
translated: The treatise was composed by the author in order to eliminate the misconception about that inference, in order to establish it.

original: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di skad du gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa la brten nas /
translated: This is what is being said: because of the misconception about inference,

original: tshang ma kun nas bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya ba yin na de la yang log par rtog pa yod pa de'i phyir re zhig de nyid rnam par gzhag go zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: tshang ma kun nas bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya ba yin na de la yang log par rtog pa yod pa de'i phyir re zhig de nyid rnam par gzhag go zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: the treatise was composed in order to establish inference, since the meaning of the entire text is to be explained in dependence on inference.

original: de skad du rab tu byed pa gnyis pa rtsom pa na yang slob dpon gyis chad ma'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du rab tu byed pa gnyis pa rtsom pa na yang slob dpon gyis chad ma'i mtshan nyid bshad pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is stated in the second chapter of the text, where the master states the reason for explaining the definition of negation: ‚ÄúHaving established inference, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na ci'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin na ci'i phyir /
translated: If inference is to be established, why is it not mentioned at the beginning?

original: phyogs chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs kho na rnam par 'jog ce na /
analyzed: phyogs chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs kho na rnam par 'jog ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúAre the reasons established by the property of the subject and so on?‚Äù

original: de ni nyes pa med de gtan tshigs bye brag tu bshad pa'i sgro kho na nas de rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de gtan tshigs bye brag tu bshad pa'i sgro kho na nas de rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because they are established by the mere words that explain the reasons in detail.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid dang / grangs nges pa dang / nges pa'i rgyu dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa bshad de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid dang / grangs nges pa dang / nges pa'i rgyu dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa bshad de /
translated: In this verse, the definition, the ascertainment of number, the cause of ascertainment, and the opposite of the discordant class are explained.

original: phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni //
analyzed: phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni //
translated: The property of the subject and pervasion by that part

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition.

original: phyogs de'i cha ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos te ;
analyzed: phyogs de'i cha ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos te ;
translated: The part of the subject is the property to be proven.

original: / des khyab pa kho na zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: / des khyab pa kho na zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: It is ascertained that it is pervaded by that alone.üîΩThe three

original: rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni grangs nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni grangs nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of number.

original: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
translated: Because of the certainty of the invariable relation.

original: zhes bya ba ni grangs nges pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grangs nges pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: This is the cause of the ascertainment of number.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ni gsum kho na la nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ni gsum kho na la nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because non-existence is ascertained only in the three.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang de las @6b gzhan //üîΩzhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang de las @6b gzhan // zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ste /
translated: The fallacious reasons are other than those.

original: gtan tshigs gsum po de las gzhan pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum po de las gzhan pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag yin no //
translated: The fallacious reasons are other than those three reasons.

original: mdo las phyogs chos zhes bshad pa //
analyzed: mdo las phyogs chos zhes bshad pa //
translated: The Sutra master explains that the property of the subject is stated.

original: phyogs ni chos dang chos can gyi spyi la bya na /
analyzed: phyogs ni chos dang chos can gyi spyi la bya na /
translated: If the subject is taken to be the general property of the subject and the predicate,

original: gtan tshigs ni spyi'i chos nyid yin par phyir rgol ba la ma grub po //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni spyi'i chos nyid yin par phyir rgol ba la ma grub po //
translated: then the reason is not established for the opponent, because it is the general property.

original: 'on te grub na ni rjes su dpag pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te grub na ni rjes su dpag pa don med do zhe na /
translated: But if it is established, then inference is pointless.

original: phyogs ni chos can no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs ni chos can no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The subject is the property of the subject.

original: nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that it is a designation.

original: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that it is pointless,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol po'i the tshom gyi bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol po'i the tshom gyi bsam pa yin no //
translated: this is the opponent's doubt.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed de dgos pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed de dgos pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: The response to this is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúNo, because . . . ‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the property of the subject is refuted.

original: nye bar gdags pa ni zhes bya ba zhig khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa ni zhes bya ba zhig khong nas drang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe property of the subject‚Äù is supplied from the earlier discussion.

original: nye bar gdags pa bor na ni chos can gyi chos zhes bstan par bya ba yin no //üîΩde lta na ni sgra ni mi rtag pa yin te /üîΩmig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang dpe'i chos can gyi chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa bor na ni chos can gyi chos zhes bstan par bya ba yin no // de lta na ni sgra ni mi rtag pa yin te / mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang dpe'i chos can gyi chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the property of the subject is rejected, then the property of the subject is taught.

original: gtan tshigs nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the argument ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is perceptible by the eye‚Äù would be a valid proof, because the property of the subject is a property of the example.

original: nye bar btags na ni chos can thams cad kyi chos yin pa bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar btags na ni chos can thams cad kyi chos yin pa bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the property of the subject is supplied, then the property of all subjects is refuted.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is this so?‚Äù

original: de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúBecause it is a part of that . . . ‚Äù

original: 'di ltar spyi yan lag dag la nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu ni de'i phyogs gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi yan lag dag la nye bar 'dogs pa'i rgyu ni de'i phyogs gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause of the designation of the universal in the parts is their one-sidedness.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad la nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yang de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad la nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yang de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were not so, it would be designated in everything.üîΩAnd the subject of the proposition is one-sided,üîΩso it is proper to designate it as one-sided.

original: phyogs kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyogs su nye bar gdags su rung ba yin te /üîΩde'i chos gang yin pa de yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyogs su nye bar gdags su rung ba yin te / de'i chos gang yin pa de yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the one-sidedness of the subject of the proposition,

original: nye bar gdags pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa byed pa yin no //
translated: the designation is made in order to understand that it is the property of that.üîΩIf it were so,

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs na'o //
translated: if one understands that the subject of the proposition is proper for designation,

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos par bya ba nyid yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos par bya ba nyid yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: then the statement ‚Äúbecause it is apprehended by the eye‚Äù and so on is abandoned. The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes ‚Äúbecause it is the object of the eye‚Äù and so on.

original: chos zhes brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba @7a * //
analyzed: chos zhes brjod pas kyang zhes bya ba @7a * //
translated: Also, by the expression ‚Äúthe property,‚Äù etc.,

original: la sogs pas ni chos de'i chos khyab pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod pas kyang 'brel ba can gyi sgra yin pa'i phyir /üîΩchos can yin par gzhi ste yin par yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: la sogs pas ni chos de'i chos khyab pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod pas kyang 'brel ba can gyi sgra yin pa'i phyir / chos can yin par gzhi ste yin par yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: since the expression ‚Äúthe property of the property‚Äù is used, the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is related to the word ‚Äúproperty.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù and is taken as the property-possessor.

original: de ltar grub ste chos can gyi chos zhes chos can smos pa de'i shugs kyis 'dir nye bar bya bar brjod par 'dod do zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: de ltar grub ste chos can gyi chos zhes chos can smos pa de'i shugs kyis 'dir nye bar bya bar brjod par 'dod do zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Thus, it is established that the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù and is taken as the property-possessor.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is meaningless.

original: khyab pa yin par brjod par 'dod na ni chos can zhes smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyab pa yin par brjod par 'dod na ni chos can zhes smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.üîΩIf the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the basis for the word ‚Äúproperty,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is meaningless.

original: gal te chos can zhes ma smos na /üîΩde'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra gang zhig dang sbyar zhe na /üîΩchos zhes smos pas 'phangs pa'i chos can tsam gang yin pa de dang ngo //
analyzed: gal te chos can zhes ma smos na /üîΩde'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra gang zhig dang sbyar zhe na /üîΩchos zhes smos pas 'phangs pa'i chos can tsam gang yin pa de dang ngo //
translated: If the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù is taken as the

original: de lta bas na chos can zhes smos pa'i shugs kyis nye ba yin par sgrub pa gang yin pa'i nye ba yin pa de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos can zhes smos pa'i shugs kyis nye ba yin par sgrub pa gang yin pa'i nye ba yin pa de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since the subject is mentioned, it is established that it is the subject of the proof. Therefore, it is taken to be the subject of the proposition.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir nye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir nye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is the context of the probandum, it is the subject.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te dpe'i chos can yang sgrub pa nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te dpe'i chos can yang sgrub pa nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the example-subject is also the subject because it is the context of the proof.

original: de'i phyir the tshom yod pas gcig kho nar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom yod pas gcig kho nar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is doubt, it is not taken to be the subject of the proposition alone.

original: de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
analyzed: de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
translated: He answers, ‚ÄúBecause it is pervaded by the property of the subject,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni //
analyzed: phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni //
translated: The property of the subject is pervaded by it.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis de'i chas khyab par bshad pa gang yin pa des dpe'i chos can la yod pa grub ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis de'i chas khyab par bshad pa gang yin pa des dpe'i chos can la yod pa grub ste /
translated: This explains that the example-subject is established as pervaded by it.

original: dpe'i chos can la gtan tshigs med pa ni de'i chas khyab par mi srid do//
analyzed: dpe'i chos can la gtan tshigs med pa ni de'i chas khyab par mi srid do//
translated: The reason does not exist in the example subject, because it is impossible for it to pervade it.

original: de lta bas na chos can zhes smos pa ni dpe'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ma yin te don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos can zhes smos pa ni dpe'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ma yin te don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is not intended to refer to the example subject, because that would be meaningless.

original: 'on kyang chos can zhes smos pa'i shugs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos can zhes smos pa'i shugs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: However, the statement ‚Äúsubject‚Äù implicitly refers to the probandum subject.

original: grub bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /üîΩde'i chas khyab pa zhes bya bas dpe'i chos can la yod par grub mod kyi /
analyzed: grub bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te / de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya bas dpe'i chos can la yod par grub mod kyi /
translated: The response to that is stated in the line ‚Äúeven though it is established,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe line ‚Äúpervasiveness by its factor‚Äù means that the reason is established as existing in the example subject.

original: 'on kyang grub bzhin du de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya bas dpe'i chos can la yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos gang yin pa gal te dpe'i chos can kho na la yod pa yin na yin no zhes @7b brnan ba'i phyir yang smos pa yinüîΩpar dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang grub bzhin du de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya bas dpe'i chos can la yod par grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos gang yin pa gal te dpe'i chos can kho na la yod pa yin na yin no zhes @7b brnan ba'i phyir yang smos pa yinüîΩpar dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the statement ‚Äúeven though it is established‚Äù is made because there is a concern that one might think that the reason is established as existing in the example subject by the pervasiveness by its factor, and that the statement ‚Äúit exists‚Äù is made to emphasize that the reason is established as existing in the example subject alone.

original: yang ci rtogs pa'i bstan bcos la la las grub bzhin du brnan pa'i phyir yang smos pa lta mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci rtogs pa'i bstan bcos la la las grub bzhin du brnan pa'i phyir yang smos pa lta mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: Again, is it said in some treatises on logic that it is said in order to prove that which is already established?

original: mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúOnly in that which is similar,‚Äù and so on.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i mtshan nyid ni phyogs kyi chos gang zhig mthun pa la yod la de med pa la med pa de ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i mtshan nyid ni phyogs kyi chos gang zhig mthun pa la yod la de med pa la med pa de ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The definition of Master Dignaga is: ‚ÄúThat property of the subject which exists in the similar instance and does not exist in the dissimilar instance is the logical reason.‚Äù

original: de la ni mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes bya ba'i nges par gzung ba 'di kho nas gtan tshigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa grub mod kyi /
analyzed: de la ni mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes bya ba'i nges par gzung ba 'di kho nas gtan tshigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa grub mod kyi /
translated: In that, it is established that the logical reason is the opposite of the dissimilar instance by this very restriction, ‚ÄúOnly in that which is similar.‚ÄùüîΩBut the statement, ‚ÄúIt does not exist in the absence of the probandum,‚Äù is said in order to prove that it does not exist in the absence of the probandum.

original: de med pa la med pa zhes bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa smos pa gang yin pa de ni med pa kho na la med pa yin gyi 'gal ba la yang ma yin la de las gzhan pa la yang ma yin no zhes brnan pa'iüîΩphyir yin te /
analyzed: de med pa la med pa zhes bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa smos pa gang yin pa de ni med pa kho na la med pa yin gyi 'gal ba la yang ma yin la de las gzhan pa la yang ma yin no zhes brnan pa'iüîΩphyir yin te /
translated: That is, it is said in order to prove that it does not exist in the absence of the probandum, but it does not exist in the contradictory and it does not exist in that which is other than that.

original: de lta bas na brnan pa yin par dogs pa bstsal ba'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na brnan pa yin par dogs pa bstsal ba'i phyir nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the doubt that it is a superimposition, it is a designation.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can ni gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can ni gtso bo yin te /
translated: The subject of the probandum is primary,

original: de ni thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be established by the means.

original: dpe'i chos can ni thabs yin pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can ni thabs yin pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: The example subject is not primary, because it is the means.

original: phal pa dang gtso bo nye na gtso bo bya ba yin par shes pas shes bya'i shugs 'di dang de bzhin du bya ba dang / nges pa yod na bya ba kho na gtso bo yin par bya zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na yin par yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phal pa dang gtso bo nye na gtso bo bya ba yin par shes pas shes bya'i shugs 'di dang de bzhin du bya ba dang / nges pa yod na bya ba kho na gtso bo yin par bya zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na yin par yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir shugs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When the ordinary and the primary are near, the primary is understood to be the object of action. By the force of the object of knowledge, and likewise by the force of the object of action, and when there is certainty, only the object of action is to be taken as primary. By the force of this, the subject of the probandum alone is to be taken as the subject. Therefore, he says, by the force, etc.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i shugs rnam pa gnyis kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don go zhing khong du chud pa yin na rtogs par dka' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i shugs rnam pa gnyis kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don go zhing khong du chud pa yin na rtogs par dka' bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the meaning of the definition is understood and comprehended by the two kinds of implication just explained, then it would be difficult to understand.

original: sgra med pa'i don la bdag nyid kyis rjes su 'brang ba ni rtogs par dka'o //
analyzed: sgra med pa'i don la bdag nyid kyis rjes su 'brang ba ni rtogs par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand the meaning of a word that is not directly stated.

original: de bas na rtogs par dka' ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang phyogs zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rtogs par dka' ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang phyogs zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúposition‚Äù is also mentioned in order to avoid the difficulty of understanding.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used to include what has already been explained, in order to avoid the doubt that implication is not accepted, and to include what has already been explained, such as ‚Äúbecause it is perceived by the eye,‚Äù in order to avoid that.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shugs khas mi len na sngar bshad pa lta bu brnan par bya ba yin par dogs pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang zhes bshad zin pa bsdu bar bya ba yin no //üîΩyang ni @8a * //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shugs khas mi len na sngar bshad pa lta bu brnan par bya ba yin par dogs pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang zhes bshad zin pa bsdu bar bya ba yin no // yang ni @8a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù is used to include what has already been explained.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ma bshad pa bsdu ba'i don yin te /
