analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ma bshad pa bsdu ba'i don yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of inclusion, even though it is not explained.

original: gal te pha rol po nye bar gdags pa yang mi bya la chos can zhes smos par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po nye bar gdags pa yang mi bya la chos can zhes smos par yang mi bya'o //
translated: If you do not even impute the opponent, then you should not even mention the subject.

original: 'o na ci zhe na shes par 'dod pa'i chos can gyi chos zhes brjod par bya'o zhes smra bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na shes par 'dod pa'i chos can gyi chos zhes brjod par bya'o zhes smra bar 'gyur na /
translated: If you say that you should say ‚Äúthe property of the subject that is desired to be known,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang gzhung mangs pa dang tshig le'ur byas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhung mangs pa dang tshig le'ur byas pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: then the text would be too long and the meter would be violated.

original: de lta bas na phyogs gzhan la 'chel na gzhung mangs pa dang tshig le'ur byas pa nyams par 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang zhes ma bshad pa bsdu bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phyogs gzhan la 'chel na gzhung mangs pa dang tshig le'ur byas pa nyams par 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang zhes ma bshad pa bsdu bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to avoid the fault of the text being too long and the meter being violated, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used to include what is not stated.üîΩIf it is the property of the subject,

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs zhes bya ba khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs zhes bya ba khong nas drang ngo //
translated: the word ‚Äúreason‚Äù is implied.

original: 'di ltar re zhig 'di la phyogs kyi chos yod par zhes bya bar 'bru mang po pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig 'di la phyogs kyi chos yod par zhes bya bar 'bru mang po pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù does not mean that the property of the subject exists in this case.

original: chos can zhes bya ba phyogs dang chos zhes bya bar gzhi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ba phyogs dang chos zhes bya bar gzhi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no common locus between the subject and the property.

original: de nyid kyi phyir las kyi gzhi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir las kyi gzhi yang ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is also not the basis of the thesis.

original: phyogs dang chos zhes bya bar zlas dbye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang chos zhes bya bar zlas dbye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a compound of the subject and the property,

original: phan tshun ldan pa yin na ni gnyis kyi tshig yin pa dang / gcig tu bsdu ba yin na ni ma ning nyid yin par thal bar yang 'gyur la phyogs dang chos de la de'i chas khyab pa yang med do //
analyzed: phan tshun ldan pa yin na ni gnyis kyi tshig yin pa dang / gcig tu bsdu ba yin na ni ma ning nyid yin par thal bar yang 'gyur la phyogs dang chos de la de'i chas khyab pa yang med do //
translated: because if they were mutually related, it would follow that it would be a compound of two words, and if it were a combination of the two, it would follow that it would be neuter.

original: de lta bas na phyogs chos zhes bya ba ni drug par tshig bsdu ba yin la de la yang phyogs kho na'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na phyogs chos zhes bya ba ni drug par tshig bsdu ba yin la de la yang phyogs kho na'i chos yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the compound ‚Äúproperty of the subject‚Äù is a genitive tatpurusa compound, and the property is only of the subject.

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin na zhes phyogs kyi chos khyad par du byed pa yin na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin na zhes phyogs kyi chos khyad par du byed pa yin na //
translated: It is not of another, so the property of the subject is distinguished.

original: de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas phyogs de'i khyad par la ltos pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas phyogs de'i khyad par la ltos pa yin pas /
translated: Therefore, as explained, it depends on the distinction of the subject.

original: de'i khyad par la ltos pa ste de gzhan dpe'i chos can la mi 'jug pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par la ltos pa ste de gzhan dpe'i chos can la mi 'jug pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is ‚Äúuncommon‚Äù because it does not apply to the example subject.

original: mi ldan pa ni ma 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni ma 'brel pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Non-possession‚Äù is non-connection.

original: de rnam par bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par bcas pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúexcluded‚Äù by that.

original: des khyad par du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des khyad par du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is distinguished by that,

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: it is not uncommon.

original: phyogs kyi chos kho na zhes de skad du khyad par du byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgang la chos chos can dang 'brel par the tshom za ba de la ni gang gi tshe chos yod par sgrub pa de'i tshe mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos kho na zhes de skad du khyad par du byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang la chos chos can dang 'brel par the tshom za ba de la ni gang gi tshe chos yod par sgrub pa de'i tshe mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly the property of the subject‚Äù is distinguished in that way. That is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is distinguished.‚ÄùüîΩWhen there is doubt about whether the property is connected to the subject, then when the existence of the property is established, non-possession is excluded.

original: gang gi tshe chos can dang 'brel pa grub la chos can gzhan la yod par dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir chos sbyor ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos can dang 'brel pa grub la chos can gzhan la yod par dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir chos sbyor ba de'i tshe na /
translated: When the connection to the subject is established, and in order to eliminate the doubt that it exists elsewhere, the property is applied.

original: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin no//
analyzed: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin no//
translated: Then possession of another is excluded.

original: @8b phyogs kyi chos kyi dpe'i rnam pa dang po dper na nag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te nag pa 'phong skyen pa nyid yin par the tshom za ste /
analyzed: @8b phyogs kyi chos kyi dpe'i rnam pa dang po dper na nag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te nag pa 'phong skyen pa nyid yin par the tshom za ste /
translated: The first type of example of a property of the subject is illustrated by the passage beginning ‚ÄúFor example, when it is said ‚ÄòNƒ´laka·πá·π≠ha.‚Äô‚ÄùüîΩSince there is doubt about whether Nƒ´laka·πá·π≠ha is an archer,

original: de'i phyir 'di 'phong skyen pa kho na yin no zhes mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'phong skyen pa kho na yin no zhes mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pa yin no //
translated: the statement ‚ÄúHe is an archer alone‚Äù excludes his not being an archer.

original: nges par gzung ba gang la nyes pa yod pa de bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba gang la nyes pa yod pa de bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the fault in that which is ascertained,

original: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIt is not by the exclusion of what is possessed by another.‚Äù

original: khyad par du byas pa'i phyir zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyad par du byas pa'i phyir zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the specification‚Äù is supplied from the context.

original: chos can gzhan dang ldan pa ste /üîΩde rnam par bcad pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos can gzhan dang ldan pa ste / de rnam par bcad pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is possessed by another‚Äù is a property of the subject.üîΩThe meaning is that because of the specification by the exclusion of that,

original: 'di'i dpe yang dper na srid sgrub ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dpe yang dper na srid sgrub ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: the example of this is illustrated by the passage beginning ‚ÄúFor example, when it is said ‚Äò≈öikha·πá·∏çin.‚Äô‚Äù

original: srid sgrub ni 'phong skyen pa nyid yin par grub pa kho na yin la ci de 'dra ba gzhan la yod dam zhes bsam pa de la srid sgrub kho na 'phong skyen pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa
analyzed: srid sgrub ni 'phong skyen pa nyid yin par grub pa kho na yin la ci de 'dra ba gzhan la yod dam zhes bsam pa de la srid sgrub kho na 'phong skyen pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pa
translated: The exclusion of others is: ‚ÄúOnly Arjuna is the best archer, not anyone else.‚ÄùüîΩIt will be explained.

original: yin no // bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni le'u bzhi ba las bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: yin no // bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni le'u bzhi ba las bstan par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit will be explained‚Äù means it will be taught in chapter 4.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthat part of it‚Äù means the property of that.

original: de'i cha ni de'i chos yin gyi zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos kyi ched yin pas gtso bor gyur pa ma yin yang phyogs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i cha ni de'i chos yin gyi zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos kyi ched yin pas gtso bor gyur pa ma yin yang phyogs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is for the sake of the property, and although it is not primary, it is connected to the position.

original: phyogs de'i cha ni de'i cha ste de kho na'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: phyogs de'i cha ni de'i cha ste de kho na'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin no //
translated: That part of that position is a part of it. It is only the property to be proven.

original: gal te cha zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs gcig la bya bar grags na ji ltar chos ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te cha zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs gcig la bya bar grags na ji ltar chos ston par byed ce na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúpart‚Äù is known to refer to one part, how does it teach the property?

original: smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the power of the speaker‚Äôs intention‚Äù is stated.

original: sgra rnams rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa ni dngos po'i stobs kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams rjod par byed pa nyid yin pa ni dngos po'i stobs kyis ma yin no //
translated: The fact that sounds express meaning does not occur by the power of things.

original: 'on kyang smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis te de'i cha zhes bya ba de'i phyogs gcig ni ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis te de'i cha zhes bya ba de'i phyogs gcig ni ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: However, it is due to the power of the speaker's desire to express, and the part is not a portion of that. The term that is connected to the context.

original: yang gal te ci ste de lta yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te ci ste de lta yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, Why is that?

original: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra spyi la mi bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra spyi la mi bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, Because the term 'part' is not used for universals.

original: gal te phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra spyi la bya ba yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra spyi la bya ba yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If the term 'part' were used for universals,

original: de'i tshe cha chos dang chos can gyi spyi'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs gcig chos kyi bdag nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe cha chos dang chos can gyi spyi'i bdag nyid kyi phyogs gcig chos kyi bdag nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: then at that time, the part of the universal, which has the nature of the general property and the subject, would be the nature of the property.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra nye bar btags pa ni chos can kho na la bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra nye bar btags pa ni chos can kho na la bya ba yin pas /
translated: Since the term 'part' is applied only to the subject,

original: bdag nyid gcig pa de la phyogs gcig ga la yod /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pa de la phyogs gcig ga la yod /
translated: how can there be a part of that which is a single nature?

original: khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The word ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù is indicated by the words ‚Äúthat which is the pervader‚Äù and so on.

original: de ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos yin @9a * //
analyzed: de ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos yin @9a * //
translated: That is, it is the property of the pervader and the property of the pervaded.

original: pa nyid kyis gnyi ga la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid kyis gnyi ga la yod pa yin no //
translated: It exists in both.

original: de la khyab par byed pa'i chos nyid yin par brjod par 'dod pa ni khyab pa khyab par bya ba gtan tshigs de la khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa'i chos nyid yin par brjod par 'dod pa ni khyab pa khyab par bya ba gtan tshigs de la khyab par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: With regard to that, the property of the pervader is what is asserted to be the pervader. The pervasion is that the reason exists only where the property to be established exists.

original: mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pas nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pas nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: It is ascertained by the exclusion of non-possession.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir de la khyab par byed pa kho na yod pa yin no zhes nges par gzung bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir de la khyab par byed pa kho na yod pa yin no zhes nges par gzung bar ni mi nus so //
translated: Because it is impossible, it is not possible to ascertain that the pervader exists there alone.

original: gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gcig pu kho na yod pa de lta bu'i phyogs kyi chos ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gcig pu kho na yod pa de lta bu'i phyogs kyi chos ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no property of the subject that is like that, where the property to be established exists alone.

original: de kho na la khyab par byed pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba nges par gzung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na la khyab par byed pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba nges par gzung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it ascertained that the pervader exists there alone.

original: de lta na ni mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the mere presence of something in a similar instance would not be a reason.

original: khyab par bya ba bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba kho na la khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba kho na la khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The pervader, impermanence, is not present only in what is produced immediately after the pervaded property.

original: bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin pa glog la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin pa glog la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is also present in lightning, etc., which are not produced immediately after.

original: gang gi tshe khyab par bya ba'i chos nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni khyab pa yang na de kho na la khyad par bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyab par bya ba'i chos nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni khyab pa yang na de kho na la khyad par bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: When it is the property of the pervader, then the pervasion is either present only in that or there is a distinction.

original: de kho na la zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa kho na la ste /
analyzed: de kho na la zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa kho na la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOnly in that‚Äù means only in the pervader.

original: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pas nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pas nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: It is ascertained by the exclusion of possession of something else.

original: 'dir yang mi srid pa'i phyir de la khyab par bya ba kho na la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni nges par mi gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang mi srid pa'i phyir de la khyab par bya ba kho na la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni nges par mi gzung ste /
translated: Here, because it is impossible, it is not ascertained in that way, that ‚Äúit is present only in what is pervaded.‚Äù

original: thams cad chos du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs chos gcig kho na dang ldan pa ni med do //
analyzed: thams cad chos du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs chos gcig kho na dang ldan pa ni med do //
translated: Because all things possess many properties, there is no reason that possesses the property to be established and possesses only one property.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas de la khyab pa bya ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas de la khyab pa bya ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it might be the case that the reason exists in only one similar instance, it is not definite that it must pervade that instance.

original: bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid mi rtag pa la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bstsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid mi rtag pa la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere fact of being produced does not necessarily exist in the impermanent,

original: glog la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glog la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in lightning and so on.

original: phyogs chos zhes tshul gcig brjod nas /
analyzed: phyogs chos zhes tshul gcig brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the first mode, the property of the subject,

original: de'i chas khyab ces bya ba tshul gnyis pa bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i chas khyab ces bya ba tshul gnyis pa bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt the second mode, pervasion by that part, explained?

original: de'i phyir rtags ni tshul gnyis pa kho na yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags ni tshul gnyis pa kho na yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore the reason would be only the second mode.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to that, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúTherefore, by this . . .‚Äù

original: 'dis zhes @9b bya ba ni phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes @9b bya ba ni phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the words ‚Äúthe property of the subject and the pervasion by that.‚Äù

original: de la khyab pa zhes smos pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag bshad de khyab pa ni de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la khyab pa zhes smos pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag bshad de khyab pa ni de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù in the above passage explains the positive and negative concomitances, because that is what pervasion is.

original: de gnyis nges pa dag kyang shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ci lta ba'i chad mas bshad la /
analyzed: de gnyis nges pa dag kyang shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ci lta ba'i chad mas bshad la /
translated: The certainty of those two is explained by the phrase ‚Äúthe property of the subject‚Äù because this is the context of a proof statement.

original: phyogs kyi chos nges pa yang phyogs chos zhes smos pa kho nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nges pa yang phyogs chos zhes smos pa kho nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The certainty of the property of the subject is explained by the phrase ‚Äúthe property of the subject‚Äù itself.

original: de ltar na rtags ni tshul gsum pa kho nar bshad pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rtags ni tshul gsum pa kho nar bshad pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, since the reason is explained as having only three modes, there is no contradiction.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang gis sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang gis sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAs it is‚Äù refers to the valid knowledge that establishes the reason.

original: de yang 'og nas bye brag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩde dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de yang 'og nas bye brag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩde dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: This will be explained in detail below.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthose two‚Äù refers to the property of the subject and the pervasion.

original: de ni rnam gsum ste zhes bya ba de ston te /
analyzed: de ni rnam gsum ste zhes bya ba de ston te /
translated: The phrase it is of three types indicates that.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid dang / ji skad bshad pa'i khyab pa dang ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid dang / ji skad bshad pa'i khyab pa dang ldan pa dag go //
translated: The phrase those refers to the property of the subject and the pervasion as they have been explained.

original: 'di la 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i ngo bo nyid yod pas na de dag la de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i ngo bo nyid yod pas na de dag la de skad ces bshad do //
translated: The phrase because it has the nature of those indicates that the reason has the nature of the effect, nature, and nonapprehension.

original: du ba las zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: du ba las zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: The phrase from smoke indicates the reason that is an effect.

original: 'di na me yod do zhes bya bas ni bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: 'di na me yod do zhes bya bas ni bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: The phrase here there is fire indicates the effect that is being proven.

original: 'di phyogs kyi sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di phyogs kyi sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the application of the property of the subject.

original: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bstan te /
analyzed: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bstan te /
translated: The phrase because it is a sƒÅl tree indicates the reason that is a nature.

original: shing sha pa ni shing gi khyad par kho na zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing sha pa ni shing gi khyad par kho na zhig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A sƒÅl tree is a particular kind of tree.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase the property of the subject and so on indicates nonapprehension.

original: phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe difference in location‚Äù means the characteristic of the object.

original: 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang bral ba na'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig na zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang bral ba na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some place‚Äù means in a place devoid of a pot.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis ni dgag pa mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis ni dgag pa mi 'grub pas /
translated: Since a negation is not established by mere non-apprehension,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya bas gtan tshigs khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes bya bas gtan tshigs khyad par du byed de /
translated: the reason is specified by ‚Äúhaving the characteristic of apprehension.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan mig la sogs ni nus pa thogs pa med pa dag ni /üîΩdmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan mig la sogs ni nus pa thogs pa med pa dag ni / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The cause of apprehension is the eye, etc., which are unimpeded in their capacity.üîΩThey have the characteristic of apprehension.

original: de dag gir gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gir gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ste /
translated: Having that is having the characteristic of apprehension.

original: rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang snang ba'i shes pa bskyed par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: It is the special nature of the consciousness that appears to it.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not apprehended.

original: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni de med par 'khrul pa med do zhes ldog pas bstan pa'i phyir gal te yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @10a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni de med par 'khrul pa med do zhes ldog pas bstan pa'i phyir gal te yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @10a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate by the negative statement that such non-apprehension is infallible with regard to non-existence, he says, ‚ÄúIf it exists,‚Äù etc.

original: smos te / gal te bum pa dang bral ba'i phyogs na yang ji skad bshad pa'i bum pa yod na ni de'i tshe dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te gzung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smos te / gal te bum pa dang bral ba'i phyogs na yang ji skad bshad pa'i bum pa yod na ni de'i tshe dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te gzung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the vase existed in the place devoid of vase, as it has been explained, then it would be perceived, it would be apprehended.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam yang gzung ba ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam yang gzung ba ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not otherwise, that is, it is never not apprehended.

original: de lta bus ni gdon mi za bar shes pa 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bus ni gdon mi za bar shes pa 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By this, it is said, there is no doubt that consciousness is non-erroneous.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes khyad par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni shugs kyis na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i yod pa can zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa zhes khyad par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni shugs kyis na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i yod pa can zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since that is so, the reason for the explanation of the qualification ‚Äúin the nature of perception‚Äù is that it is implicitly explained as ‚Äúhaving existence in the nature of perception.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni tshig gi don 'di yin te /üîΩ'dis ni mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid de dmigs pa nyid mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni tshig gi don 'di yin te / 'dis ni mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid de dmigs pa nyid mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Here is the meaning of the words.üîΩSince this indicates, it is a mark. Perception itself is a mark.

original: de yir gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de yir gyur pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is in the nature of that is in the nature of perception.

original: shes pa dang 'brel pa 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa dang 'brel pa 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout error in relation to consciousness‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout error in relation to cognition.‚Äù

original: gang la de lta bu'i yod pa yod pa de ni de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la de lta bu'i yod pa yod pa de ni de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has such existence is said to be ‚Äúthat which exists in that way.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i yod pa can ni shes pa log na gdon mi za bar ldog go zhes bya bar bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yod pa can ni shes pa log na gdon mi za bar ldog go zhes bya bar bsam pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that if cognition is reversed, then that which exists in that way is necessarily reversed.

original: yod pa dang dgag pa dag gis ni bsgrub par bya ba thams cad la khyab la /
analyzed: yod pa dang dgag pa dag gis ni bsgrub par bya ba thams cad la khyab la /
translated: Existence and nonexistence pervade all that is to be proven.

original: de gnyis kyang gtan tshigs gsum la rag las pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang gtan tshigs gsum la rag las pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And those two are dependent on the three types of logical reason.

original: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúFrom among those . . . ‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gsum po de las rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum po de las rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa ste /
translated: From among those three types of logical reason, the two‚Äîthe logical reason of nature and the logical reason of effect‚Äîare proofs of an existent thing.

original: dngos po sgrub pa ni yod pa sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po sgrub pa ni yod pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: A proof of an existent thing is a proof of an existent.

original: gnyis kho na zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po sgrub pa kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kho na zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i dngos po sgrub pa kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly two‚Äù should not be taken as definite, as if to say that only two are proofs of an existent thing.

original: 'di gnyis kyis dgag ba yang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis dgag ba yang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these two establish the negation.üîΩOne is a reason for negation,

original: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs ba ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kho na yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs ba ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs kho na yin no //
translated: the one that has the previously explained characteristic is a reason for negation.

original: gcig kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: One is not ascertained as only one,

original: snga ma gnyis kyis kyang rnam par bcad pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis kyis kyang rnam par bcad pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other two also realize the exclusion.

original: yang ci ste dngos po sgrub pa gnyis kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ste dngos po sgrub pa gnyis kho na yin zhe na /
translated: But why are there only two that establish entities?

original: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe connection with the nature, etc.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang 'brel pa ni de la rag las pa nyid de de yod na'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang 'brel pa ni de la rag las pa nyid de de yod na'o //
translated: The connection with the entity that is to be established as the nature is the dependence on that, because it exists if that exists.

original: don gyis zhes bya ba ni rtags kyis so //
analyzed: don gyis zhes bya ba ni rtags kyis so //
translated: By the word ‚Äúmeaning‚Äù he means the reason.

original: don @10b zhes bya ba ni rtags can te /
analyzed: don @10b zhes bya ba ni rtags can te /
translated: The word ‚Äúentity‚Äù means the property-possessor.

original: 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med do //
translated: There is no error.

original: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa de yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa de yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho na ste /
translated: Moreover, the relation of intrinsic nature is characterized as identity and origination,

original: gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no third relation.

original: de la dang po de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la dang po de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: With regard to that, the first is stated: because it is the intrinsic nature of that.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the relation of intrinsic nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the intrinsic nature of that‚Äù means because it is the intrinsic nature of the probandum.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sgrub pa yin pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i bye brag med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid sgrub pa yin pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i bye brag med do zhe na /
translated: If it is the intrinsic nature of that, then if the proof is the intrinsic nature of the probandum, then whatever is the probandum is the proof. Therefore, there is no distinction between the probandum and the proof.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par gyur pa'i chos kyi bye brag rnams ni ldog pa'i bye brag gis kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par gyur pa'i chos kyi bye brag rnams ni ldog pa'i bye brag gis kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the distinctions of the properties of the probandum and the proof are imagined by the distinction of the negation.

original: 'di ni gzhan sel ba'i skabs su bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan sel ba'i skabs su bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained in the chapter on the exclusion of other.

original: 'di ni slob dpon gyis kyang bshad do zhes bya bar de skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon gyis kyang bshad do zhes bya bar de skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] also explained this, so it is said, etc.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa me dang du ba dag gi bye brag dngos po las gyur pa yod pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni gang la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa me dang du ba dag gi bye brag dngos po las gyur pa yod pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Everything means that even though there is a difference between the thing to be established and the means of establishment, such as fire and smoke, there is no designation by way of their own characteristics.

original: blo la yod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'o //
analyzed: blo la yod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'o //
translated: Existing in the mind means appearing to the conceptual mind.

original: gal te blos brtags pas rjes su dpag pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te blos brtags pas rjes su dpag pa yin na /
translated: If it is an inference because it is investigated by the mind,

original: 'o na ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: then the characteristics of a reason are not being of the nature of that [property to be proven] and arising from that,

original: blos brtags na de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: blos brtags na de gnyis med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because those two do not exist when investigated by the mind.

original: chos can dang chos nyid du tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: chos can dang chos nyid du tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The different things that are the property possessor and the property, etc.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being explained.

original: don kho nas don go bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don kho nas don go bar 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning is understood only through the meaning,

original: 'di ni blo'i rnam par byas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni blo'i rnam par byas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and this is not created by the mind.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don de lta bu yod bzhin du rmongs pa la bstan pa'i thabs su gyur pa chos can dang chos nyid tha dad pa gang yin pa de blo'i rnam pas byas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don de lta bu yod bzhin du rmongs pa la bstan pa'i thabs su gyur pa chos can dang chos nyid tha dad pa gang yin pa de blo'i rnam pas byas te /
translated: However, when there is such an external object, the means of teaching the ignorant is created by the mind, which is the distinction between the subject and the object.

original: de ma byas par ni gzhan la bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ma byas par ni gzhan la bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Without that, it is not possible to teach others.

original: don kyang blo'i rnam pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don kyang blo'i rnam pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And the meaning is not created by the mind,

original: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by its own nature.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtags kho nas don rtogs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtags kho nas don rtogs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the meaning is not understood only through the sign that is the basis for conceptual thought?

original: blo'i bye brag ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pa nyid @11a * //
analyzed: blo'i bye brag ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'dod pa tsam dang 'brel pa nyid @11a * //
translated: The so-called distinction of the mind is merely related to the mere desire for conceptual differentiation.

original: kyis rang dga' ba rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kyis rang dga' ba rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The independent ones are not the basis for the meaning,

original: don dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not related to the meaning.

original: 'di ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag gis brtags pa yang yin la yul yang yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag gis brtags pa yang yin la yul yang yin pas /
translated: This is the object of those conceptual thoughts that are not the basis of the object.

original: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul lo //
translated: Therefore, it is the object of those conceptual thoughts.

original: gtan tshigs de lta bu des ni don mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de lta bu des ni don mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: By that reason, the object is not obtained at all.

original: don 'thob pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don 'thob pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The object is not obtained at all.

original: gnyis pa'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The second characteristic of the relation is stated with ‚Äúthe effect, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is the nature of the effect.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from that, it arises from the cause.

original: gang zhig rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin par mi 'dod pa de la 'di gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid yin par mi 'dod pa de la 'di gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For one who does not accept inference as valid knowledge, it is stated with ‚Äúthese two, etc.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di nyid ni tshad ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di nyid ni tshad ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This knowledge of what is to be inferred is valid knowledge.

original: 'di gnyis zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rtags las skyes pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin rtags las skyes pa dag ste /
translated: These two are the nature of the inferential mark and the nature of the result that arises from the mark.

original: mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir gnyis zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir gnyis zhes bshad do //
translated: Non-apprehension is included within the nature of the reason, so it is explained as two.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i rang bzhin dang rgyu dag shes pa yin pas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i rang bzhin dang rgyu dag shes pa yin pas /
translated: It is the knowledge of the nature of the object to be inferred and the cause.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the knowledge of the object to be inferred.

original: de snang ba nyid ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin yang ngo //
analyzed: de snang ba nyid ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin yang ngo //
translated: Even though it does not appear as that, meaning even though it does not appear as the nature of the object to be inferred,

original: de mi snang ba nyid ni de dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi snang ba nyid ni de dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it does not appear as that because it does not arise from that.

original: 'o na ji ltar mi 'khrul zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mi 'khrul zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it non-erroneous?

original: de las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it arises from that,‚Äù

original: brgyud de rjes su dpag par bya ba rang bzhin dang rgyu dag las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyud de rjes su dpag par bya ba rang bzhin dang rgyu dag las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the nature and cause of the object to be inferred, indirectly.

original: der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba 'khrul pa med pa dag go //
analyzed: der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba 'khrul pa med pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are non-errone‚Äù means that they are non-errone with regard to the object to be inferred.

original: rgyu des na tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu des na tshad ma yin te /
translated: By that reason, they are valid cognitions.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: It is like direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khyab pa ston te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khyab pa ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe validity of direct perception, etc.‚Äù indicates the pervasion.

original: don med na med pa nyid yin pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni don 'khrul pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: don med na med pa nyid yin pas mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni don 'khrul pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: If the object does not exist, it does not exist. Therefore, direct perception is non-errone with regard to the object.

original: de lta ma yin na de med par te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de med par te /
translated: If it were not so, it would arise without the object.

original: don med par mngon sum 'byung ba ni der 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don med par mngon sum 'byung ba ni der 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
translated: Direct perception would arise without the object because it would be erroneous with regard to the object.

original: don la slu ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan gyis mi 'khrul pa yang de las skye ba las gzhan ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: don la slu ba'i phyir ro // gzhan gyis mi 'khrul pa yang de las skye ba las gzhan ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni /
translated: It would be deceptive with regard to the object.üîΩ‚ÄúWhat else is there other than that which is non-errone with regard to something else arising from that?‚Äù

original: gzhan rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin pa'i rang gzhan dang lhan cig mi @11b 'khrul pa gang yin pa de yang de las skye pa las gzhan ci zhig yod ;
analyzed: gzhan rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin pa'i rang gzhan dang lhan cig mi @11b 'khrul pa gang yin pa de yang de las skye pa las gzhan ci zhig yod ;
translated: What else is there other than that which is non-errone with regard to itself and others, which is not a different nature?

original: med pa kho na ste mi 'khrul ba ni de las skye ba kho nar zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa kho na ste mi 'khrul ba ni de las skye ba kho nar zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is only non-existent, and it is non-erroneous, because it arises from that. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rag ma las shing 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni /
analyzed: rag ma las shing 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni /
translated: Because those that are not related, whose natures are not related,

original: lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: are not ascertained to occur together.

original: mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not ascertained to be non-erroneous.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi ma nor ba ni don las skye ba kho na yin pas tshad ma nyid yin la de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang yod pas gnyi ga mtshungs so snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum gyi ma nor ba ni don las skye ba kho na yin pas tshad ma nyid yin la de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang yod pas gnyi ga mtshungs so snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because non-erroneous perception only arises from an object, it is valid cognition. Since that also exists for inference, both are the same. This is the idea.

original: pha rol pos go ba ste de las skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pha rol pos go ba ste de las skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúBecause it arises from that,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu'i go bar byed pa yin na zhes bya ba khod nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu'i go bar byed pa yin na zhes bya ba khod nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The passage should be read as follows: ‚ÄúBecause it arises from the object to be established, the effect is the comprehender of the cause.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byad par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byad par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that everything would be the comprehender and the comprehended.

original: me'i khyad par gsal ba la sogs pa yang go bar bya ba yin par 'gyur la du ba'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa yang go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i khyad par gsal ba la sogs pa yang go bar bya ba yin par 'gyur la du ba'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa yang go bar byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The particularities of fire, such as being luminous, would be the object of inference, and the substance of smoke, etc., would be the means of inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yod pa'i phyir te /üîΩcha 'ga' zhig gis me skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yod pa'i phyir te / cha 'ga' zhig gis me skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: Because there is production in every way.

original: du ba bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ni med do //
analyzed: du ba bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa ni med do //
translated: There is no fire that does not produce smoke, nor is there smoke that is not produced by fire.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa yod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa yod pa ni ma yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: There is no production in every way.üîΩWhy?

original: de med par te /
analyzed: de med par te /
translated: Because it is not possible that

original: me med par rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: me med par rdzas nyid la sogs pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: the substance, etc., of fire would occur without smoke.

original: 'di ltar rdzas nyid la sogs pa ni du ba ma yin pa gzhan la yang yod pas khyad par med pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa de las me rjes su dpag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas nyid la sogs pa ni du ba ma yin pa gzhan la yang yod pas khyad par med pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa de las me rjes su dpag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the substance, etc., of fire is not different from smoke, the substance, etc., of fire are not the means of inferring fire.

original: de bzhin du de med par te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de med par te /
translated: Similarly, it is not possible thatüîΩthe substance, etc., of smoke would occur without fire.

original: me la yod pa'i gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par de med par du ba tsam 'byung ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: me la yod pa'i gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par de med par du ba tsam 'byung ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no certainty that smoke alone arises from that, without the particularities such as brightness that exist in fire.

original: me la yod pa'i khyad par de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me la yod pa'i khyad par de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty that it arises from those particularities that exist in fire.

original: de lta bas na du ba tsam gyis me'i khyad par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na du ba tsam gyis me'i khyad par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the particularities of fire are not known by smoke alone.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: And because that is so, it is said:

original: rgyu la rang bzhin ji snyed cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu la rang bzhin ji snyed cig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever natures exist in the cause‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu la zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i bdun pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the cause‚Äù is the seventh case.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos kyi rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chos kyi rnam grangs yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúnatures‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúdharmas.‚Äù

original: rgyu la yod pa'i chos @12a * //
analyzed: rgyu la yod pa'i chos @12a * //
translated: Whatever general dharmas exist in the cause,

original: spyir gyur pa ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu du bal sogs pa ni de dag gi go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyir gyur pa ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu du bal sogs pa ni de dag gi go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: if they are not present, the effect, such as smoke, does not occur. They are the reason that causes understanding of those. This is the meaning.

original: khyad par rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by the particularities.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir te /üîΩdu ba ni du ba la khyab par byed pa'i chos de dag kho na'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir te / du ba ni du ba la khyab par byed pa'i chos de dag kho na'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are ascertained as the effects of those.üîΩSmoke is ascertained as the effect of only those phenomena that pervade fire because smoke is an effect in reliance on only those phenomena that are the general properties of fire.

original: du ba ni me la yod pa'i spyi'i chos de dag kho na la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du ba ni me la yod pa'i spyi'i chos de dag kho na la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of the above passage.

original: re zhig de ltar na go bar bya ba ni rgyu la yod pa'i chos spyi dag yin no zhes bshad pa yan no ;üîΩ/ go bar byed pa ni 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos khyad par dag yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar na go bar bya ba ni rgyu la yod pa'i chos spyi dag yin no zhes bshad pa yan no ; / go bar byed pa ni 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos khyad par dag yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus it has been explained that the object that is understood is the general properties that exist in the cause.

original: gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho nas yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho nas yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To indicate that the object that causes understanding is the specific properties that exist in the effect, the text says, ‚Äúonly those that do not occur if those do not exist.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos khyad par du ba nyid la sogs pa gang dag rgyu la yod pa'i spyi'i chos de dag med na ni mi 'byung ba 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos de dag kho nas rgyu la yod pa'i chos rnams kyi gtanüîΩtshigs yin no //üîΩgal te rgyu la yod pa'i spyi'i chos rnams 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos khyad par dag dang / med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos khyad par du ba nyid la sogs pa gang dag rgyu la yod pa'i spyi'i chos de dag med na ni mi 'byung ba 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos de dag kho nas rgyu la yod pa'i chos rnams kyi gtan tshigs yin no // gal te rgyu la yod pa'i spyi'i chos rnams 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos khyad par dag dang / med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The specific attributes of the effect are the evidence for the general attributes of the cause.üîΩIf the general attributes of the cause are the specific attributes of the effect, and if they are the evidence for the effect, then at that time the cause and effect would be the thing that is to be understood and the thing that causes understanding, respectively.

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin na ni de'i tshe cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then the cause and effect would be the thing that is produced and the producer, respectively.

original: me ni spyi'i chos dag kho na skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: me ni spyi'i chos dag kho na skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Fire is the producer of the general attributes alone,

original: du ba ni chos khyad par kho na bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: du ba ni chos khyad par kho na bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and smoke is the thing to be produced that is the specific attributes alone.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gzung na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gzung na ste /
translated: If one grasps the particular that is produced by that,

original: me la yod pa'i khyad par des bskyed par bya ba du ba la yod pa'i khyad par ni des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: me la yod pa'i khyad par des bskyed par bya ba du ba la yod pa'i khyad par ni des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: then the particular that is produced by that particular that exists in fire, which particular exists in the smoke that is produced by that, is the particular that is produced by that.

original: de gzung zhing nges na rgyu la yod pa'i khyad par rnams go bar bya ba nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / rtags kyi bye brag ni du ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de gzung zhing nges na rgyu la yod pa'i khyad par rnams go bar bya ba nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / rtags kyi bye brag ni du ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: If one grasps and ascertains that, then the particulars that exist in the cause are to be understood, because it is maintained that the particulars of the sign are the nature of smoke.

original: rdzas nyid la sogs pa gang dag la khyad par bye brag de yod pa de dag gzung na go bar byed pa nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdzas nyid la sogs pa gang dag la khyad par bye brag de yod pa de dag gzung na go bar byed pa nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is maintained that if one grasps those that have that particular, that is, substantiality, etc., then they are to be understood.

original: du bas khyad par du byas pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa ni me la 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du bas khyad par du byas pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa ni me la 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Substantiality, etc., qualified by smoke, are not mistaken with respect to fire.

original: de la du pa kho na go bar @12b byed pa yin gyi des khyad par du byas pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la du pa kho na go bar @12b byed pa yin gyi des khyad par du byas pa'i rdzas nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In that case, smoke alone is to be understood, not substantiality, etc., qualified by it.

original: dper na byas pa nyid yin na gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na byas pa nyid yin na gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, in the case of ‚Äúbecause of being a product, it is an object of comprehension,‚Äù

original: byas pa nyid kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhal bya nyid ni ma yin pa lta bu zhig ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: byas pa nyid kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhal bya nyid ni ma yin pa lta bu zhig ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: is it not the case that only being a product is the reason, and not being an object of comprehension?

original: de ni bden te mi 'khrul pa tsam zhig rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bden te mi 'khrul pa tsam zhig rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: That is true, but it is said in that way in order to teach mere non-deceptiveness.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du na rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa yod pa'i phyir cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du na rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa yod pa'i phyir cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in another way, since the object of comprehension and the reason exist in every way, the relation of producer and product is not established by parts.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe rtags la yod pa'i spyi'i chos rnams go par byed pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe rtags la yod pa'i spyi'i chos rnams go par byed pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: But when the general properties that exist in the reason are not the object of comprehension, what is the reason?

original: spyi khyad par du ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi khyad par du ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe general property without distinctions,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdzas nyid la sogs pa khyad par du ma byas pa dag brjod par 'dod pa de'i che ni 'khrul pa'i phyir de dag go bar byed pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rdzas nyid la sogs pa khyad par du ma byas pa dag brjod par 'dod pa de'i che ni 'khrul pa'i phyir de dag go bar byed pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: Because they are mistaken with regard to the mere substance, etc., which are not distinguished, they are not accepted as the means of understanding that which is desired to be expressed.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas rang bzhin yong tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas rang bzhin yong tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With regard to the reason of nature, he says, ‚Äúmere existence, etc.,‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúreason‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: gtan tshigs yin zhes bya bar sbyar te bya bar sbyar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin zhes bya bar sbyar te bya bar sbyar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúTo be applied‚Äù means

original: de dag gi gtan tshigs yin zhes bya ba de ltar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gtan tshigs yin zhes bya ba de ltar ro //
translated: ‚Äúto be the reason of those.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi ste /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the probandum

original: ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig gis she na /
translated: ‚ÄúBy what kind?‚Äù

original: yod tsam dang 'brel ba can gyi gtan tshigs yod pa tsam dang 'brel ba can gyi ngo bo ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: yod tsam dang 'brel ba can gyi gtan tshigs yod pa tsam dang 'brel ba can gyi ngo bo ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is the mere existence, the mere relation, the mere nature of the reason.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: It is the reason of nature.

original: tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni don gzhan la mi ltos par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba smos pa ni don gzhan la mi ltos par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù is stated in order to show that it does not depend on another object.

original: ci'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de tsam dang 'brel pa can kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de tsam dang 'brel pa can kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the reason of intrinsic nature related to that alone?

original: de'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it has the nature of that alone,‚Äù and so on.

original: de tsam dang 'brel pa can kho na'i yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi bdag nyid de yin pa de yod na yod pa kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: de tsam dang 'brel pa can kho na'i yin zhes bya ba ni gang gi bdag nyid de yin pa de yod na yod pa kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: ‚Äú Related to that alone‚Äù means that it exists only when that exists,

original: gzhan la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa ni ma yin te /
translated: and it is not dependent on another.

original: rgyu gzhan la rag las shing phyis 'byung ba can gyi ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la rag las shing phyis 'byung ba can gyi ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is dependent on another cause and arises later does not have the nature of that.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, why?

original: de yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it does not exist when that does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyu de yod na yod par ma gyur pa rgyu gzhan la rag las pa'i chos kyi phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni des pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de yod na yod par ma gyur pa rgyu gzhan la rag las pa'i chos kyi phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni des pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not exist when the cause exists, which is dependent on another cause, and which arises later is not that.

original: rgyu gzhan la rag las shing phyis 'byung ba ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la rag las shing phyis 'byung ba ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is dependent on another cause and arises later does not necessarily occur.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrgyu rnams @13a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrgyu rnams @13a * //
translated: If it is asked, why?üîΩHe says, ‚Äúbecause it is not related to that,‚Äù and so on.

original: ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because there is error in regard to the effect.

original: rgyu rnams la ni gags byed par srid pa'i phyir de dag las 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu rnams la ni gags byed par srid pa'i phyir de dag las 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How can it be that an effect definitely arises from those causes, since it is possible that there is an obstruction to the causes?

original: mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to non-apprehension, he says:

original: tshad ma rnams ni mi 'jug pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni mi 'jug pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The valid cognitions do not engage.

original: gang dag mi 'jug pa yin zhe na tshad ma rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag mi 'jug pa yin zhe na tshad ma rnams so //
translated: What is it that does not engage? The valid cognitions.

original: mang po'i tshig smos pa ni gsal ba'i bye brag gi tshad ma rnams mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig smos pa ni gsal ba'i bye brag gi tshad ma rnams mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The plural particle is used because there are many different kinds of valid cognitions.

original: yang na lung la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na lung la ltos pa yin te /
translated: Or else, it refers to scripture,

original: 'di skad du 'og nas kyang lung log pa yang dngos po med pa bsgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'og nas kyang lung log pa yang dngos po med pa bsgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: for later on it says, ‚ÄúA false scripture also does not prove the nonexistence of a thing.‚Äù

original: tshad ma rnams ldeg pa'i mi dmigs pa de nyid med la mi 'jug 'bras bu can te /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ldeg pa'i mi dmigs pa de nyid med la mi 'jug 'bras bu can te /
translated: That very non-apprehension which is the non-engagement of the valid cognitions is the result of the reversal of the valid cognitions.

original: yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i dngos po ni yod par tha snyad gdags pa las med pa'i phyir med pa zhes pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: yul la sogs pas bskal pa'i dngos po ni yod par tha snyad gdags pa las med pa'i phyir med pa zhes pa'o / // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Since the thing that is separated from the object, etc., does not exist apart from the designation existent, it is called nonexistent.

original: mi 'jug 'bras bu can zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i shes ba dang sgra dang tha snyad rnams ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jug 'bras bu can zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i shes ba dang sgra dang tha snyad rnams ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase having the effect of non-engagement means that the engagement of the cognition, word, and convention of existence is the engagement of the cognition, word, and convention of existence.

original: de bkag pa ni mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bkag pa ni mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: The negation of that is non-engagement.

original: gang la 'bras bu de yod pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'bras bu de yod pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has that effect is called having the effect of non-engagement.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir yong pa'i shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir yong pa'i shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, having the effect of negating the cognition, word, and convention of existence.

original: tha snyad ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: Convention is establishment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa de dag ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa de dag ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those cognitions, etc., of existence are preceded by an object.

original: de bas na rgyu med na 'bras bu yang med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu med na 'bras bu yang med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, thinking, If there is no cause, there is no effect, [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] said, having the effect of negating the cognition, word, and convention of existence.

original: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs dgag pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'di ni 'dra ba'i ngo bo yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs dgag pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'di ni 'dra ba'i ngo bo yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The effect of the negation of the cognition of existence, etc., is just that which has the same nature.

original: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa ni yod pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The cognition of existence, etc., is expressed by the word ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa ni med pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa ni med pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The cognition of non-existence, etc., is expressed by the word ‚Äúnon-existence.‚Äù

original: yod pa dang med pa ni yod pa dang med pa dag go //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ni yod pa dang med pa dag go //
translated: Existence and non-existence are existence and non-existence.

original: de gnyis go rims bzhin du dgag pa dang / sgrub pa ni yod pa dang / med pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis go rims bzhin du dgag pa dang / sgrub pa ni yod pa dang / med pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa ste /
translated: The negation and affirmation of those two, respectively, are the negation and affirmation of existence and non-existence.

original: de gnyis kyi gtan tshigs dag go //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gtan tshigs dag go //
translated: Those are the reasons for those two.

original: yod pa dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason for the negation of existence is the non-apprehension of the imperceptible.

original: med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason for the affirmation of non-existence is the non-apprehension that has the characteristic of apprehension.

original: de dag ni 'dra ba'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dra ba'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Those have the same nature.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid @13b kyir gyur ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid @13b kyir gyur ba /
translated: Thus, that which has the characteristic of apprehension

original: mi dmigs pa yang yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension is also the proof of the negation of the cognition of existence, etc.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs pa gnyi ga yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu nyid can yin par 'dra ba de bzhin du yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs pa gnyi ga yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu nyid can yin par 'dra ba de bzhin du yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that just as non-apprehension is similar in being the effect of the negation of the convention of both,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin la de yang gnyis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin la de yang gnyis te /
translated: Apprehension itself is existence, and that is twofold.

original: re zhig gang gi tshe las la yod pa'i bya ba yin par brjod pa de'i tshe ni dmigs pa dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gang gi tshe las la yod pa'i bya ba yin par brjod pa de'i tshe ni dmigs pa dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: First, when the activity is said to exist in the object, then the characteristic of a suitable entity is the object.

original: gang la mtshan nyid dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la mtshan nyid dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the characteristic of a suitable entity is said to be that.

original: gang gi tshe byed pa po la yod pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyogs de la ni de'i rten can gyi shes pa 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byed pa po la yod pa'i bya ba yin pa'i phyogs de la ni de'i rten can gyi shes pa 'jug pa yin te /
translated: When the position is that the activity exists in the agent, then the engagement of the cognition that has it as its basis is the object.

original: shes pa 'jug pa gang la rten dngos po rung ba de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'jug pa gang la rten dngos po rung ba de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has a real basis for the operation of consciousness is said to exist.

original: de ni nye bar btags pa'i phyir yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nye bar btags pa'i phyir yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to exist because it is imputed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad dag 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad dag 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the knowledge, words, and conventions of existence operate in regard to it.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa las so //
translated: In regard to it means in regard to the objective support.

original: mi dmigs pa ni med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa ni de ltar dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i bye brag gis dngos po yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa ni de ltar dngos dang nye bar btags pa'i bye brag gis dngos po yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: Non-apprehension is the non-existence of non-existents. Non-apprehension is the opposite of the apprehension which has the characteristic of the existence of an entity, as distinguished by the difference between the real and the imputed.

original: bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa gzhi'i mtshan nyid dam de shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa gzhi'i mtshan nyid dam de shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It has the characteristic of the ground devoid of a pot, etc., or the knowledge of that.

original: de ni med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no //
translated: That is the non-existence of non-existents.

original: de ltar na bltar rung ba mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de ltar na bltar rung ba mi dmigs na /
translated: Thus, if the visible is not apprehended,

original: dngos po'i dbang gis yod pa log pa rang gi rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa dang sgra la sogs pa zlog par byed pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dag mi dmigs pa kho na med pa rnams kyi med pa yin par rigs na /
