analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis yod pa log pa rang gi rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa dang sgra la sogs pa zlog par byed pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dag mi dmigs pa kho na med pa rnams kyi med pa yin par rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable that the non-existence of non-apprehension, which is characterized by the non-apprehension of things that are not present, is the non-existence of those that are not present.

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal pa dag go //
translated: But they are naturally separate.

original: ji ltar te the tshom yod pa'i phyir de dag ni mi dmigs su zin kyang med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar te the tshom yod pa'i phyir de dag ni mi dmigs su zin kyang med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since there is doubt about that, even though they are not apprehended, they are not non-existent.

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang rtogs par byed pa'i dbang gis med pa zhes brjod kyi dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang rtogs par byed pa'i dbang gis med pa zhes brjod kyi dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin te /
translated: That is true, but still, non-existence is said to be due to the fact that it is understood, not due to the fact that it is a thing.

original: rtogs par byed pa ni mi dmigs pa brjod par 'dod pa'i don mi byed pa'i phyir yod kyang med pa dang 'dra bar sems so //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa ni mi dmigs pa brjod par 'dod pa'i don mi byed pa'i phyir yod kyang med pa dang 'dra bar sems so //
translated: Because the understanding of non-apprehension is not the purpose of what is intended to be expressed, even though it exists, it is thought to be like non-existence.

original: de bas na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: med pa dang 'dra ba'i med par rang bzhin gyis bskal pa @14a * //
analyzed: med pa dang 'dra ba'i med par rang bzhin gyis bskal pa @14a * //
translated: The non-existence that is like non-existence is naturally separate.

original: dag mi dmigs pa ni med pa yin pas de'i phyir 'di la yang rtogs par byed pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis yod pa log pa rang gi rgyu can gyi yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa zlog par byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dag mi dmigs pa ni med pa yin pas de'i phyir 'di la yang rtogs par byed pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis yod pa log pa rang gi rgyu can gyi yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa zlog par byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since non-apprehension is non-existence, therefore, in this case also, the cognition of existence, etc. , which is the result of the cognition of the absence of existence, is refuted by the power of the intention to understand.üîΩThe result of some non-apprehensions is the cognition of non-existence,

original: gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas //üîΩla la med shes 'bras bu can //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas // la la med shes 'bras bu can //
translated: depending on the particularity of the reason.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason is non-apprehension.

original: de'i khyad par ni gtan tshigs bye brag ste de la ltos pa des na mi dmigs pa la la med pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu can yin te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni gtan tshigs bye brag ste de la ltos pa des na mi dmigs pa la la med pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu can yin te /
translated: The particularity of that is the particularity of the reason. Depending on that, the result of some non-apprehensions is the cognition of non-existence.

original: shes pa zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pas med pa shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pas med pa shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mention of cognition is by way of illustration, so the meaning is: the result of the cognition of non-existence, etc.

original: la la zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: la la zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Some means the non-apprehension of what is suitable to appear.

original: yang gtan tshigs ni gang yin de'i bye brag ni ci zhig ce na gtan tshigs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yang gtan tshigs ni gang yin de'i bye brag ni ci zhig ce na gtan tshigs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: What is the reason? What is its division? He says, ‚ÄúThe reason is non-apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa de'i bye brag ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de'i bye brag ni khyad par ro //
translated: The division of that non-apprehension is its distinction.

original: de yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i yod pa can yin te /
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i yod pa can yin te /
translated: And that is the existence of the object characterized by apprehension,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i yod pa can mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes khyad par du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i yod pa can mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes khyad par du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by the non-apprehension of the existence of the object characterized by apprehension.

original: yang cis te mi dmigs pas med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub kyi /
analyzed: yang cis te mi dmigs pas med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub kyi /
translated: But if the cognition of non-existence is established by non-apprehension, and so on,

original: med pa kho na ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: med pa kho na ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: is it not just non-existence?

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe reason is non-apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin par khas len na yul gang zhig med par sgrub par byed pa de dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin par khas len na yul gang zhig med par sgrub par byed pa de dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: If one accepts that non-existence is the probandum, then whatever object is established as non-existent must be established by the non-apprehension of another non-apprehension,

original: de yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that also has the nature of non-existence.

original: ji ltar don dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar don dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the non-apprehension of an object is established by another non-apprehension,

original: dmigs pa dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: so too the non-apprehension of an apprehension must be established by another non-apprehension, and so on ad infinitum.

original: 'on te nyes pa der gyur na mi rung zhes te /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa der gyur na mi rung zhes te /
translated: But if you say that this fault is unacceptable,

original: dmigs pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa med par rang kho nas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa med par rang kho nas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the non-apprehension of an apprehension will be established by itself, without the non-apprehension of an object.

original: de bzhin du yod pa med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, existence will be without non-existence,

original: yul med par rang rang gis 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul med par rang rang gis 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and will be established by itself, without an object.

original: de'i phyir med pa grub par bya ba la mi dmigs pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa grub par bya ba la mi dmigs pa don med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-apprehension is meaningless in establishing non-existence.

original: ji ste gzhan @14b dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pas ma dmigs pa 'grub pas mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub ste /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan @14b dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pas ma dmigs pa 'grub pas mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub ste /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúNon-observation is established by direct perception, because the observation of another object establishes non-observation,‚Äù

original: gzhan dmigs pa'i mngon sum kho nas grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa'i mngon sum kho nas grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then how is non-observation established by the observation of another object?

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pa de bzhin du gzhan yod pas te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pa de bzhin du gzhan yod pas te /
translated: Just as non-observation is established by the observation of another object, in the same way, the existence of another object is established by the observation of another object.

original: don gzhan bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa gzhi la sogs pa yod pas /
analyzed: don gzhan bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa gzhi la sogs pa yod pas /
translated: The existence of the ground, for example, which is devoid of another object, such as a pot, is established by the observation of another object.

original: grub pas kyang dgag par bya ba'i don med pa ci ste mi 'grub /
analyzed: grub pas kyang dgag par bya ba'i don med pa ci ste mi 'grub /
translated: In that case, why is the nonexistence of the object of negation not established?

original: de ltar na shes pa med pa bzhin don med pa yang mngon sum gyis sgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis dngos po med pa grub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa med pa bzhin don med pa yang mngon sum gyis sgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis dngos po med pa grub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, just as the nonexistence of consciousness is established by direct perception, the nonexistence of the object is also established by direct perception. Therefore non-observation does not establish the nonexistence of things.

original: 'o na ci zhe na med pa'i tha snyad kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na med pa'i tha snyad kho na'o //
translated: If that is so, then what is established? The term ‚Äúnonexistence‚Äù is established.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that, he says, ‚ÄúWhen, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni don med pa rnams kyi med pa dmigs su rung ba dmigs pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul mngon sum gyis grub tu zin kyang rmongs pas yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dag khong du mi chud pa'i mi yul rab tu bstan pas med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul med pa bsnyad pas brda ste /
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni don med pa rnams kyi med pa dmigs su rung ba dmigs pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul mngon sum gyis grub tu zin kyang rmongs pas yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dag khong du mi chud pa'i mi yul rab tu bstan pas med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul med pa bsnyad pas brda ste /
translated: ‚Äú Such‚Äù means that when the mere observation of the possible observation of the non-existence of non-entities is established by direct perception as the domain of the convention of non-existence, the person who, due to delusion, does not understand the subject, the cognition, the word, and the convention, is taught the domain of non-existence, the domain of the convention of non-existence, by means of indication.

original: tha snyad la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: tha snyad la 'jug par byed do //
translated: He is caused to engage in the convention.

original: dper bstan pa dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper bstan pa dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The example is stated by ‚ÄúFor example, etc.‚Äù

original: ba lang ni lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: ba lang ni lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin te /
translated: The cow is the very self of the collection of dewlap, etc.

original: de'i phyir de la ba lang nyid ni mi sgrub kyi 'on kyang tha snyad sgrub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ba lang nyid ni mi sgrub kyi 'on kyang tha snyad sgrub po //
translated: Therefore, the cow is not established there, but rather the convention.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú If that is so, etc.‚Äù means:

original: gang gi phyir tha snyad sgrub pa de kho nas dpe ma grub par rgol ba yang bstsal cing spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha snyad sgrub pa de kho nas dpe ma grub par rgol ba yang bstsal cing spangs pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, the opponent‚Äôs objection that the example is not established by the very same means of establishing the convention is also refuted.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med par bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med par bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the non-observation sign is used to prove non-existence,

original: phyogs kyi chos gang gis bsgrub par bya ba de kho nas dpe'i chos can yang bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni de la dpe gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos gang gis bsgrub par bya ba de kho nas dpe'i chos can yang bsgrub par bya ba yin na ni de la dpe gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the property of the subject by which the probandum is established would also be the probandum of the example property. In that case, another example would be needed, and there would be an infinite regress.

original: tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can med pa bsgrub bar bya ba'i de kho nas bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yul la sngon du zhugs pa'i tha snyad thams cad dpe nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can med pa bsgrub bar bya ba'i de kho nas bdag nyid ji lta ba'i yul la sngon du zhugs pa'i tha snyad thams cad dpe nyid yin no //
translated: If the property of the subject to be established by the means of establishing the convention does not exist, then by the very same means of establishing the probandum, all conventions that engage in the object as it is are examples.

original: yul rtogs na yul can yang rtogs pa kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: yul rtogs na yul can yang rtogs pa kho na nyid yin te /
translated: When the object is cognized, the subject is also cognized.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad kyang ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad kyang ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can the convention also be the probandum?

original: yul rtogs su zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul rtogs su zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven if the object is cognized,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig rten na yang gang dag yul rtogs @15a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gang dag yul rtogs @15a * //
translated: In the world, too, it is seen thatüîΩ

original: su zin kyang yul can mi rtogs par de lta bu dag snang ngo //
analyzed: su zin kyang yul can mi rtogs par de lta bu dag snang ngo //
translated: In the world, too, there are those who, even though they have understood the object, do not understand the subject.üîΩThus, they appear.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud de /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud de /
translated: Thus, etc., concludes.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas na bltar rung ba dang bltar mi rung ba'i mi dmigs pa 'di gnyis ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas na bltar rung ba dang bltar mi rung ba'i mi dmigs pa 'di gnyis ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, in the order explained, these two non-apprehensions, of the visible and the invisible, are similar in that they both have the effect of negating the convention of existence.

original: ji ltar zhe na rang dang bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs med pa dang yod pa dag gi phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na rang dang bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs med pa dang yod pa dag gi phyir te /
translated: How so? Because of the presence and absence of the reason and its opposite.

original: rang zhes bya ba'i sbras ni yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba'i sbras ni yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúown‚Äù indicates the cognition of existence, etc.

original: bzlog pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúopposite‚Äù indicates the cognition of non-existence, etc.

original: rang dang bzlog pa ni rang dang bzlog pa dag go //
analyzed: rang dang bzlog pa ni rang dang bzlog pa dag go //
translated: The own and the opposite are the own and the opposite.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu ni rang dang bzlog pa'i rgyu dag ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu ni rang dang bzlog pa'i rgyu dag ste /
translated: The cause of those two is the cause of the own and the opposite.

original: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang / med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang / med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the cognition of existence, etc., and the cause of the cognition of non-existence, etc.

original: de la rang gi rgyu ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi rgyu ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Of these, the cause of the former is the object,

original: bzlog pa'i rgyu ni bltar rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i rgyu ni bltar rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: and the cause of the latter is the non-apprehension of an object that is suitable to be apprehended.

original: de gnyis med pa dang yod pa ni rang dang bzlog pa'i rgyu med pa dang yod pa dag ste de dag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis med pa dang yod pa ni rang dang bzlog pa'i rgyu med pa dang yod pa dag ste de dag gi phyir ro //
translated: The non-existence and existence of these two are the non-existence and existence of the cause of the former and the cause of the latter, respectively.

original: gcig la ni zhes bya ba'i bltar mi rung ba'i yul gyi mi dmigs pa la ste /
analyzed: gcig la ni zhes bya ba'i bltar mi rung ba'i yul gyi mi dmigs pa la ste /
translated: In regard to the non-apprehension of an object that is not suitable to be apprehended, i.e., the one,

original: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa'i don ni the tshom yod pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pas bskal pa'i don ni the tshom yod pa'i phyir rang gi rgyu med pa yin no //
translated: the object is excluded by its intrinsic nature, etc., because there is doubt. Therefore, it lacks a cause of its own.

original: de'i phyir 'di la rgyu med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rgyu med pa'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad med pa yin no //
translated: Consequently, there is no conventional expression of existence in regard to this, because it lacks a cause.

original: gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa la'o //
translated: In regard to the non-apprehension of an object that is suitable to be apprehended, i.e., the other,

original: bzlog pa'i phyir te med par nges pa'i phyir bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir te med par nges pa'i phyir bzlog pa ste /
translated: because of the exclusion, i.e., because of the ascertainment of non-existence,

original: yod pa'i tha snyad las bzlog pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yod do //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad las bzlog pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yod do //
translated: The reason for the expression of nonexistence is the reversal of the expression of existence.

original: de'i phyir 'di la yod pa'i tha snyad las bzlog pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yod pas na yod pa'i tha snyad med par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la yod pa'i tha snyad las bzlog pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yod pas na yod pa'i tha snyad med par 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the reason for the expression of nonexistence is the reversal of the expression of existence, the expression of existence is established as nonexistent.

original: gal te bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pa la the tshom yod na de ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pa la the tshom yod na de ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: If there is doubt about the nonapprehension of the imperceptible, how can it be a means of valid cognition?

original: de la dang po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, he says, ‚ÄúThe first, etc.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa gnyis kyi nang nas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa gnyis kyi nang nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this‚Äù refers to the two nonapprehensions.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni bltar mi rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni bltar mi rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe first‚Äù is the nonapprehension of the imperceptible object.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad dgag par dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pas 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad dgag par dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pas 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it has the purpose of negating the expression of existence‚Äù means that it has a result because it negates the expression of existence.

original: ldog pa mthong ba ni med pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa mthong ba ni med pa shes pa'o //
translated: The perception of the reversal is the knowledge of nonexistence.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya bas smos pas ni sgra dang tha snyad bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya bas smos pas ni sgra dang tha snyad bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes sound and convention.

original: gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung @15b ba'i yul mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung @15b ba'i yul mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The second is the non-apprehension of an object that is suitable to appear.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni ldog pa mthong ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni ldog pa mthong ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the perception of an absence.üîΩThat non-apprehension of an object that is suitable to appear is of four kinds, due to the differences in the application.

original: yul bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis ni rnam bzhi zhes bya ba de dang sbyar ro //üîΩ'gal ba dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yul bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis ni rnam bzhi zhes bya ba de dang sbyar ro // 'gal ba dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe perception of an incompatible object‚Äù is to be supplied.üîΩThe incompatible object and the object that is the effect of an incompatible object are different from each other.üîΩThe incompatible object is that which is incompatible with the object that is to be established.

original: mi 'dra ba dag la gcig lus par byas pa yin no //üîΩgrub pa ni dmigs pa ste bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag ces bya ba ni 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba dag la gcig lus par byas pa yin no // grub pa ni dmigs pa ste bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag ces bya ba ni 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang gnyis bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe perception of an object that is the effect of an incompatible object‚Äù is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe perception of an object that is the effect of

original: rgyu dang ngo bo bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba'i rgyu dang rang bzhin dag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang ngo bo bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag ni ma grub pa zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba'i rgyu dang rang bzhin dag mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot established as a cause or as a nature that can be perceived‚Äù means that a cause or a nature that has the characteristic of being perceived is not found.

original: 'dis kyang rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang gnyis bstan pas rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang gnyis bstan pas rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: This [reasoning] also teaches two types of non-observation: the non-observation of a cause and the non-observation of a nature. Thus, there are four types.

original: med don can zhes bya ba ni med pa'i yul can dang / med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med don can zhes bya ba ni med pa'i yul can dang / med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has the meaning of non-existence‚Äù means that which has a non-existent object and that which has a non-existent convention as its object.

original: 'gal ba dang 'bras bu grub pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba mi grag pa yin nam ji ltar na 'di gnyis pa mi dmigs pa nyid yin zhen dgag pa gang ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang 'bras bu grub pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba mi grag pa yin nam ji ltar na 'di gnyis pa mi dmigs pa nyid yin zhen dgag pa gang ji snyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúthat which is contradictory and that which has accomplished its result,‚Äù is the word ‚Äúnon-observation‚Äù not mentioned? Or, if it is mentioned, how can these two be non-observation? To answer this, [the root text] says, ‚Äúall negations . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba ni dgag pa ste /üîΩdon 'ga' zhig sgrub pas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba ni dgag pa ste / don 'ga' zhig sgrub pas sam /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way . . .‚Äù is a negation.

original: don 'ga' zhig dgag pas se //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig dgag pas se //
translated: [A negation] is either the establishment of some object or the refutation of some object.

original: sgrub par byed na ni 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed na ni 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is established, then either a contradiction or a non-contradiction is established.

original: mi 'gal ba sgrub na ni dgag par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba dag lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'gal ba sgrub na ni dgag par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba dag lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If a non-contradiction is established, then the object of negation and the object of affirmation are not contradictory in existing together.

original: dgag par 'dod pa bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag par 'dod pa bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the intended negation is not negated.

original: 'gal ba la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ni gal te de na rang dang 'gal ba mi dmigs par gyur na de ltar na 'di 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ni gal te de na rang dang 'gal ba mi dmigs par gyur na de ltar na 'di 'gal ba yin no //
translated: As for ‚Äúin the case of a contradiction,‚Äù etc., if there is non-apprehension of something that is contradictory with it, then it is a contradiction.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid bstan te /
translated: ‚Äú In this way,‚Äù etc., indicates that.

original: rgyu ma gtugs pa can zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma zad pa can no //
analyzed: rgyu ma gtugs pa can zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma zad pa can no //
translated: ‚Äú Having a cause that is not terminated‚Äù means having a cause that is not exhausted.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste 'gal ba nye ba'i sngon rol na zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba ste 'gal ba nye ba'i sngon rol na zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Arising‚Äù means being born. It should be understood that ‚Äúprior to the approach of the contradiction‚Äù means prior to the approach of the contradiction.

original: gzhan yod na de 'gal ba yod par gyur na med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yod na de 'gal ba yod par gyur na med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the other exists, then the contradiction exists. But if it does not exist,

original: de gnyis phan tshun 'gal bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun 'gal bar rtogs so //
translated: then the two are understood to be mutually contradictory.

original: 'di ltar de nye ba kho nas de'i rgyu mtshang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya @16a * //üîΩbar shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nye ba kho nas de'i rgyu mtshang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya @16a * // bar shes so //
translated: Thus, it is understood that the reason for that is just that.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yod na med pa yang mi dmigs pa las yin te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yod na med pa yang mi dmigs pa las yin te /
translated: And that is also from the non-apprehension of the existent of another.

original: 'di ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the contradiction of the characteristic of non-coexistence.

original: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show the second, he says, etc.

original: phan tshun dmigs pa ni phan tshun rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun dmigs pa ni phan tshun rtogs pa'o //
translated: Mutual apprehension is mutual understanding.

original: de spangs pa ni dben pa ste /
analyzed: de spangs pa ni dben pa ste /
translated: The abandonment of that is isolation.

original: gang dag la de lta bur gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la de lta bur gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have the characteristic of abiding in that way are so called.

original: de dag gi ngo bo ni phan tshun dmigs pa spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin te de yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo ni phan tshun dmigs pa spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin te de yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Their nature is the characteristic of abiding in the abandonment of mutual apprehension, and that is also a contradiction.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The word also is inclusive.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: Like the permanent and the impermanent, this is an example.

original: gal te 'gal ba dang po la yang phan tshun spangs pa yod pa kho na la /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba dang po la yang phan tshun spangs pa yod pa kho na la /
translated: If the first contradiction is the mere mutual exclusion of two things,

original: gnyis pa la yang lhan cig mi gnas pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang lhan cig mi gnas pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: and the second contradiction is the mere non-coexistence of two things,

original: 'di ltar chos gang dag kho na lhan cig mi gnas pa de dag kho na 'gal ba gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gang dag kho na lhan cig mi gnas pa de dag kho na 'gal ba gnyis pa yin te /
translated: then whatever phenomena do not coexist are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang ro dag la ni 'di mi 'dod na de ci'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang ro dag la ni 'di mi 'dod na de ci'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis bshad ce na /
translated: If this is so, then why are two types of contradiction explained, since form and taste, for example, are not mutually exclusive?

original: bden mod kyi yul rnam par dbye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi yul rnam par dbye ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is true, but they are explained in terms of their objects.

original: 'gal ba snga ma ni bltar rung ba'i dngos po'i yul can kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba snga ma ni bltar rung ba'i dngos po'i yul can kho na yin la /
translated: The first contradiction has only a visible object.

original: gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa'i yul can yang yin la bltar mi rung ba'i yul can yang yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dngos po med pa'i yul can yang yin la bltar mi rung ba'i yul can yang yin no //
translated: The second contradiction has an invisible object and also has a non-entity as its object.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i 'gal ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i 'gal ba la yang ngo //
translated: Also means in addition to the just explained contradiction.

original: gcig dmigs pas te /
analyzed: gcig dmigs pas te /
translated: It is the observation of one.

original: zla bo gcig dmigs pas na gzhan mi dmigs pas na gzhan mi dmigs pa kho nar te /
analyzed: zla bo gcig dmigs pas na gzhan mi dmigs pas na gzhan mi dmigs pa kho nar te /
translated: The observation of one excludes the observation of another.

original: dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa kho nar shugs kyis brjod do //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa kho nar shugs kyis brjod do //
translated: and the non-apprehension of the object to be negated is expressed only by implication.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par mi brjod na de'i tshe gcig dmigs su zin kyang dgag par bya ba dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gang yin pa de med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par mi brjod na de'i tshe gcig dmigs su zin kyang dgag par bya ba dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gang yin pa de med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one does not say that the non-apprehension of the other is due to the apprehension of one, then even though one is apprehended, the non-establishment of the non-existence of that object to be negated which is not negated by the apprehension of one is not established.

original: de lta bas na 'gal ba gnyis ka yang mi dmigs pas byas pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi dmigs pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas rab tu sbyar kyang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gal ba gnyis ka yang mi dmigs pas byas pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi dmigs pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas rab tu sbyar kyang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because both the negation and the non-apprehension are produced, even though they are applied by way of establishing the non-apprehension of the incompatible, etc., they are only of the nature of non-apprehension.

original: gang la gcig bkag pas gzhan 'gog pa de la ni mi dmigs pa nyid gsal ba kho na yin pas //
analyzed: gang la gcig bkag pas gzhan 'gog pa de la ni mi dmigs pa nyid gsal ba kho na yin pas //
translated: In that case, where one is negated and the other is negated, the non-apprehension itself is clearly stated.

original: gcig bkag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gcig bkag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúBy the negation of one, etc.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dgag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the negation, etc.‚Äù

original: @16b don gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩgnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: @16b don gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur ba'am / gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the reason that refutes another object to be refuted would be a cause or it would be an effect or it would be a reason that refutes that which is neither a cause nor an effect.üîΩIt would be neither a cause nor an effect.

original: rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin pa zhig dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu yang ma yin 'bras bu yang ma yin pa zhig dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The reason that refutes that which is neither a cause nor an effect would be nonexistent, that is, it would not exist.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad dam dmigs kyis bstsal ba'o //üîΩgnyi ga ma yin pa ste rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ni dgag par bya ba dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de med na ste 'brel pa med pa med na gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad dam dmigs kyis bstsal ba'o // gnyi ga ma yin pa ste rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ni dgag par bya ba dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de med na ste 'brel pa med pa med na gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúthat‚Äù is a verbal particle or an exclusion.üîΩThat which is neither a cause nor an effect is not related to the object to be refuted.üîΩHow could it be nonexistent, that is, unrelated, without the object to be refuted?

original: dgag par bya ba 'dod pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba der lta ga la 'gyur /üîΩ'bras bu mi dmigs kyang de med par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /üîΩde med par zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par ro //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba 'dod pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba der lta ga la 'gyur /üîΩ'bras bu mi dmigs kyang de med par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /üîΩde med par zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par ro //
translated: How could it be nonexistent, that is, without a cause?

original: ci'i phyir med pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not nonexistent?

original: gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is not definitely endowed with that,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with that‚Äù means endowed with the effect.

original: ma tshang ba dang gags byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshang ba dang gags byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that there is a deficiency or an obstruction.

original: 'di ni rgyu tsam smos nas bshad par zad de rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu tsam smos nas bshad par zad de rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa ni /
translated: This is merely a statement of the cause. The cause that is unobstructed and powerful

original: 'bras bu med pa las med par rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa las med par rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: is understood to be nonexistent when the effect is nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir gnyi ga ma yin pa dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyi ga ma yin pa dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Because the nonobservation of both and the nonobservation of the effect are not the means of understanding nonexistence, therefore, and so on.

original: 'brel pa'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na 'bras bu med pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na 'bras bu med pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Because of the connection, it is understood that the nonobservation of the cause alone is the means of understanding the nonexistence of the effect.

original: gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang med pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir nges par gzung ba rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang med pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir nges par gzung ba rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that because the nonobservation of essence is also a reason for nonexistence, it is not right to specify it,

original: bshad pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang gi ngo bos med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bshad pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang gi ngo bos med pa kho na ste /
translated: The explanation is that the non-observation of a nature is only the non-existence of a nature by way of its own entity.

original: 'di la don gzhan med par sgrub par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di la don gzhan med par sgrub par mi byed do //
translated: It does not prove that there is no other object.

original: rang bzhin gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la ni rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la ni rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ste /
translated: One should understand that the non-observation of a cause is the only proof for the negation of another nature.

original: de'i phyir gnod pa med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod pa med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that there is no fault.

original: 'o na de la ci zhig sgrub par byed ce na 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na de la ci zhig sgrub par byed ce na 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is proved by that?‚Äù the response is ‚ÄúOnly the non-existence of a nature.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù refers to the non-observation of a nature.

original: yul can zhes bya ba ni med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul can zhes bya ba ni med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe subjective aspect‚Äù refers to the cognition of non-existence and so on.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in this‚Äù refers to the non-observation of a nature.

original: gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba @17a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba @17a * //
translated: When the non-observation of a pervader is used to prove the absence of the pervaded,

original: med par ston te /
analyzed: med par ston te /
translated: the pervaded is shown to be absent.

original: dper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin pa de'i tshe ni khyab par bya ba med pa yang sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin pa de'i tshe ni khyab par bya ba med pa yang sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree because there is no tree,‚Äù in that case the absence of the pervasion is also established.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tha snyad kyang sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tha snyad kyang sgrub par byed do //
translated: By the word ‚Äúalso,‚Äù conventional [cognition] is also established.

original: yang 'di la ji ltar med pa sgrub par byed /
analyzed: yang 'di la ji ltar med pa sgrub par byed /
translated: Again, how is non-existence established in this [case]?

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gis shing gis dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pa las shing med par rtogs pa des ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gis shing gis dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pa las shing med par rtogs pa des ni /
translated: Thus, one who understands the non-existence of a tree from the observation of a ground devoid of trees,

original: shing sha pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pa las kyang shing sha pa med pa yang rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: shing sha pas dben pa'i sa gzhi dmigs pa las kyang shing sha pa med pa yang rtogs so zhe na /
translated: by that [observation] he also understands the non-existence of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree from the observation of a ground devoid of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: phyogs gcig tsam na shing dang shing sha pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba dag yin pa de kho na tsam na shing mi dmigs pas shing sha sha pa med par sgrub par byed do zhes pa ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tsam na shing dang shing sha pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba dag yin pa de kho na tsam na shing mi dmigs pas shing sha sha pa med par sgrub par byed do zhes pa ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that merely by the absence of a tree at that very place where trees and ≈õim≈õapƒÅ trees are observed, the non-existence of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree is established by the non-observation of a tree.

original: 'on kyang gang na shing tsam nges par gzung bar nus kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang na shing tsam nges par gzung bar nus kyi /
translated: But in a place where it is possible to ascertain the mere tree,

original: khyad par shing sha pa la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyogs de tsam na gang gi tshe shing sha pa med par rtogs par 'dod pa de'i tshe shing mi dmigs pas shing sha pa med par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: khyad par shing sha pa la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyogs de tsam na gang gi tshe shing sha pa med par rtogs par 'dod pa de'i tshe shing mi dmigs pas shing sha pa med par sgrub par byed do //
translated: when one wishes to understand that there is no sƒÅl tree, then the non-apprehension of tree proves that there is no sƒÅl tree.

original: der shing sha pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: der shing sha pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: In that place, the sƒÅl tree cannot be posited as an unapprehended nature,

original: de na shing sha pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na shing sha pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object of the apprehension of tree.

original: gzhan dag na re mi rtag pa nyid dang byas pa nyid dag ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mi rtag pa nyid dang byas pa nyid dag ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bor grub pa yin la /
translated: Others say: Impermanence and being produced are established as the nature of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: gang gi tshe ldog par bstan par bya ba las khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid med pas byas pa nyid med par ston pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ldog par bstan par bya ba las khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid med pas byas pa nyid med par ston pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one teaches the reverse, that the pervader, impermanence, does not exist, then being produced does not exist.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs na med pa 'grub po zhes bya bar sems so //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs na med pa 'grub po zhes bya bar sems so //
translated: This is what I think.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: In the passage beginning with ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so on,

original: me don can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha ston to //
analyzed: me don can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha ston to //
translated: he shows the part of the verse that begins with ‚Äúthe presence of fire.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba grub par zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pas so //
analyzed: 'gal ba grub par zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe establishment of the contradiction‚Äù is by the observation of a contradiction in nature.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dper brjod pa 'dis ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba 'grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dper brjod pa 'dis ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba 'grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this example of the observation of a contradiction in nature, it should be understood that the establishment of a contradiction in the pervader is also explained.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: The example is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúfor example.‚Äù

original: ba mo ni kha pa dang ldan pa'i grang ba'i reg pa'i khyad par kho na yin no //
analyzed: ba mo ni kha pa dang ldan pa'i grang ba'i reg pa'i khyad par kho na yin no //
translated: A cow is a particular cold touch that possesses a dewlap.

original: de la khyab par byed pa ni grang ba yin no //
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa ni grang ba yin no //
translated: The pervader there is cold.

original: de dang 'gal ba ni me yin te de la mes 'gal ba grang ba zlog par byed pa na des khyab par bya pa ba mo'i @17b reg pa yang zlog par byed pas don gyis na 'di rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs par 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba ni me yin te de la mes 'gal ba grang ba zlog par byed pa na des khyab par bya pa ba mo'i @17b reg pa yang zlog par byed pas don gyis na 'di rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs par 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Fire is the contradictory object of that, because when fire stops the cold, which is contradictory to it, it also stops the cold sensation, which is pervaded by it.üîΩThis is the observation of a contradictory object.

original: 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni grang ba dang 'gal ba ni me'o //
analyzed: 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni grang ba dang 'gal ba ni me'o //
translated: This is the statement, ‚ÄúThere is no cold sensation here because there is smoke,‚Äù where the contradictory object of cold is fire.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni du ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni du ba'o //
translated: Its effect is smoke.

original: des ni me nye bar 'jog par byed la /
analyzed: des ni me nye bar 'jog par byed la /
translated: That establishes the presence of fire.

original: des kyang grang ba sel bar byed do //
analyzed: des kyang grang ba sel bar byed do //
translated: And that stops the cold.

original: re zhig de ltar na de ni 'gal ba dang 'bras bu dag grub pa zhes bya ba rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar na de ni 'gal ba dang 'bras bu dag grub pa zhes bya ba rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is the explanation of the statement, ‚ÄúThe contradictory object and the effect are established.‚Äù

original: de ni rgyu dang ngo bo dag ma grub pa zhes bya ba de dpe brjod pa'i tshul gyis ston te /
analyzed: de ni rgyu dang ngo bo dag ma grub pa zhes bya ba de dpe brjod pa'i tshul gyis ston te /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe cause and nature are not established,‚Äù is taught by way of an example.

original: rgyu ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: rgyu ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause is not established‚Äù means the cause is not observed.

original: 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni du ba'i rgyu ni me'o //
analyzed: 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni du ba'i rgyu ni me'o //
translated: The cause of smoke is fire.

original: me med pa ni des dben pa'i sa gzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: me med pa ni des dben pa'i sa gzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The absence of fire is the ground, etc., devoid of it.

original: 'di la yang phyogs gang na me dang du ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dag mi dmigs pa de na me med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di la yang phyogs gang na me dang du ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dag mi dmigs pa de na me med pa bzhin du /
translated: And here, in the place where fire and smoke are not perceived, which is characterized by the perception of the absence of fire,

original: du ba med pa yang rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa kho nas nges pa yin pas de la rgyu mi dmigs pa sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba med pa yang rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa kho nas nges pa yin pas de la rgyu mi dmigs pa sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: the absence of smoke is ascertained by the non-perception of its nature alone. Therefore, the non-perception of its cause is not applied there.

original: 'on kyang mtsho chen po la sogs pa gang na rlangs pa 'thul ba la sogs pa du ba dang 'dra bas bslus pa dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las du ba dang 'dra bas bslus pa dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las du ba med par nges par
analyzed: 'on kyang mtsho chen po la sogs pa gang na rlangs pa 'thul ba la sogs pa du ba dang 'dra bas bslus pa dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las du ba dang 'dra bas bslus pa dang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las du ba med par nges par
translated: But in a great lake, etc., where one is deceived by the appearance of smoke, such as steam, etc., the absence of smoke is ascertained from the non-perception of its nature.

original: gzung mi nus la /
analyzed: gzung mi nus la /
translated: But it cannot be grasped.

original: me med par ni nges par zin pa de kho nar rgyu mi dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: me med par ni nges par zin pa de kho nar rgyu mi dmigs pa med par bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: And the absence of fire is ascertained there, and the proof of the absence of its cause is grasped there alone without the non-perception of its cause.

original: rang bzhin ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pas so //
translated: The phrase because of the non-establishment of intrinsic nature means because of the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature.

original: 'di na du ba med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /üîΩdmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //üîΩ'dis ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di na du ba med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o // 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase here there is no smoke because of the non-apprehension of smoke means that the non-apprehension of smoke is the reason for the non-existence of smoke.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so //üîΩkhyab par byed pa yang yin la rang bzhin yang yin te /üîΩde ma grub pa'i mi dmigs pa yang bshad de /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so // khyab par byed pa yang yin la rang bzhin yang yin te / de ma grub pa'i mi dmigs pa yang bshad de /
translated: The phrase because of the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign should be supplied.

original: dper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshing gi dngos pos ni shing sha pa la khyad pa ste /üîΩshing sha pa ni shing gi khyad par kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro // shing gi dngos pos ni shing sha pa la khyad pa ste / shing sha pa ni shing gi khyad par kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in this way means that the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the sign means that the non-apprehension of the sign is the reason for the non-establishment of the object characterized by the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign means that the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the sign.

original: med pa sgrub pa zhes bya ba la med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad ni med pa'i sgrar bshad med pa sgrub pa dang med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa sgrub pa zhes bya ba la med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad ni med pa'i sgrar bshad med pa sgrub pa dang med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase because of the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign means that the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the sign means that the non-apprehension of the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign means that the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the sign means that the non-apprehension of the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign means that the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the sign means that the non-apprehension of the sign is the reason for the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign.üîΩThe phrase because of the non-apprehension of the object characterized by the sign means that the non-apprehension

original: thams cad la yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i sgo dang dgag pa'i sgo nas sbyar @18a * //
analyzed: thams cad la yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i sgo dang dgag pa'i sgo nas sbyar @18a * //
translated: The phrase in all cases refers to the positive and negative forms of the reason.üîΩThe words that are established and that are not established are not to be construed in the order in which they are stated in the root text.

original: ba'o // de dag dang 'gal ba dag grub pa dang ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du sbyar ba ni ma yin no //üîΩ'on kyang ci rigs par te /
analyzed: ba'o // de dag dang 'gal ba dag grub pa dang ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du sbyar ba ni ma yin no // 'on kyang ci rigs par te /
translated: Rather, the phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.

original: gang dag med pas med ba sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: gang dag med pas med ba sgrub par byed pa /
translated: The phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.

original: rgyu la sogs pa bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid de dag kho na ma grub pa dang / de dag dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid de dag kho na ma grub pa dang / de dag dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: The phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.üîΩThe phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.

original: dgag par bya ba'i don dang 'gal ba rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag kho na grub pa'i rtags nyid yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩ'dir yang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag ces bya ba dang / de dang 'gal ba dag ces bya ba'i drug pa dag gzhi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba'i don dang 'gal ba rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag kho na grub pa'i rtags nyid yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩ'dir yang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag ces bya ba dang / de dang 'gal ba dag ces bya ba'i drug pa dag gzhi mthun pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.üîΩThe phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.üîΩThe phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.üîΩThe phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.üîΩThe phrase that are established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that, and the phrase that are not established should be applied to the reason that is incompatible with that.

original: grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgra kho nas bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid du grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgra kho nas bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid du grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word ‚Äúestablished‚Äù itself implies that it is established as an observable entity.

original: bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni dmigs pa med do //
translated: But those that are not observable entities are not perceived.

original: 'on kyang 'di skad du gal te de dang 'gal ba dag dgag par 'dod pa bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams dang mi mthun pa yin na de dag grub pa'i rtags nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di skad du gal te de dang 'gal ba dag dgag par 'dod pa bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams dang mi mthun pa yin na de dag grub pa'i rtags nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: However, it should be applied in the following way: ‚ÄúIf you wish to refute that which is incompatible with that, then the evidence is established as being incompatible with observable entities.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu la sogs pa bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid gzhan dag ni med pa yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid gzhan dag ni med pa yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because other causes, etc., that are not observable entities are not established as nonexistent,

original: dgag par 'dod pa bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dang / 'gal ba yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag par 'dod pa bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni rang bzhin 'gal ba la sogs pa dang / 'gal ba yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and those that are incompatible with that which is to be refuted, which are observable entities, are not established as being incompatible with intrinsic reality, etc.

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Another party objects, beginning with the words, ‚ÄúIf you say that . . . ‚Äù

original: grang ba dang 'gal ba me'i 'bras bu du ba ste /
analyzed: grang ba dang 'gal ba me'i 'bras bu du ba ste /
translated: Smoke is the effect of fire, which is incompatible with cold.

original: de dmigs pas kyang grang ba med pa 'grub na /
analyzed: de dmigs pas kyang grang ba med pa 'grub na /
translated: If one accomplishes the absence of cold by observing that,üîΩwhy would one not accomplish the absence of cold by observing the cause of that, i.e., the fuel, etc., which is the cause of fire, which is incompatible with cold?

original: de'i rgyu dmigs pas te grang ba dang 'gal ba me de'i rgyu shing la sogs pa gang yin pa de dmigs pas grang ba med pa ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na slob dpon gyis de dang 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu dmigs pas te grang ba dang 'gal ba me de'i rgyu shing la sogs pa gang yin pa de dmigs pas grang ba med pa ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na slob dpon gyis de dang 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Acarya says, ‚ÄúThat which is incompatible with that . . . ‚Äù

original: grang ba'i reg pa de dang 'gal ba me'i rgyu mtshan shing la sogs pa de dmigs pa sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa de dang 'gal ba me'i rgyu mtshan shing la sogs pa de dmigs pa sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: That which is incompatible with the contact of cold, i.e., the cause of fire, the fuel, etc., is the observation of that which is the application.

original: nam zhe na rgyu mtshan dag ni 'gal ba nyid med na ste /
analyzed: nam zhe na rgyu mtshan dag ni 'gal ba nyid med na ste /
translated: When? ‚ÄúWhen there is no incompatibility of the causal signs.‚Äù

original: me dang grang ba'i rgyu mtshan dag 'gal ba med pa yin na'o //
analyzed: me dang grang ba'i rgyu mtshan dag 'gal ba med pa yin na'o //
translated: When there is no incompatibility of the causal signs of fire and cold.

original: dper brjod pa dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper brjod pa dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: An example is stated: ‚ÄúFor example . . . ‚Äù

original: ji ltar me'i rgyu shing tsam yin pa ltar grang ba'i yang de dang 'dra bas rgyu @18b mtshan la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: ji ltar me'i rgyu shing tsam yin pa ltar grang ba'i yang de dang 'dra bas rgyu @18b mtshan la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Just as the cause of fire is fuel, so also is the cause of cold. Therefore, there is no incompatibility of the causal signs.

original: me skyed par byed pa'i shing nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni grang ba'i rgyu mtshan dang 'gal mod kyi /
analyzed: me skyed par byed pa'i shing nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni grang ba'i rgyu mtshan dang 'gal mod kyi /
translated: The wood that produces fire, whose power is unimpeded, is indeed contrary to the cause of cold.

original: 'on kyang shing de lta bu de ni 'bras bu mthong ba kho nas nges pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang shing de lta bu de ni 'bras bu mthong ba kho nas nges pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'gal ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But that kind of wood is only contrary to the effect, because it is ascertained only by seeing the effect.

original: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal na ni rgyu dmigs pa go bar byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal na ni rgyu dmigs pa go bar byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: When the reason is contrary to the cause, the cause is only understood by implication.

original: dper na skyes bu 'di la ba spu langs pa la sogs pa khyad par med de /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu 'di la ba spu langs pa la sogs pa khyad par med de /
translated: For example, in the case of a person with goosebumps, etc., there is no difference.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni so thams thams byed pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni so thams thams byed pa dang 'dra ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes shivering, horripilation, etc.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba smos pas ni grang ba'i 'bras bu rnams bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba smos pas ni grang ba'i 'bras bu rnams bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: By mentioning difference, the effects of cold are included,

original: de dag sha za la sogs pas 'gyur ba'i byas pa yang yod pas so //
analyzed: de dag sha za la sogs pas 'gyur ba'i byas pa yang yod pas so //
translated: because they are also produced by rakshasas, etc.

original: skyes bu gang la me'i khyad par nye bar yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang la me'i khyad par nye bar yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That person is said to have the difference of fire when the difference of fire is near.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of that is itself, and therefore,

original: 'dir yang khyad par zhes bya ba smos pas ni me ji lta bu zhig gis pa spu langs pa la sogs pa sel bar byed nus pa de lta bu bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang khyad par zhes bya ba smos pas ni me ji lta bu zhig gis pa spu langs pa la sogs pa sel bar byed nus pa de lta bu bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúdistinctive‚Äù is used because it is the kind of fire that is able to remove horripilation, etc.

original: 'dir ni tsha ba'i rgyu mtshan med dang / ba spu langs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu grang bar 'gal ba yod de //
analyzed: 'dir ni tsha ba'i rgyu mtshan med dang / ba spu langs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu grang bar 'gal ba yod de //
translated: Here, there is no reason for heat, and there is a reason for horripilation, etc., which is cold, the opposite of heat.

original: de lta bas na rang dang 'gal ba'i grang ba sel ba ni de'i 'bras bu ba spu langs pa la sogs pa la yang sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang dang 'gal ba'i grang ba sel ba ni de'i 'bras bu ba spu langs pa la sogs pa la yang sel bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the removal of cold, which is incompatible with it, removes horripilation, etc., which are its effects.

original: rgyu 'gal ba dper brjod pa 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de las kyang de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu 'gal ba dper brjod pa 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de las kyang de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par bshad pa yin te /
translated: This example of the incompatibility of the cause explains that ‚Äúeven from its effect‚Äù means that even from an effect that is incompatible, the absence of that which is incompatible with it is understood.

original: 'gal ba gang zhig gi 'bras bu dmigs na de dang 'gal ba zla bo gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni de dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba gang zhig gi 'bras bu dmigs na de dang 'gal ba zla bo gnyis pa gang yin pa de ni de dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: When the effect of something incompatible is observed, that which is incompatible with it, the second alternative, is incompatible with it.

original: de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de med par rtogs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de med par rtogs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The result of that is understood to be nonexistent.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: For example, etc. is an example.

original: phyogs gang la grang pas byas pa'i ba sbu langs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i skyes bu gang yin pa de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gang la grang pas byas pa'i ba sbu langs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i skyes bu gang yin pa de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The person who has the distinction of goose bumps, etc. produced by cold in a place where that exists is called that.

original: phyogs smos pas ni du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di phyogs kyi chos nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyogs smos pas ni du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di phyogs kyi chos nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: By mentioning the place, it is shown that this is the property of the place, because it is said, ‚Äúbecause smoke exists.‚Äù

original: skyes bu chos can yin na ni phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bu chos can yin na ni phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If the person were the subject, the property of the place would not be the reason.

original: du ba ni phyogs kyi chos yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di la ni grang ba dang @19a * //
analyzed: du ba ni phyogs kyi chos yin pa'i phyir te / 'di la ni grang ba dang @19a * //
translated: Because smoke is the property of the place.üîΩHere, by observing the result of fire, which is incompatible with cold,

original: 'gal ba me'i 'bras bu dmigs pas me dang 'gal ba grang ba'i 'bras bu spu langs pa la sogs pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gal ba me'i 'bras bu dmigs pas me dang 'gal ba grang ba'i 'bras bu spu langs pa la sogs pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: the result of cold, which is incompatible with fire, goose bumps, etc., is understood to be nonexistent.

original: du bas ni me 'jog par byed cing des ni grang ba zlog par byed la de bzlog pa na rang gi 'bras bu ba spu langs pa la sogs pa zlog par byed pas don gyis na 'di ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: du bas ni me 'jog par byed cing des ni grang ba zlog par byed la de bzlog pa na rang gi 'bras bu ba spu langs pa la sogs pa zlog par byed pas don gyis na 'di ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The smoke is the cause of the fire, and the fire is the cause of the heat. The heat is the cause of the bristling of the hairs of the body, etc. Thus, indirectly, the presence of the cause of the cause of the effect is perceived.

original: de dang 'gal ba grub pa 'di yang zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba grub pa 'di yang zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the perception of the effect of the cause of the cause.

original: gong du zhes bya ba ni mod las rab tu dbye ba rnams pa bzhi bstan par ro //
analyzed: gong du zhes bya ba ni mod las rab tu dbye ba rnams pa bzhi bstan par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAbove‚Äù means in the above presentation of the four types of nonperception.

original: rgyu ma grub pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na ste /üîΩ'di ltar rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pas ni dgag par bya ba'i rgyu med pa kho nar ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu ma grub pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na ste / 'di ltar rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pas ni dgag par bya ba'i rgyu med pa kho nar ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly the nonestablishment of the cause‚Äù means only the nonperception of the cause.üîΩThus, the perception of the cause of the cause shows only the nonexistence of the cause of the object to be refuted.

original: phyogs 'di nyid kyis na rgyu ma grub pa kho nas rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di nyid kyis na rgyu ma grub pa kho nas rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this same principle, the perception of the effect of the cause of the cause is also explained as being only the nonestablishment of the cause.

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsa ba'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa bzhi yin yang /
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsa ba'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa bzhi yin yang /
translated: Thus, although nonapprehension is of four types,

original: bar skabs kyi sbyor ba'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar skabs kyi sbyor ba'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: it is of eight types due to the subdivision of the intermediate types.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni khyad pa byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni khyad pa byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin par bshad do //
translated: The subdivision of the apprehension of contradictory attributes is explained as the apprehension of contradictory attributes of the object.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The subdivision of the nonapprehension of attributes is the nonapprehension of attributes of the object.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'o //
translated: The subdivision of the nonapprehension of cause is the apprehension of a cause that is contradictory with the object and the apprehension of an effect that is contradictory with the cause.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: The apprehension of a contradictory effect is one type.

original: de ltar na rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus, there are eight types.

original: re zhig 'dir rnam pa brgyad du bshad kyi mi dmigs pa 'di ni rnam pa bcu gcig yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'dir rnam pa brgyad du bshad kyi mi dmigs pa 'di ni rnam pa bcu gcig yin no //
translated: Here, the eight types are explained, but there are eleven types of nonapprehension.

original: mal khang la sogs pa ni me shi nas ring mo zhig lan pa'i du ba yang yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: mal khang la sogs pa ni me shi nas ring mo zhig lan pa'i du ba yang yod pa yin nam /
translated: Is there smoke in a house where the fire has long since gone out?

original: ji ltar 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa mi 'khrul zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa mi 'khrul zhe na /
translated: How is it that the effect of contradiction is not mistaken?

original: de'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu de la yang yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu de la yang yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos par 'dod do //
translated: And that effect of contradiction is also asserted to depend on place, time, etc.

original: nam mkha' la du ba 'thul bas 'di na grang ba med de gang gi tshe /
analyzed: nam mkha' la du ba 'thul bas 'di na grang ba med de gang gi tshe /
translated: Since smoke is emitted in the sky, cold is absent here, because whenüîΩit is absent, it becomes the case that it exists at some time. This is the

original: med ltar gyi yin par gyur ba'i dus 'ga' zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni dus la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: med ltar gyi yin par gyur ba'i dus 'ga' zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni dus la ltos pa'o //
translated: dependence on time.üîΩCold is absent here, because in some place near the fire from which this

original: 'di na grang ba med de gang na gang las du ba 'di byung ba'i me nye ba'i yul 'ga' zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni yul la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di na grang ba med de gang na gang las du ba 'di byung ba'i me nye ba'i yul 'ga' zhig na'o zhes bya ba ni yul la ltos pa yin no //
