original: ji ltar bshad ma thag pa de tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad ma thag pa de tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the above is not a valid cognition,

original: mi mthun phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam gyi 'bras bu spyi mthong ba las rgyu khyad par can rjes su dbog pa'i /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam gyi 'bras bu spyi mthong ba las rgyu khyad par can rjes su dbog pa'i /
translated: so too, in the same way, the cognition of the reason that infers a specific cause from the perception of a general effect, when the reason is not seen in the discordant side,

original: gtan tshigs shes pa tshad ltar snang //
analyzed: gtan tshigs shes pa tshad ltar snang //
translated: is a pseudo-valid cognition.

original: tshad ma ltar snang ba yin te ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma ltar snang ba yin te ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a pseudo-valid cognition, it is not ascertained, is what is meant.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na /üîΩtshig las chags can la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na / tshig las chags can la sogs bzhin //
translated: What is it like?üîΩLike the four, the lustful, etc.

original: g-yo ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed do //
translated: The moving of the lips, etc., is explained by the words ‚Äúmoving, speech, etc.‚Äù

original: g-yo ba ni mchu gnyis 'gul ba ste de ni smra ba'i tshe gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni mchu gnyis 'gul ba ste de ni smra ba'i tshe gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moving is the quivering of the two lips, because that necessarily occurs when speaking.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de las gzhan pa smra ba'i tshig 'byung ba bzhin 'gyur ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de las gzhan pa smra ba'i tshig 'byung ba bzhin 'gyur ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the changes, etc., that occur when speech arises, which are different from that.

original: brjod par 'dod pa spyi ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam khyad par med pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa spyi ni brjod par 'dod pa tsam khyad par med pa ste /
translated: The general desire to speak is the mere desire to speak, without any distinction.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa gang dag la rgyu de kho na yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa gang dag la rgyu de kho na yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have that cause alone are said to be that.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: That nature is itself, and therefore.

original: gal te brjod par 'dod pa de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na 'dod pa'i phyir cung zad kyang gnod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te brjod par 'dod pa de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na 'dod pa'i phyir cung zad kyang gnod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that desire to speak is itself attachment, there is no harm at all in saying that it is desired.

original: de lta yin na grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta yin na grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If that is so, it is merely establishing what is already established.

original: yang @24a * //
analyzed: yang @24a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: khyed kyis 'dod chags gang zhig yin par shes she na /
analyzed: khyed kyis 'dod chags gang zhig yin par shes she na /
translated: what is that attachment that you know?

original: 'dod chags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAttachment is...,‚Äù and so on.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni 'dod chags sems kyi mngon par zhen pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gi rnam par lta ba gang yin pa des 'phangs shing bskyed pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can zhes bya ba ste nye bar len pa'i
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni 'dod chags sems kyi mngon par zhen pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gi rnam par lta ba gang yin pa des 'phangs shing bskyed pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can zhes bya ba ste nye bar len pa'i
translated: The wise say that attachment is a mental factor that is the object of contaminated phenomena, which is projected and generated by the view of the transitory collection, which is the conception of permanence, pleasure, purity, and a self and mine.

original: phung po snga la dmigs pa can yin par smra'o //üîΩji ste 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa yod par 'dod pa de dag kyang sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir bdag la sogs par lta bar zhugs pa yang yin la sems can la rjes su chags par zhugs pa'i
analyzed: phung po snga la dmigs pa can yin par smra'o // ji ste 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa yod par 'dod pa de dag kyang sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir bdag la sogs par lta bar zhugs pa yang yin la sems can la rjes su chags par zhugs pa'i
translated: It is said to focus on the prior aggregates that are appropriated.üîΩIf you assert that those who are free of attachment have love, compassion, and so on, then since they focus on sentient beings, they would engage the view of a self and so on.

original: phyir mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: phyir mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin te /
translated: Since they engage in attachment to sentient beings, they would also have the nature of manifest clinging.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang chags pa can yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang chags pa can yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, even those who are free of attachment would be attached.

original: de'i phyir snying rje la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, compassion and so on are not like that.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi snying rje la sogs pa ni sems can la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi snying rje la sogs pa ni sems can la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Compassion and so on of those free from attachment do not focus on sentient beings.

original: gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos la dmigs pa dag kyang srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos la dmigs pa dag kyang srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are possible in other ways, they are possible in other ways, such as focusing on phenomena.

original: 'di ni mjug thogs su bstan par bya'o //üîΩde la tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog par byed na tshig tsam las ni mi rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te 'di ltar ji ltar chags pa smra ba ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'di ni mjug thogs su bstan par bya'o // de la tshig las 'dod chags rjes su dpog par byed na tshig tsam las ni mi rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te 'di ltar ji ltar chags pa smra ba ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: This will be explained later.üîΩIf attachment is inferred from words, it is not understood from words alone.

original: 'dod chags spangs pa yang de dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags spangs pa yang de dang 'dra bas so //
translated: This is applied to the statement, ‚ÄúJust as one who is attached speaks, one free from attachment speaks in that way.‚Äù

original: tshig tsam las 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig tsam las 'dod chags rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Attachment is not inferred from words alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na 'dod chags kho nas bskyed par bya ba gang yin pa'i tshig khyad par can las so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na 'dod chags kho nas bskyed par bya ba gang yin pa'i tshig khyad par can las so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that attachment is inferred from words that are generated by attachment,

original: de'i phyir khyad par las kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par las kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúNor is it from a distinguishing mark.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na bsam pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na bsam pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why? The thought is difficult to understand.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang chags pa can bzhin du g-yo la chags pa can yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin du g-yo bas bsam pa rtogs par dka'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang chags pa can bzhin du g-yo la chags pa can yang 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin du g-yo bas bsam pa rtogs par dka'o //
translated: Because the thought of one free from attachment is like that of one who is attached, and the thought of one who is attached is like that of one free from attachment, it is difficult to understand.

original: de bas na tha snyad 'chol bas rtags su nye bar bkod pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir khyad par las kyang 'dod chags rjes su dpag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na tha snyad 'chol bas rtags su nye bar bkod pa'i tha snyad thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir khyad par las kyang 'dod chags rjes su dpag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because all the conventions that are adduced as evidence are confused due to the confusion of conventions, attachment is not to be inferred from a distinguishing mark.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de dang 'dra bar smra'o zhes gang bshad pa de la la na @24b 'debs par dogs nas gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de dang 'dra bar smra'o zhes gang bshad pa de la la na @24b 'debs par dogs nas gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Someone might doubt what was said above, namely, that one free from attachment is like that. Anticipating this, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is said that it is not possible because there is no purpose, etc.‚Äù

original: smra ba ni tshig tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba ni tshig tu brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo speak‚Äù means to express in words.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig tu brjod pa la ni 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshig tu brjod pa la ni 'bras bu med do //
translated: There is no purpose in the words of one free from attachment.

original: de lta yin na 'dod chags dang tshig dag la 'khrul pa med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'dod chags dang tshig dag la 'khrul pa med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, there would be no error in saying that the one who is attached and the one who speaks are the same.

original: slob dpon gyis ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Master says, ‚ÄúNo, because...

original: smra ba ni gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir dgos pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba ni gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir dgos pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: ... speaking is not purposeless, since it is for the benefit of others.‚Äù

original: gzhan gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra na ste /
analyzed: gzhan gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra na ste /
translated: If others say, ‚ÄúBecause of being free from attachment, etc.,‚Äù

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzhan dag la yang ma chags pa yin la chags pa med par ni gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yang med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzhan dag la yang ma chags pa yin la chags pa med par ni gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa yang med do snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: the thought is that one who is free from attachment is not attached to others, and that one who is without attachment does not engage in the welfare of others.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because one engages through compassion.

original: gal te snying rje de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na snying rje la 'dod chags zhes ming du 'dogs na de ni 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te snying rje de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na snying rje la 'dod chags zhes ming du 'dogs na de ni 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If you say that compassion itself is attachment, it is acceptable to designate compassion as attachment.

original: gal te snying rje yang sems can du lta ba'i phyir phyin ci log las byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid kyi nyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snying rje yang sems can du lta ba'i phyir phyin ci log las byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid kyi nyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that compassion is a fault, like attachment, because it arises from error, since it views sentient beings,

original: phyin ci ma log pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: [the root text] states, ‚ÄúIt arises from non-error, etc.‚Äù

original: phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir snying rjes ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir snying rjes ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it arises from non-error, [the root text] states, ‚ÄúCompassion arises from non-error, because it is generated by the power of habituation to the view of the reality of suffering.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la nges par rtog pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la nges par rtog pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúMerely by seeing the distinctive aspect of suffering‚Äù means merely by ascertaining the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: goms pa'i stobs las skye ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i skad cig ma rigs mthun pa snga ma snga ma las skyes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs las skye ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i skad cig ma rigs mthun pa snga ma snga ma las skyes pa kho na yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt arises from the power of habituation‚Äù means that it arises only from the prior moments of compassion that are of a similar type.

original: lung dang yang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lung dang yang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to apply scriptural references, [the root text] states, ‚ÄúThus, it is said,‚Äù and so on.

original: byams pa la sogs pa ni byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa ni byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Love, etc. means love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: sems can la dmigs pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The object of sentient beings is that of ordinary beings.

original: chos la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The object of the Dharma is that of noble beings.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dmigs pa med pa dag bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dmigs pa med pa dag bsdu ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the objectless.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The objectless is that of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, who are free from the adherence to grasped and grasper.

original: 'dod pa ni grub pa'i mtha' las so //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni grub pa'i mtha' las so //
translated: The desire is from the philosophy.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩrigs mthun pa la goms pas 'byung ba can zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'i @25a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa'o // rigs mthun pa la goms pas 'byung ba can zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'i @25a * //
translated: And those means love, etc.

original: stobs kyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs kyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They arise from the repeated practice of the same type means that they arise by the power of the previous moments.

original: 'dod chags la ltos pa can ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems can dag la rjes su chags pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags la ltos pa can ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems can dag la rjes su chags pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot dependent on desire‚Äù means that it does not arise through the power of attachment to sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyis goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin te zhes don 'di bshad ma thag pa kho na ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong ba tsam gyis goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin te zhes don 'di bshad ma thag pa kho na ma yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIt arises from the power of habituation, merely through seeing the particular suffering‚Äù means that this is the very meaning that has just been explained.

original: bden na de ni snying rje kho na la brten nas yin la da ni thams cad la brten pa kho nas yin pas khyad par yod do //
analyzed: bden na de ni snying rje kho na la brten nas yin la da ni thams cad la brten pa kho nas yin pas khyad par yod do //
translated: If that is true, then it is only compassion that is the basis, but now it is only the basis of all, so there is a difference.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that desire and so on are also like that,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de ltar 'du byed mthong ba tsam gyis 'jug pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de ltar 'du byed mthong ba tsam gyis 'jug pa ma yin te ;
translated: desire and so on do not operate merely through seeing conditioning in that way,

original: bdag la sogs par phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs par phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist without the error of self and so on.

original: gal te snying rje can gyi rtsom pa byams pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams la 'byung ba 'bras bu med pa yang phyin ci log las yin te /
analyzed: gal te snying rje can gyi rtsom pa byams pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams la 'byung ba 'bras bu med pa yang phyin ci log las yin te /
translated: If the compassionless composition of beings arises due to the power of love and so on, it is also from error.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni rang gi don 'ga' yang med pas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni rang gi don 'ga' yang med pas so //
translated: If the compassionless one‚Äôs composition is due to the power of love, etc., for sentient beings, it is still perverse, because the one free from attachment has no self-interest at all.

original: 'bras bu ni rang gi don kho na yin no snyam du sems na 'di ni nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang gi don kho na yin no snyam du sems na 'di ni nyes pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the result is only one‚Äôs own self-interest, this is not a fault,

original: gzhan gyi don kho na 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don kho na 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result is held to be only the benefit of others.

original: gal te gzhan gyi don 'dod pa la ni rag na 'on kyang 'bras bu nyid go ji ltar snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi don 'dod pa la ni rag na 'on kyang 'bras bu nyid go ji ltar snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that, granted the desire for the benefit of others, how is it the result?

analyzed: de kho na la rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa mthong bas tshig gi rgyu ni brjod par 'dod pa spyi yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tshig gi khyad par ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir rtags nyid du mi rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to //

translated: As such, by the method of explanation, since the desire to express desire itself is obstructed in any generation of words, how could the power of desire be obstructed and still be helpful?

original: 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gang la 'bras bu nyid kyang phan mi 'dogs pa de la ji ltar 'bras bu'i nus pa phan 'dogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gang la 'bras bu nyid kyang phan mi 'dogs pa de la ji ltar 'bras bu'i nus pa phan 'dogs par 'gyur /

original: 'on te nus pa chod pas kyang phan 'dogs na de lta na nus pas phan 'dogs na ni 'dod chags de nyid kyis phan btags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te nus pa chod pas kyang phan 'dogs na de lta na nus pas phan 'dogs na ni 'dod chags de nyid kyis phan btags par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i sgo kho na nas nus phas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zhes brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i bar skabs su bshad zin to //

analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud par byed do //

analyzed: de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rag las pa ma yin pa gzhan ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba yang ma yin te / tshu rol mthong ba'i ma mthong ba tsam gyis nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa'i gzigs pa log pas ni des par 'gyur te ;

original: / de'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la khyab pa yin pas so //
analyzed: / de'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la khyab pa yin pas so //

analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir thams cad gzigs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: yang ci'i phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis med par ma nges she na /

analyzed: de ni 'du bya ba'i dper brjod pa yin no //

original: yul dang dus dag gi ni gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus dag gi ni gzhan du brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: phal cher ni de ltar mi snang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phal cher mngar por mi snang ba ste /
translated: For the most part, it does not appear to be sweet.

original: 'bras bu phal cher bska bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu phal cher bska bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the most part, the fruit appears to be astringent.

original: de ni 'bras bu phal cher mngar por mi snang ba'i phyir la la ni 'bras bu mngar por srid pa spang du ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu phal cher mngar por mi snang ba'i phyir la la ni 'bras bu mngar por srid pa spang du ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Because the fruit is not sweet for the most part, it is not suitable to deny the possibility of a sweet fruit.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags med pa 'ga' zhig la tshig smra ba ma mthong du zin kyang de tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad la smra ba med do zhes bya bar ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags med pa 'ga' zhig la tshig smra ba ma mthong du zin kyang de tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad la smra ba med do zhes bya bar ni nges pa med do //
translated: In the same way, even though one has not seen someone without attachment speak, one cannot conclude that everyone who is free from attachment does not speak.

original: de bas @27a * //
analyzed: de bas @27a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: na tshig tsam ldog par ma nges pa las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: na tshig tsam ldog par ma nges pa las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not certain that desire, etc. are merely verbal expressions, and therefore desire, etc. cannot be inferred.üîΩSince this is so, the reason is stated in the following verse:

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ste /
translated: It is proper to say that a speaker like myself,

original: gang zhig bdag dang 'dra bar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa ni ;
analyzed: gang zhig bdag dang 'dra bar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa ni ;
translated: who is endowed with improper mental activity,

original: 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: is desirous.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags skye bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dod chags skye bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúDesire arises in the desirous one, etc. ‚Äù

original: de yang gang zhig ce na bdag tu lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig ce na bdag tu lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
translated: And what is that? He says, ‚ÄúThe view of self, etc. ‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of self is the perishable collection view.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs par phyin ci log pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs par phyin ci log pa yin te /
translated: Improper mental activity is the error of permanence, pleasure, etc.

original: 'di ni zlas dbye ba'i tshig bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zlas dbye ba'i tshig bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is a compound in which the members are in a relation of mutual dependence.

original: yang na bdag tu lta ba nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no zhes khyad par gyi tshig bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na bdag tu lta ba nyid tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no zhes khyad par gyi tshig bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Or else, the phrase ‚Äúthe view of self‚Äù is a summary of the phrase ‚Äúthe misapprehension of the self.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni zhes khyad par du byed na yang smra ba dper brjod pa ni don med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni zhes khyad par du byed na yang smra ba dper brjod pa ni don med do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat that time‚Äù is a specification of the speaker, ‚Äúlike myself.‚Äù But it is meaningless to cite an example of a speaker.üîΩThe reason, ‚Äúbecause he speaks,‚Äù is meaningless.

original: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di brjod pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di brjod pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what the root text means.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig bdag lta bur tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa de ni 'dod chags can yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig bdag lta bur tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa de ni 'dod chags can yin te /
translated: The reason is this: ‚ÄúWhoever possesses the misapprehension of the self, like myself, is lustful.

original: dper na bdag lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di kho na gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na bdag lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'di kho na gtan tshigs yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, like myself.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ma mthong ba tsam gyis nges pa med pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ma mthong ba tsam gyis nges pa med pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ste /
translated: Since there is no certainty about this matter based on mere non-perception, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe non-perception of the reason in the discordant side.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba ni rtags ldog pa nges par bya ba la gtan tshigs mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba ni rtags ldog pa nges par bya ba la gtan tshigs mi rung ngo //
translated: The reason is not suitable for ascertaining the reversal of the reason in the case of the dissimilar class, because the reason is not seen there.

original: ji ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong bas gtan tshigs 'khrul ba yin na 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni smra ba'ang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ji ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong bas gtan tshigs 'khrul ba yin na 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni smra ba'ang ma mthong ste /
translated: If the reason is mistaken because it is seen in the dissimilar class, then even freedom from attachment is not seen in the speaker.

original: de lta bas na ma mthong ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa grub po snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma mthong ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa grub po snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, if you think that the reversal of the non-existence of the probandum is established because it is not seen,

original: de'i phyir mi mthun phyogs las ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun phyogs las ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: then for that reason it is said that the reason is not non-mistaken merely by not being seen in the dissimilar class.

original: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med pa'o //
translated: The reason is non-mistaken in the dissimilar class.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid phyir //
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid phyir //
translated: Because there is the possibility of mistake.

original: gang la 'khrul pa srid pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'khrul pa srid pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called having the possibility of mistake.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: That is its nature, and that is why.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong du zin kyang 'on kyang de la yod pa mi 'gal @27b bas 'khrul pa srid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong du zin kyang 'on kyang de la yod pa mi 'gal @27b bas 'khrul pa srid do //
translated: Even though one does not see the contrary, it is possible that there is error, because it is not contradictory for it to exist there.

original: phru ba'i 'bras ni phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa'i 'bras te /
analyzed: phru ba'i 'bras ni phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa'i 'bras te /
translated: The rice in the pot is the rice that is in the pot.

original: de dag tshos ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag tshos ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the rice that is cooked.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mang mo zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mang mo zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúA great many of the rice grains are seen to be cooked,‚Äù etc.

original: phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa phal cher tshos pa mthong la /
analyzed: phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa phal cher tshos pa mthong la /
translated: A great many of the rice grains that are in the pot are seen to be cooked.

original: de bzhin du ma tshos pa dag la gtan tshigs phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa nyid ma mthong ba tsam yang yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma tshos pa dag la gtan tshigs phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa nyid ma mthong ba tsam yang yod du zin kyang /
translated: In the same way, even though one does not see the reason, ‚Äúbeing in the pot,‚Äù in the uncooked rice,

original: 'on kyang phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa tsam gyi gtan tshigs kyis ni 'bras lhag ma tshos par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'on kyang phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa tsam gyi gtan tshigs kyis ni 'bras lhag ma tshos par mi 'grub po //
translated: nevertheless, the reason, ‚Äúbeing in the pot,‚Äù does not establish the remaining rice as cooked.

original: 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin yin la zhes bya ba ni tshos par mthong ba gang dag yin pa de dag dang rang bzhin 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin yin la zhes bya ba ni tshos par mthong ba gang dag yin pa de dag dang rang bzhin 'dra ba yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúThose that have such a nature‚Äù are those that are seen to be cooked. They have a nature that is similar to

original: gang dag la tshos pa de dag kho na dang rgyu 'dra ba yod pa de dag ni tshos so zhes bya bar ni rung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag la tshos pa de dag kho na dang rgyu 'dra ba yod pa de dag ni tshos so zhes bya bar ni rung ngo //
translated: Only those that are cooked and that resemble the cause are rightly called cooked.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa nyid tsam gyis thams cad tshos pa sgrub na ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni phru ba'i nang na 'dug pa nyid tsam gyis thams cad tshos pa sgrub na ni /
translated: Otherwise, if all that is in the pot is established as cooked,

original: rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: then the inference would be fallacious, called ‚Äúhaving a remainder.‚ÄùüîΩThe NaiyƒÅyikas state three types of inference for others: having a prior nature, having a remainder, and seeing a universal.

original: rigs pa can gyis rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid snga ma dang ldan pa dang lhag ma dang ldan pa dang spyir mthong ba zhes pa smras pa de la rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ni snga ma dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa can gyis rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid snga ma dang ldan pa dang lhag ma dang ldan pa dang spyir mthong ba zhes pa smras pa de la rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ni snga ma dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Inference of an effect from a cause is having a prior nature,

original: rgyu ni snga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni snga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause exists prior to the effect.

original: rgyu las lus pa ni lhag ma ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu las lus pa ni lhag ma ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: The remainder is the effect that remains from the cause.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa ste /
translated: That which has that is having a remainder.

original: 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu las rgyu rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is the inference of a cause from an effect.

original: de ltar gzhan dag gis lhag ma dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag gis lhag ma dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since others posit a different characteristic of possession of remainder,

original: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is this so-called possession of remainder?‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristic, he says,

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is called possession of remainder‚Äù and so on.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni ma nges pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni ma nges pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúpossession of remainder‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúindeterminate.‚Äù

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig las gtan tshigs log tu zin kyang /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig las gtan tshigs log tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though a reason is sometimes reversed from a discordant class,

original: gang la lhag ma 'khrul par the tshom za ba'i yul yod ba de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la lhag ma 'khrul par the tshom za ba'i yul yod ba de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: that which has an object about which there is doubt as to whether the remainder is mistaken is called ‚Äúpossession of remainder.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gang zhig ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par rab tu sgrub par byed pa de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang zhig ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par rab tu sgrub par byed pa de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since a reason is not a valid cognition merely by not seeing, it is said that ‚Äúit is endowed with a remainder‚Äù in order to establish the reversal from the discordant class.

original: gtan tshigs de'i ldog pa de ni ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang @28a * //üîΩ'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i ldog pa de ni ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang @28a * // 'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that reversal of the reason is uncertain, there is doubt that it engages even in the discordant class.

original: ci ste ma nges she na ldog pa sgrub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci ste ma nges she na ldog pa sgrub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If it is asked why it is uncertain, it is said ‚Äúthe reversal is established,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma mthong ba ni mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Not seeing is non-observation.

original: de yang ldog bsgrub par byed pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ldog bsgrub par byed pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is that also the establishment of the reversal?

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said ‚Äúall non-observations,‚Äù and so on.

original: bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa kho na rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa kho na rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Only the non-observation of what is suitable to appear is a proof.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gcig log par bsgrub par bya ba log pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gcig log par bsgrub par bya ba log pas /
translated: Since the reversal is not merely not seeing in that way, the reversal of what is to be established is reversed.

original: gzhan log par sgrub pa ldog par 'dod pas ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa de gnyis de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan log par sgrub pa ldog par 'dod pas ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa de gnyis de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: One who wishes to refute the establishment of the other by the reverse must accept that the probandum and the proof are related by the character of being identical with it or by the character of one arising from the other.

original: ldog pa tsam 'ga' zhig gis ni mi chog go //
analyzed: ldog pa tsam 'ga' zhig gis ni mi chog go //
translated: It is not sufficient to have a mere reverse.

original: de lta ma yin te 'brel par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te 'brel par mi 'dod na /
translated: If it were not so, if one did not accept a relation,

original: gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: the reason would not be an illuminator,

original: khyab pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na gtan tshigs kyi tshul phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa gsum la'ang slob dpon gyis tshad ma kun nas btus pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: khyab pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na gtan tshigs kyi tshul phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa gsum la'ang slob dpon gyis tshad ma kun nas btus pa la sogs pa las /
translated: because the pervasion is not ascertained.üîΩBecause that is so, the master has stated the certainty in the Nyayavarttika, etc.,

original: gnyi ga la yang rab tu grub pa ni sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas nges pa brjod pa mdzad pa yin no//
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang rab tu grub pa ni sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas nges pa brjod pa mdzad pa yin no//
translated: that the mode of the reason is the property of the subject, the forward pervasion, and the reverse pervasion, saying, ‚ÄúThe proof is the establishment of both.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gi gnyen por zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gi gnyen por zhe na /
translated: What is the antidote to that?

original: ma grub pa bzlog don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma grub pa bzlog don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe purpose of the reversal, etc.‚Äù

original: de ma grub pa'i gnyen por ni phyogs ni phyogs kyi chos nges pa brjod do //
analyzed: de ma grub pa'i gnyen por ni phyogs ni phyogs kyi chos nges pa brjod do //
translated: The antidote to the non-establishment of the property of the subject is the expression of the pervasion.

original: bzlog don ni 'gal ba ste de'i gnyen por ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog don ni 'gal ba ste de'i gnyen por ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The purpose of the reversal is the contradiction; the antidote to that is the forward pervasion.

original: 'khrul pa can ni ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa can ni ma nges pa ste /
translated: The error is the uncertainty;

original: de'i gnyen por ni ldog pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ni ldog pa nges pa'o //
translated: the antidote to that is the expression of the counter pervasion.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa brjod par mdzad pas ni don gyis na 'brel pa yang bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa brjod par mdzad pas ni don gyis na 'brel pa yang bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: By expressing the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion, the relation is implicitly taught.

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa med par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa nges pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa med par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa nges pa med do //
translated: Thus, without a relation, there is no forward pervasion and no counter pervasion.

original: gtan tshigs des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa de nyid ston par mdzad pa na nges par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa de nyid ston par mdzad pa na nges par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the relation characterized by identity and causality is taught, the pervasion is implicitly explained.

original: nyes pa gang zhig gi gnyen por tshul gang zhig nges par bshad ce na /
analyzed: nyes pa gang zhig gi gnyen por tshul gang zhig nges par bshad ce na /
translated: What fault is the antidote to which mode of argumentation?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that, he says:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The words ‚Äúin regard to that‚Äù and so on are stated.

original: 'gal ba dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'gal @28b ba rnams dang / de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams te /üîΩ'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni gang dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ni nges la /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'gal @28b ba rnams dang / de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams te / 'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni gang dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ni nges la /
translated: ‚Äú Contradictory and concordant with that‚Äù means contradictory and concordant with that.üîΩConcordant with the contradictory is that which definitely exists in the discordant side,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ni the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ni the tshom za ba'o //
translated: but is doubtful in the concordant side.

original: de dag ni the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa kho na yin te /
translated: These are only doubtful and indefinite.

original: gzhan dag la grags pas de skad du brjod par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la grags pas de skad du brjod par zad do //
translated: This is stated in terms of what is known to others.

original: ldog pa nges pas ni zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //

analyzed: gang zhig gis mthun pa'i phyogs la yod la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa de ni lhag ma dang ldan pa yin no // gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni gcig la grub pa dgag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga la yang rab tu grub pa ni zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgol ba'am /
translated: When someone infers on the basis of mere presence in similar instances and absence in dissimilar instances, that is called ‚Äúhaving a remainder.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú In both‚Äù means that the establishment in one is negated.

translated: this

analyzed: gang la the tshom za ba dag ce na /

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩlhag ma dang ldan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ba'o //

analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la'o //

analyzed: de lta bas na slob dpon gyis kyang nges pa smos pa'i phyir 'brel ba bzhed pa kho na yin no //

translated: is asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the pervaded.üîΩThe nonobservation of a natureüîΩis asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of a property of that nature.üîΩThe nonobservation of a cause

analyzed: ma nges pa yi ga nyen por 'dod //

analyzed: zhes bya ba de kho nas drang ngo //
translated: is asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the similar instance.üîΩThe nonobservation of a property of the dissimilar instanceüîΩis asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the dissimilar instance.üîΩThe nonobservation of a property of the effectüîΩis asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the effect.üîΩThe nonobservation of a property of the causeüîΩis asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the cause.üîΩThe nonobservation of a property of the essential natureüîΩis asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the essential nature.üîΩThe nonobservation of a property of the pervaderüîΩis asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the pervader.üîΩThe nonobservation of a property of the similar instanceüîΩis asserted to be the proof of the nonexistence of the similar instance.

translated: The nonobservation of a

analyzed: chos mthun pa smos pa ni 'gal ba'i gnyen por ro // gal te ma mthong 'bras can te //

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba grub pa yin no //

translated: If that is true, then still, the words that express the opposite cause one to remember nonseeing.üîΩThus, it is not reasonable to posit memory of that seeing, and to generate memory of that seeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of seeing some object is not a part and is not a proof.üîΩBut in the case of nonseeing, the absence of seeing, it is reasonable to posit memory of that nonseeing, and to generate memory of that nonseeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of nonseeing some object is a part and is a proof.üîΩBut in the case of nonseeing, the absence of seeing, it is reasonable to posit memory of that nonseeing, and to generate memory of that nonseeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of nonseeing some object is a part and is a proof.

translated: But in the case of nonseeing, the absence of seeing, it is reasonable to posit memory of that nonseeing, and to generate memory of that nonseeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of nonseeing some object is a part and is a proof.üîΩBut in the case of nonseeing, the absence of seeing, it is reasonable to posit memory of that nonseeing, and to generate memory of that nonseeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of nonseeing some object is a part and is a proof.üîΩBut in the case of nonseeing, the absence of seeing, it is reasonable to posit memory of that nonseeing, and to generate memory of that nonseeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of nonseeing some object is a part and is a proof.üîΩBut in the case of nonseeing, the absence of seeing, it is reasonable to posit memory of that nonseeing, and to generate memory of that nonseeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of nonseeing some object is a part and is a proof.üîΩBut in the case of nonseeing, the absence of seeing, it is reasonable to posit memory of that nonseeing, and to generate memory of that nonseeing, since the nonapprehension and nonmemory of nonseeing some object is a part and is a proof.

original: de med na ste /
analyzed: de med na ste /
translated: But in the case of nonseeing, the

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs mthong ba med na ma mthong ba grub pa kho na yin pas de grub par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: If one does not see a reason for the discordant side, then one does not see it at all. Therefore, it is in order to establish that.

original: mthong ba med pa grub par bya ba'i phyir chos mi mthun pa brjod pa @29b don med do //üîΩgal te mi dmigs pa'i skyes bu'i de tsam gyi zhes bya ba ste ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med do zhes bya ba de lta bur nges pa ma yin pa nyid de ma mthong ba tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin
analyzed: mthong ba med pa grub par bya ba'i phyir chos mi mthun pa brjod pa @29b don med do // gal te mi dmigs pa'i skyes bu'i de tsam gyi zhes bya ba ste ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med do zhes bya ba de lta bur nges pa ma yin pa nyid de ma mthong ba tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin
translated: It is pointless to state a dissimilar instance in order to establish non-seeing.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one were to say that the mere non-apprehension of a person by someone is the reason for the discordant side, then it would not be certain that the mere non-seeing of that by someone is the reason for the discordant side, because mere non-seeing is the cause of doubt.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir chos mi mthun pa brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nges pa bskyed pa'i phyir chos mi mthun pa brjod do zhe na /

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar med ces bya ba'i tshig tshad ma ma yin pas kyang spang bar bya ba de med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar med ces bya ba'i tshig tshad ma ma yin pas kyang spang bar bya ba de med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is not a valid means of knowledge, that which is to be refuted does not exist at all.

analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na med do zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na smras pa /

analyzed: gal te ji ltar rang bzhin 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gang gis med pa de ltar rigs pa de brjod na /

analyzed: de tshe med ces bya bar rtogs //

analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha dang po 'chad de /

translated: If one does not understand that the mere nonapprehension of something by nonapprehension is its nonexistence,üîΩthen at that time one would not understand even by means of a valid cognition that is a dissimilar example.

original: 'di ltar khyod kyi gzhung lugs kyis chos mi mthun pa smos pa de yang mi dmigs pa kho na rjod par byed pa yin gyi khyad par lhag pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: ji ste chos mi mthun pa smos pas na gtan tshigs med pa bsgrub par bya ba med pas byas pa brjod pa med de /
translated: If you say that because of the mention of a dissimilar instance, the reason is nonexistent, and because the probandum is nonexistent, the expression ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is meaningless,

original: de'i phyir khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par yod do zhe na /

original: de'i phyir gcig mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the expression ‚Äúnonobservation of one‚Äù means the nonobservation of the probandum.

original: gzhan med pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan med pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa med pa ste /
translated: The expression ‚Äúnonexistence of another‚Äù means the nonexistence of the proof.

original: 'brel pa med na zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med na zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that if there is no relation,üîΩbecause of the absurdity of the consequence.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med par ldog na ni ba lang log pas kyang rta gdon mi za bar ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med par ldog na ni ba lang log pas kyang rta gdon mi za bar ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no relation and the reversal occurs, then even the reversal of the cow would certainly bring about the reversal of the horse.

original: ji ste rgol ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa la mi slu bar mthong la /
analyzed: ji ste rgol ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa la mi slu bar mthong la /
translated: If you maintain that the statement of the opponent is not deceptive with regard to the property of the subject and so on,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med do zhes bya ba yang rgol ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med do zhes bya ba yang rgol ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: and that the statement of the opponent is also that the reason does not exist in the dissimilar instance,

original: de'i phyir nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: then it would be ascertained.

original: de'i phyir nges med do zhes brjod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges med do zhes brjod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: rgol ba des med do zhes brjod par byas pa gang yin pa des de ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dngos po med pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ba ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir @30a * //
analyzed: rgol ba des med do zhes brjod par byas pa gang yin pa des de ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dngos po med pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ba ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir @30a * //

original: ro ; / de'i tshe tshad ma nyid gcig yin na ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis kyang thams cad grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro ; / de'i tshe tshad ma nyid gcig yin na ni dam bcas pa tsam gyis kyang thams cad grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a valid cognition, then everything would be established by a mere thesis.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na ji ltar chos mi mthun pa smos pas ma nges pa spangs pa yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na ji ltar chos mi mthun pa smos pas ma nges pa spangs pa yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since it is not so, how could the statement of a dissimilar example avoid being indeterminate?

original: de lta bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog par 'dod pas ldog pa de la gang gis na zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog par 'dod pas ldog pa de la gang gis na zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to have a reason that is the opposite of the discordant class must state the reason that is the opposite of the discordant class.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba la rigs pa brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba la rigs pa brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: In this regard, one must state the reason for understanding.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag 'brel pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag 'brel pa brjod dgos so //
translated: The relation between the probandum and the probans must be stated.

original: gzhan gyis de med pa la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de med pa la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The other party says, ‚ÄúIn the absence of that,‚Äù

original: de med pa la bsgrub par bya ba med pa la mi dmigs pas gtan tshigs ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam 'di nyid rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pa la bsgrub par bya ba med pa la mi dmigs pas gtan tshigs ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam 'di nyid rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the absence of that,‚Äù i.e., in the absence of the probandum, the non-apprehension of the probans is not established as the pervasion. This is the correct reasoning.

original: 'di ni mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min ba zhes bya ba des lan btab zin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min ba zhes bya ba des lan btab zin pa nyid yin te /
translated: This has already been answered by the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not non-erroneous by merely not seeing the discordant side.‚Äù

original: khas blangs nas brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do /
analyzed: khas blangs nas brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do /
translated: It is merely a statement of acceptance.

original: gal te ma mthong bas gtan tshigs ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe ste gtan tshigs lhag ldan 'khrul can yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas gtan tshigs ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe ste gtan tshigs lhag ldan 'khrul can yin te /
translated: If the pervasion of the probans were by non-apprehension, then it would be fallacious, i.e., the probans would be fallacious.

original: 'khrul pa can ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa can ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be fallacious at all.

original: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And what is that like? It is said ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni zos pa las gzhan pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni zos pa las gzhan pa dag ste /
translated: These effects are other than what is eaten.

original: 'di ni chos can bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chos can bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the subject.

original: smin pa'am ro 'di bro ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: smin pa'am ro 'di bro ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gnyis bstan te /
translated: The two properties to be established are presented by the distinction ‚Äúripening‚Äù or ‚Äútaste.‚Äù

original: ro 'di bro ba zhes bya ba ni mngar ba'am skyur ba'o //
analyzed: ro 'di bro ba zhes bya ba ni mngar ba'am skyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTaste‚Äù means sweet or sour.

original: gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zos pa'i gzugs dmar ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang gzugs 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zos pa'i gzugs dmar ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang gzugs 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the similarity of form, because of the similarity of form to that which is red, etc., of the effect that is eaten.

original: gcig las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shing gcig las skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shing gcig las skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the similarity of origin, because of the similarity of origin from one tree.

original: bye brag 'di dag gis ni gtan tshigs gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: bye brag 'di dag gis ni gtan tshigs gnyis bstan to //
translated: By these distinctions, two reasons are presented.

original: zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike what is eaten‚Äù is the example.

original: ci'i phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par 'dod na lhag ma dang ldan pa yang 'khrul pa med pa can nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par 'dod na lhag ma dang ldan pa yang 'khrul pa med pa can nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that mere non-observation is accepted as a reason, but not the possession of the remainder?

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated:

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di la yang brjod par 'dod pa ste /üîΩzos pa las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu gzugs kyi khyad par la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ma @30b lus par phyogs su byas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'di la yang brjod par 'dod pa ste / zos pa las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu gzugs kyi khyad par la sogs pa dang ldan pa de ma @30b lus par phyogs su byas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In this, too, the desired object,üîΩthe particular form, etc., that is the effect of eating, is not entirely included in the subject.

original: smin pa la sogs pa med pa gtan tshigs gzugs kyi khyad par la sogs pa mi dmigs pa yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smin pa la sogs pa med pa gtan tshigs gzugs kyi khyad par la sogs pa mi dmigs pa yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the non-observation of the effect, etc., is present, the reason, the non-observation of the particular form, etc., does not turn away from the discordant side.

original: de'i 'khrul pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'khrul pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it would be non-erroneous.

original: 'di ltar phyogs su byas pa brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du gzung ba zos pa gang yin pa de la ma gtogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa phung po gsum pa la ni skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs su byas pa brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du gzung ba zos pa gang yin pa de la ma gtogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa phung po gsum pa la ni skad bshad pa'i gtan tshigs 'jug pa med do //
translated: In this way, the desired effect that is the object of the subject and the eating that is taken as the similar class are not excluded from the third category, the discordant side. The stated reason does not apply to that.

original: kha cig na re mngon gsum gyis gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kha cig re res 'ga' gcig la skyes pa'i 'bras bu la yang ma smin pa'am /
analyzed: kha cig na re mngon gsum gyis gnod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kha cig re res 'ga' gcig la skyes pa'i 'bras bu la yang ma smin pa'am /
translated: Some say: The statement that it is harmed by direct perception refers to the fact that some results generated in some beings do not ripen.

original: de mi bro ba mngon sum du nyams su myong ba srid pa'i phyir /üîΩmngon sum gyis gnod par dogs te /
analyzed: de mi bro ba mngon sum du nyams su myong ba srid pa'i phyir / mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs te /
translated: Some say: The statement ‚Äúit is undermined by direct perception‚Äù means that it is possible that the result of an action that has arisen in some person is not experienced or is experienced as unpleasant.üîΩThus, it is suspected that it is undermined by direct perception.

original: de nyid lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nyid lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: That is a mistake because it is associated with a remainder.

original: de ni de lha ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lha ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ro la sogs pa mngon sum du ma byas pa la ni rjes su dpag pa kho na 'jug pas phyogs su byas pa'i yul bsgrub par bya ba nyid du gzung ba la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa mngon sum du ma byas pa la ni rjes su dpag pa kho na 'jug pas phyogs su byas pa'i yul bsgrub par bya ba nyid du gzung ba la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Inference alone engages objects that are not directly perceived, such as the taste of a fruit. Therefore, it is not undermined by direct perception with regard to the object that is held to be the probandum.

original: ji ste mngon sum zhugs pas gnod par dogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ste mngon sum zhugs pas gnod par dogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not suspected that it is undermined by direct perception.

original: 'on kyang gal te na mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te na mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: However, if it is undermined by direct perception,

original: de lta bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the statement ‚Äúit is undermined by direct perception‚Äù is made.

original: de lta bus dogs na zhes bya ba ni gal te mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur bar dogs na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus dogs na zhes bya ba ni gal te mngon sum gyis gnod par 'gyur bar dogs na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if you fear that a valid cognition will contradict, then there is an absurdity.

original: 'di ltar mi 'khrul par mngon par 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan la yang mngon sum gyis gnod par nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi 'khrul par mngon par 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan la yang mngon sum gyis gnod par nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not certain that a valid cognition will contradict another reason that is accepted as nondeceptive.

original: pha rol po 'brel pa khas mi len na gnod par dogs pa mi ldog go snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po 'brel pa khas mi len na gnod par dogs pa mi ldog go snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: If the opponent does not accept the relation, the fear of contradiction is not averted.

original: de lta bas na tshad ma zhugs shing rab tu zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad ma zhugs shing rab tu zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that a valid cognition that engages and fully engages contradicts.

original: ma zhugs par gnod na ste /
analyzed: ma zhugs par gnod na ste /
translated: If it contradicts without engaging,

original: tshad ma ma byung ba kho nar gnod na ni thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshad ma ma byung ba kho nar gnod na ni thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
translated: if it contradicts only when a valid cognition has not arisen, then it is not reliable in all cases.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa la ni tshad ma zhugs pa'i gnod par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa la ni tshad ma zhugs pa'i gnod par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it has a remainder, then even a valid cognition that engages does not contradict.

original: de lta bas na ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa yin na lhag ma dang ldan pa yang 'khrul pa nyid du gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa @31a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa yin na lhag ma dang ldan pa yang 'khrul pa nyid du gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa @31a * //
translated: Therefore, if the reversal is merely non-seeing, then the possession of the remainder would be a mistake.üîΩThis is the point.

original: yin no // gal te ma mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin pas /
analyzed: yin no // gal te ma mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin pas /
translated: If non-seeing is the absence of seeing,

original: de la ni dran pa bskyed pa la ltos mi dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de la ni dran pa bskyed pa la ltos mi dgos so zhe na /
translated: then it does not need to depend on the production of memory.

original: 'o na ni khyod kyis bshad pa ldog pa la yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni khyod kyis bshad pa ldog pa la yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then, for you, the reversal would be similar.

original: de'i phyir bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe reversal of the reason from the discordant side,‚Äù etc.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa kho na ste des pa kho na sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa kho na ste des pa kho na sgrub pa yin no //
translated: That reversal which is the reason is just established, and by that alone the proof is established.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir de lta bu'i bo bo ni nges pa la ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir de lta bu'i bo bo ni nges pa la ste /
translated: For that reason, the subject in that way is ascertained.

original: ldog pa'i ngo bo ni nges pa la ltos so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i ngo bo ni nges pa la ltos so //
translated: The nature of the reversal depends on ascertainment.

original: de ni 'di skad du kho bo cag gi ldog pa ni khyod kyi lta bur mthong ba med pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du kho bo cag gi ldog pa ni khyod kyi lta bur mthong ba med pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: This is what it says: ‚ÄúOur reversal is not merely the absence of seeing, as in your case.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag 'brel pa yod la /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa rang la yod pa'i chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag 'brel pa yod la / bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa rang la yod pa'i chos nyid yin no //
translated: However, the probandum and the proof are related.üîΩIf the probandum does not exist, the reason is not a property of the dissimilar instances.

original: gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang gdon mi za bar rang nges pa la ltos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de yang gdon mi za bar rang nges pa la ltos te /
translated: Moreover, the nature of the reason must certainly depend on its own ascertainment.

original: shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is what causes understanding.

original: gal te khyod kyi gzhung lugs ltar na yang ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi gzhung lugs ltar na yang ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa 'khrul pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If, according to your system, how is it that the possession of a remainder is mistaken?

original: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not by way of non-apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa la ji skad bshad pa lta bu'i ldog pa ni med do //
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa la ji skad bshad pa lta bu'i ldog pa ni med do //
translated: The possession of a remainder does not have the exclusion as explained above.

original: 'o na ci zhe na mi dmigs pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na mi dmigs pa tsam du zad do //
translated: What is it, then? It is simply non-apprehension.

original: de lta bas na mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig la gtan tshigs med par grub tu zin kyang /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig la gtan tshigs med par grub tu zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, although by way of non-apprehension, it is established that the reason does not exist in some dissimilar instances,

original: gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa med pa ni sgrub par byed pa de med kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i dngos po thams cad la med par mi 'grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa med pa ni sgrub par byed pa de med kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba'i dngos po thams cad la med par mi 'grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: The reason is not related to the probandum, because the probative reason is not established as absent in all things that are discordant with it.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa gang yin pa de nyid lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absence of the reason in the discordant class is uncertain.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa gzhan bsags pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyes pa gzhan bsags pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, there is another fault.

original: gal te ma mthong bas ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas ldog pa yin na /
translated: If the reason is absent because it is not seen,

original: de'i tshe ldog pa can yang gtan tshigs 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe ldog pa can yang gtan tshigs 'gyur /
translated: then the presence of the reason would be the logical reason.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: gson po'i lus 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gson po'i lus 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThis living body . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ni thal bar 'gyur pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thal bar 'gyur pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained by way of reductio.

original: sbyor ba ni gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: This living body has a self,üîΩbecause it is a living body.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: because it possesses life, etc.

original: 'di ltar bdag med pa ni bdag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag med pa ni bdag dang bral ba'o //
translated: Thus, the absence of self is the absence of a self.

original: 'di @31b yang ma mthong ba chad mar byas nas gzhan gyi gzhung lugs su bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di @31b yang ma mthong ba chad mar byas nas gzhan gyi gzhung lugs su bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is also an explanation of the opponent‚Äôs doctrine, which is based on the non-perception of the self.

original: de lta ma yin na bum pa la sogs pa yang ji ltar bdag med pa yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bum pa la sogs pa yang ji ltar bdag med pa yin /
translated: Otherwise, how could a pot, etc. be without a self?

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog dang dbugs rngub pa dang / 'dzums pa dang 'byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog dang dbugs rngub pa dang / 'dzums pa dang 'byed pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because life, etc. are not perceived in the seen and the unseen, i.e., because life, inhalation and exhalation, closing and opening of the eyes are not perceived.

original: mthong ba dag la ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho nas ma mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dag la ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho nas ma mthong ba yin te /
translated: In the seen, they are not perceived only because of the non-apprehension of their intrinsic nature.

original: srog la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because life, etc. are modifications that have the characteristic of being perceived.

original: ma mthong ba dag la yang de dang rigs mthun pas so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dag la yang de dang rigs mthun pas so //
translated: And in the unseen, they are not perceived because of their similarity to that.

original: de las log pas zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa de las srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis log pas gson pa'i lus la bdag yod par rtogs par 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: de las log pas zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa de las srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis log pas gson pa'i lus la bdag yod par rtogs par 'gyur ro / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: the self is understood to exist in the living body, since life and so on are seen to be the opposite of that selflessness.üîΩIf, according to you, it is the cause of doubt,

original: gal te khyod kyi ltar na ji ltar the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi ltar na ji ltar the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: why is it not the cause of the ascertainment of the self?

original: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since the unobservable is not perceived,

original: bdag bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas bum pa la sogs pa la med par ma grub na /
analyzed: bdag bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas bum pa la sogs pa la med par ma grub na /
translated: if the unobservable self is not established as nonexistent in a pot and so on,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog ba med do //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag med pa las srog la sogs pa ldog ba med do //
translated: since the reason that a pot and so on are not established as selfless is not established, life and so on are not seen to be the opposite of selflessness.

original: bum pa la sogs pa las srog la sogs pa log tu zin kyang /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa las srog la sogs pa log tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though life and so on are seen to be the opposite of a pot and so on,

original: 'on kyang bdag med pa las log go zhes bya ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag med pa las log go zhes bya ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: nevertheless, it is not the case that they are seen to be the opposite of selflessness.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pas bdag med par khas blangs te /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pas bdag med par khas blangs te /
translated: If the Buddhist accepts selflessness,

original: de bas na khas blangs pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa nyid du 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na khas blangs pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa nyid du 'grub po zhe na /
