translated: Therefore, because of the acceptance of the Buddhist, the non-self of the pot, etc. is established.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa tshad ma yin na /
translated: If the acceptance of the Buddhist is valid cognition,

original: da ni ji ltar na gson po'i lus la bdag 'grub ste /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na gson po'i lus la bdag 'grub ste /
translated: then how is the self established in the living body?

original: sangs rgyas pa ni de yang bdag med par 'dod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa ni de yang bdag med par 'dod do //
translated: The Buddhist accepts that the living body is non-self.

original: gson po'i lus la bdag med par khas len pa ni tshad ma ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di ni bdag med par mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la bdag med par khas len pa ni tshad ma ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di ni bdag med par mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: Since the acceptance of the non-self of the living body is not valid cognition, therefore it is not accepted that it is non-self.

original: gal te de lta na gzhan te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gzhan te /
translated: If that is so, then it is different.

original: gson po'i lus las gzhan ba bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa tshad ma ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gson po'i lus las gzhan ba bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa tshad ma ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How is the non-self of the pot, etc., which is different from the living body, established by invalid cognition?

original: sangs rgyas pa'i khas blangs pa kha cig tu tshad ma yin la kha cig tu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i khas blangs pa kha cig tu tshad ma yin la kha cig tu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to say that the acceptance of the Buddhist is valid cognition in some cases and not valid cognition in other cases.

original: ji ste gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas par kho bo 'dod pas de'i phyir 'di ni bdag med pa ma @32a * //
analyzed: ji ste gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas par kho bo 'dod pas de'i phyir 'di ni bdag med pa ma @32a * //
translated: But we maintain that the living body is endowed with a self, so it is not without a self.

original: yin no // bum pa la sogs pa ni gnyi gas kyang bdag med par khas blangs so zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // bum pa la sogs pa ni gnyi gas kyang bdag med par khas blangs so zhe na /
translated: But a pot, etc. are without a self, as both of you agree.

original: de'i phyir khas blangs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩbdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa dag rnam par phye nas zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khas blangs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa dag rnam par phye nas zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause of your assertion, etc.üîΩHaving distinguished that which is endowed with a self from that which is without a self, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med pa'o zhes rnam par dbye ba byas nas so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med pa'o zhes rnam par dbye ba byas nas so //
translated: The living body is endowed with a self, but a pot, etc. are without a self.

original: bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa de la srog la sogs pa med pas rtogs par byed pa nyid yin par rjod par byed pa gzhan gyis kyang bdag lung las byung ba nyid de lung gis grub pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa de la srog la sogs pa med pas rtogs par byed pa nyid yin par rjod par byed pa gzhan gyis kyang bdag lung las byung ba nyid de lung gis grub pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Having made this distinction, he says, ‚Äúbecause of your assertion that a pot, etc. are without a self, you are forced to admit that the self exists, since you are compelled to accept that the self exists in the living body, which is endowed with a self.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But the self is not an object of inference.

original: de lta bas na bum pa la sogs pa la bdag bltar mi rung ba'i rang bzhin ma mthong du zin kyang bdag ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir bdag med pa gang las kyang srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pas rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid
analyzed: de lta bas na bum pa la sogs pa la bdag bltar mi rung ba'i rang bzhin ma mthong du zin kyang bdag ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir bdag med pa gang las kyang srog la sogs pa ldog pa med pas rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid
translated: Thus, although the self is not seen in a vase, etc., since the self is not established as reversed, the self does not exist, and since life, etc. are not reversed from anything, they are not established.

original: de / de ltar na re zhig bdag ni gang las kyang ldog pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de / de ltar na re zhig bdag ni gang las kyang ldog pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the self is not established as reversed from anything.

original: khas blangs te yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khas blangs te yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having accepted that, we say this:

original: 'ga' zhig la bum pa la sogs pa mthong pa la'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la bum pa la sogs pa mthong pa la'o //
translated: If a vase, etc. is seen by someone,

original: de log ste bdag log ste srog la sogs pa log kyang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de log ste bdag log ste srog la sogs pa log kyang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: then it is reversed, and the self is reversed, and life, etc. are reversed, but since they are not related,

original: bdag dang lhan cig 'brel ba med pa'i phyir thams cad la ste /
analyzed: bdag dang lhan cig 'brel ba med pa'i phyir thams cad la ste /
translated: since they are not related to the self, all of them

original: bum pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba la yang dag log pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa mi 'grub pas /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba la yang dag log pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa mi 'grub pas /
translated: are not established as reversed by the correct or incorrect seeing of a vase, etc.

original: ldog pas la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ldog pas la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Since they are reversed, there is doubt, and therefore they are not established.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par khas len na nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod pas gang yang mi 'grub pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par khas len na nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod pas gang yang mi 'grub pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If you accept that the reason is refuted merely by not being seen, then there is this other fault.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the same way, the master says, ‚ÄúIf it exists in the similar instances and does not exist in the dissimilar instances,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni slob dpon gyi gzhung yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon gyi gzhung yin no //
translated: This is the master‚Äôs own position.

original: de las ni phyogs kyi chos ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la des par gzung ngo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de las ni phyogs kyi chos ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la des par gzung ngo zhes bshad de /
translated: In that text, it says, ‚ÄúThe property of the subject is ascertained by the proponent and the opponent.‚Äù

original: des ni gnyi ga'am gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / gzhi ma grub pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni gnyi ga'am gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / gzhi ma grub pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: This eliminates the nonestablished and the doubted by either one, and the nonestablished base.

original: ji ltar phyogs kyi chos nges pa ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi bsal ba de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa des pas ma grub pa'i rnam pa bsal baüîΩ@32b yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar phyogs kyi chos nges pa ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi bsal ba de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa des pas ma grub pa'i rnam pa bsal ba @32b yin no //
translated: Just as the four types of non-establishment of the property of the position are eliminated, in the same way, the non-establishment of the pervasion by the existence and non-existence in the similar class, etc. is eliminated.

original: ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should say as appropriate with regard to:

original: ma grub sbyar ba de yang brjod bya min //
analyzed: ma grub sbyar ba de yang brjod bya min //
translated: The non-establishment applied to that is not the object of expression.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show that, it is said, It is only non-apprehension, and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa kho nar zad pa yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa kho nar zad pa yin na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i phyir ro /
translated: If non-apprehension were only not a valid means of knowledge, then there would be doubt about the reason in the discordant class.

original: ji lta zhe na dmigs na de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na dmigs na de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: How so? Because if it is apprehended, it does not exist.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs dmigs na the tshom de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs dmigs na the tshom de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the reason is apprehended in the discordant class, then that doubt does not exist.

original: de lta bas na mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of non-apprehension,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog go zhes byas na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog go zhes byas na /
translated: If you say that the reason is reversed with respect to the discordant side,

original: don gyi ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs 'dod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: don gyi ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs 'dod pa kho na yin no //
translated: then you are asserting a reason that is doubtful with respect to the reversal of the meaning.

original: de bas na the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even if it is doubtful, it is not reversed,

original: the tshom gyi yul du byas shing the tshom du gyur pa'i ldog pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyi yul du byas shing the tshom du gyur pa'i ldog pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the reversal of the doubt is not reversed.

original: gal te ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes byung bas ci rigs par zhes smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes byung bas ci rigs par zhes smos pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that it is just that, because it is said that it should be stated as appropriate, it is stated as appropriate,

original: the tshom du gyur pa ma bzlog pa de kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pa ma bzlog pa de kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: then the doubt is not reversed.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te ;
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te ;
translated: That is not so,

original: / de'i mjug thogs te kho nar brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la des pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: / de'i mjug thogs te kho nar brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la des pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because immediately after that, it says, ‚ÄúWhatever is stated as appropriate is only stated as appropriate,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa'i tshul gsum pa dang ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa rjod par byed pa de kho na ma grub pa dang / sun 'byin pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sgra gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa'i tshul gsum pa dang ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa rjod par byed pa de kho na ma grub pa dang / sun 'byin pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The third, the inconclusive, is that which expresses a reason that is not established for both parties, such as ‚Äúbecause of nonestablishment‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of refutation.‚Äù

original: / gal te ldog pa la the tshom za ba gtan tshigs yin par bzhed ba zhig tu gyur na ni /
analyzed: / gal te ldog pa la the tshom za ba gtan tshigs yin par bzhed ba zhig tu gyur na ni /
translated: If one maintained that a reason that is doubted as to its presence in the dissimilar instances is a correct reason,

original: des pa zhes bya ba smos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des pa zhes bya ba smos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be necessary to mention ‚Äúthe virtuous one.‚Äù

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba smos pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chos can ma grub pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba smos pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chos can ma grub pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas is appropriate‚Äù is used to avoid the fault of the subject not being established for either party.

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa tsam gyis nges pa med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa tsam gyis nges pa med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no certainty from mere nonobservation,

original: slob dpon gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par de dgongs te dgag par the tshom du gyur pa dgag par nges pa zhes smos pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par de dgongs te dgag par the tshom du gyur pa dgag par nges pa zhes smos pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] thought that although the reason is not observed with regard to the discordant class, there is doubt, and thus he stated ‚Äúcertainty‚Äù in order to refute doubt with regard to the absence of the reason in the discordant class.

original: gzhan yang gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if one asserts that the absence of the reason is due to not seeing it,

original: khyad par te mnyan par bya ba nyid la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par te mnyan par bya ba nyid la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: then it becomes a reason that excludes the uncommon property, such as being audible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag lam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag lam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because permanence and impermanence are seen in the path.

original: da mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: da mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: Now, ‚Äúbeing audible‚Äù and so on are taught.

original: de ltar @33a * //
analyzed: de ltar @33a * //
translated: Thus,

original: ma mthong ba tsam las ldog par 'dod na rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dag la yang mnyan par bya ba nyid ma mthong ba yod pas /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam las ldog par 'dod na rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dag la yang mnyan par bya ba nyid ma mthong ba yod pas /
translated: if one asserts that the absence of the reason is due to merely not seeing it, then since being audible is not seen in permanent and impermanent things,

original: de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: They are the very reason for the exclusion of those.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dgag pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dgag pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: They are the very reason for the exclusion of permanent and impermanent.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las mnyan par bya ba nyid log tu zin mod /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las mnyan par bya ba nyid log tu zin mod /
translated: Granted that the quality of being heard is excluded from permanent and impermanent,üîΩbut why is the exclusion of those understood?

original: de dag rnam par gcod pa go ci'i phyir rtogs par byed ce na rnam par gcod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩma par gcod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rnam par gcod pa go ci'i phyir rtogs par byed ce na rnam par gcod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ma par gcod pa ste /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúExclusion is the very reason for the exclusion of those,‚Äù and so on.üîΩExclusion is the very reason for the exclusion of those.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las log pa las te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las log pa las te /
translated: The exclusion of permanent and impermanent is from those, i.e., from permanent and impermanent.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las ldog pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is not other than the exclusion of permanent and impermanent.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig la de log pa'i chos yod la de dag rnam par gcod pa dang ldan pa ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe de las ma log pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig la de log pa'i chos yod la de dag rnam par gcod pa dang ldan pa ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe de las ma log pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If something has a quality that is the opposite of those, but does not have the exclusion of those, then at that time it would not be the opposite of those.

original: gal te khyod kyi ltar na yang mnyan par bya ba nyid ji ltar rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi ltar na yang mnyan par bya ba nyid ji ltar rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin zhe na /
translated: If, according to you, the reason is not an exclusion, then how is it that what is to be heard is not an exclusion?

original: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not an exclusion,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa nyid nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las te ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa nyid nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú From anything‚Äù means from permanent or impermanent. It is not ascertained that the mere non-seeing of something is an exclusion.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta yin no //üîΩde ltar ma yin na chos can 'ga' zhig la chos gang zhig gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de yod na ji ltar de med par te /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta yin no // de ltar ma yin na chos can 'ga' zhig la chos gang zhig gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de yod na ji ltar de med par te /
translated: That is undoubtedly the case.üîΩIf it were not so, then if it were ascertained that some property does not exist in some subject, how could one not understand that it does not exist in that subject?

original: gang la med do zhes bya ba des pa de med par rtogs par mi byed /
analyzed: gang la med do zhes bya ba des pa de med par rtogs par mi byed /
translated: How could one not understand that the property does not exist in that subject, since it is ascertained that it does not exist in that subject?

original: mnyan par byed pa nyid ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i mtshan ma 'jug pas rtag pa las ldog pa yod pa de kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mnyan par byed pa nyid ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i mtshan ma 'jug pas rtag pa las ldog pa yod pa de kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the quality of being audible is a property of things, like being produced and so on, it is undermined by the evidence of permanence.

original: bden na 'on kyang gzhan dag rtag pa yang dngos por 'dod de /
analyzed: bden na 'on kyang gzhan dag rtag pa yang dngos por 'dod de /
translated: But, although this is true, others assert that permanence is a thing.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa dngos po'i chos yin pa gdon mi za bar dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la 'jug pas 'di ni gzhan gyi lta ba la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa dngos po'i chos yin pa gdon mi za bar dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig la 'jug pas 'di ni gzhan gyi lta ba la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the quality of being a thing is not shared by all things, it is certainly the case that the evidence of being a thing is undermined by the evidence of permanence.

original: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog kyang gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa bsgrub byar tshad ma gzhan gnod par dogs so //
analyzed: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag las ldog kyang gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa bsgrub byar tshad ma gzhan gnod par dogs so //
translated: But even if being audible is undermined by both permanence and impermanence, still, we fear that another proof that excludes both permanence and impermanence will be established.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni ji ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni ji ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is ‚ÄúIf it is said that sound is impermanent because it is produced, then the evidence is not established.‚Äù

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa yin na ste /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid kyis gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa yin na ste /
translated: If it were to eliminate both by virtue of being heard,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa @33b rnam par gcod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa @33b rnam par gcod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: then if permanence and impermanence were the object to be established,

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do //
translated: there would be another valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: gnod par byed pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that contradiction?

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúmutually,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag la phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have the nature of mutual exclusion are called that.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid ni rtag pa nyid rnam par gcod pa rtag pa nyid kyang de rnam par gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid ni rtag pa nyid rnam par gcod pa rtag pa nyid kyang de rnam par gcod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, impermanence excludes permanence, and permanence excludes impermanence.

original: de dag ni gcig rnam par bcad pas gzhan bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni gcig rnam par bcad pas gzhan bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are because one is affirmed by the exclusion of the other.

original: zla bo gnyis pa sgrub pa'i phyir dgag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zla bo gnyis pa sgrub pa'i phyir dgag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a negation that affirms a second alternative.

original: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa las log pas de rnam par gcod par byed pa de nyid kyi tshe mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa las log pas de rnam par gcod par byed pa de nyid kyi tshe mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par 'gyur la /
translated: If being heard were to eliminate permanence by being the opposite of permanence, at that very time impermanence would be established.

original: de nyid kyi tshe mi rtag pa las kyang log par mi rtag pa dgag pa dang mi rtag pa sgrub par yang byed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig la dus gcig tu dgag pa dang / bsgrub pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe mi rtag pa las kyang log par mi rtag pa dgag pa dang mi rtag pa sgrub par yang byed pa yin pa'i phyir gcig la dus gcig tu dgag pa dang / bsgrub pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, it would also be the case that impermanence would be refuted and impermanence would be established, and thus negation and affirmation would occur simultaneously with respect to one thing.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable.

original: gcig la dgag pa dang bsgrub pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la dgag pa dang bsgrub pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because negation and affirmation are mutually exclusive.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yang 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: A valid cognition that contradicts is to be applied in the following way:

original: 'gal ba gang yin pa de ni gcig la cig car mi srid de /
analyzed: 'gal ba gang yin pa de ni gcig la cig car mi srid de /
translated: Whatever is contradictory cannot occur simultaneously with respect to one thing,

original: dper na grang ba dang dro ba dag lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na grang ba dang dro ba dag lta bu yin la /
translated: like heat and cold.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag rnam par gcod pa yang dus gcig tu chos can gcig la 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag rnam par gcod pa yang dus gcig tu chos can gcig la 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yin no //
translated: As explained, the exclusion of permanence and impermanence is contradictory with respect to one basis at one time. This is the contradiction of the pervasion.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says,

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNow, if you say . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni gnod pa yod pa yin na'o //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni gnod pa yod pa yin na'o //
translated: Now, if there is the possibility of refutation, then.

original: ma mthong ba las te mthong ba med pa las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba las te mthong ba med pa las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med pa yin no //
translated: From non-perception, i.e., from the absence of perception, there is no reason for the counter-position.

original: gal te 'di ltar gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin na mnyan par bya ba nyid kho na tshad ma ma yin par zad kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin na mnyan par bya ba nyid kho na tshad ma ma yin par zad kyi /
translated: If, in this way, non-perception is not a valid cognition because of the possibility of refutation, then only what is to be heard is not a valid cognition,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not the other.

original: de bzhin du ni gzhan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzhan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the same way, in the case of the other, etc.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan la yang ldog pa bsgrub pa ma mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan la yang ldog pa bsgrub pa ma mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid do //
translated: In the case of the other reason, too, there is the possibility of refutation by another valid cognition of the non-perception of the pervasion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, because of the characteristic, etc.

original: gtan tshigs ma mthong pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi ma mthong ba gang yin @34a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma mthong pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi ma mthong ba gang yin @34a * //
translated: The reason is not seen in the dissimilar class, and that is the definition of the reason.

original: ba de la gnod pa srid pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ba de la gnod pa srid pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is possible that the reason is contradicted,

original: de'i mtshan nyid de ldog pa sgrub pa de'i mtshan nyid yul thams cad pa sun phyung ba kho nar gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid de ldog pa sgrub pa de'i mtshan nyid yul thams cad pa sun phyung ba kho nar gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
translated: then the proof of the reversal of that definition is the refutation of the definition of the reason as being present in all objects, and therefore it is not to be trusted in all cases.

original: gal te de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang kha cig la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong ba mthong ste 'di ltar sgra ni rtag pa ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid lta bu'o zhes byas na rtag pa
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang kha cig la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong ba mthong ste 'di ltar sgra ni rtag pa ste mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid lta bu'o zhes byas na rtag pa
translated: If that is so, then the object of inference is sometimes seen to be contradicted by perception and inference, for example, when it is said, ‚ÄúSound is permanent because it is audible, like sound itself.‚ÄùüîΩThe permanence of sound is contradicted by inference,

original: nyid rjes su dpag pas gnod pa dang / de bzhin du sgra ni mnyan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyid rjes su dpag pas gnod pa dang / de bzhin du sgra ni mnyan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: and likewise, sound is not audible,

original: yod pa'i phyir bum pa lta bu'o zhes byas na mngon sum gyis gnod do //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir bum pa lta bu'o zhes byas na mngon sum gyis gnod do //
translated: If you say that it is like a pot, because it exists, you are contradicted by perception.

original: de'i phyir thams cad la de dang mtshan nyid khyad par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la yang yid brtan du mi rung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad la de dang mtshan nyid khyad par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la yang yid brtan du mi rung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it follows, absurdly, that inference, which is what distinguishes the characteristics of all things, is also unreliable.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'bras bu rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i rtag pa las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i rtag pa las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for the inference of an effect, of an essence, or of nonapprehension to be contradicted by perception or inference, as has been explained.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba srid na ni de'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang 'gal ba srid na ni de'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If it were possible for it to be contradicted by perception and so on, then it would not be a characteristic of inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be an inference.

original: gal te ji ste ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa med na de'i tshe slob dpon gyis gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can te phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa gtan
analyzed: gal te ji ste ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa la gnod pa med na de'i tshe slob dpon gyis gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can te phan tshun 'gal ba'i don sgrub par byed pa gtan
translated: If there is no refutation of the inference that has the characteristics as explained above, then at that time, the master would not state the two reasons that have the characteristics of a reason, which are nonerroneously contradictory, i.e., which prove mutually contradictory meanings,

original: tshigs gnyis chos can gcig la zhugs pa bshad pa de mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni khas blangs pa nyams par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs gnyis chos can gcig la zhugs pa bshad pa de mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni khas blangs pa nyams par bstan pa yin no //
translated: and which engage a single subject.üîΩThis is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúthen you have abandoned your own assertion.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba 'khrul ba med pa can ma brjod pa'i phyir 'dod pa kho na yin pas khas blangs pa nyams pa ga la zhig yod /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba 'khrul ba med pa can ma brjod pa'i phyir 'dod pa kho na yin pas khas blangs pa nyams pa ga la zhig yod /
translated: Since the master does not state a nonerroneously contradictory reason in regard to the object of inference, how could he abandon his own assertion, since he asserts just that?

original: 'on slob dpon gyis gang la bshad ce na /üîΩ'di'i yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on slob dpon gyis gang la bshad ce na / 'di'i yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Well then, what did the master state?üîΩHe states, ‚ÄúThe object of this . . .‚Äù

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the nonerroneously contradictory reason.

original: gzhan yang gal te ma mthong bas ldog pa zhig yin na de'i tshe bye brag pa rnams kyis ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ma mthong bas ldog pa zhig yin na de'i tshe bye brag pa rnams kyis ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, if it is the case that the absence of seeing is the reason for the refutation, then because the Vai≈õe·π£ikas do not see it,

original: ma mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyis grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa mthong ba dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i gtan tshigs kyis grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa mthong ba dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: the reason of not seeing is that the contact that is neither hot nor cold does not possess seeing.

original: mthong ba sa la sogs pa dang ma 'brel par brjod pa gang yin @34b pa ;
analyzed: mthong ba sa la sogs pa dang ma 'brel par brjod pa gang yin @34b pa ;
translated: The contact that is not related to seeing is said to be earth and so on.

original: / slob dpon gyis ni reg pa ma yin pa nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'khrul pa med pa can rigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / slob dpon gyis ni reg pa ma yin pa nyid du bshad pa gang yin pa de yang 'khrul pa med pa can rigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The explanation by the master that it is not contact is also just logical, one that is free of error. This is the meaning.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the absence of seeing is the reason for the refutation,‚Äù and so on.

original: slob dpon gyis rlung gi rab tu dbye ba las gal te bye brag pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis mthong ba sa la sogs pa las reg pa 'gog par byed na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rlung gi rab tu dbye ba las gal te bye brag pas ma mthong ba tsam gyis mthong ba sa la sogs pa las reg pa 'gog par byed na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The master has explained that if the Vai≈õe·π£ika uses the mere absence of seeing as the reason for the refutation of contact with seeing, such as with earth, that is illogical.

original: gal te slob dpon yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par bzhed na de'i tshe reg pa 'gog pa ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te slob dpon yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par bzhed na de'i tshe reg pa 'gog pa ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you accept that the master is refuted merely by not seeing him, then how can it be logical to refute contact?

original: rigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is logical!

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gtan tshigs 'di la yang mi dmigs pas med pa grub par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gtan tshigs 'di la yang mi dmigs pas med pa grub par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because you accept that non-apprehension establishes non-existence in this argument.

original: pha rol po reg pa dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pha rol po reg pa dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúContact is apprehended, etc.‚Äù

original: grang pa yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i rigs pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yin pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa 'di dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: grang pa yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i rigs pa ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yin pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa la mi dmigs pa 'di dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the reason is the non-apprehension of something that has the character of being apprehensible, is it not logical to refute the non-apprehension of earth, etc.?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not logical.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs su snang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su snang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt appears to be a reason,‚Äù etc.

original: sa la sogs pa gang zhig grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i reg pa grang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa mngon sum pa de ni snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa gang zhig grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i reg pa grang ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa mngon sum pa de ni snang ba yin no //
translated: The earth, etc., which is neither hot nor cold, and which is directly perceived as possessing the contact of cold, etc., is the appearance.

original: de'i tshe mngon sum pa ma yin yang gal te grang ba dang dro ba'i rig pa dang ldan pa kho na yin na de ni de'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum pa ma yin yang gal te grang ba dang dro ba'i rig pa dang ldan pa kho na yin na de ni de'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: At that time, even though it is not directly perceived, if it possesses the awareness of cold and heat, then it is its nature.

original: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin zhes zlas dbye ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin zhes zlas dbye ste /
translated: The appearance and its nature are distinguished.

original: de nyid yul yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yul yin no //
translated: That itself is the object.

original: de tsam la reg pa 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de tsam la reg pa 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the contact is not refuted in that mere thing.

original: de la 'gog na ni nyes par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'gog na ni nyes par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If it is refuted, then there is only error.

original: 'di ltar bye brag pa des ni sa la sogs pa gang cung zad ci yod pa de thams cad ni grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa dang bral ba'o zhes chos can du gyur pa sa la sogs pa khyad par med pa kho nar
analyzed: 'di ltar bye brag pa des ni sa la sogs pa gang cung zad ci yod pa de thams cad ni grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa dang bral ba'o zhes chos can du gyur pa sa la sogs pa khyad par med pa kho nar
translated: Thus, that Vai≈õe·π£ika, whatever earth, etc., exists, all of that is devoid of neither hot nor cold, and the subject, earth, etc., is only without distinction.

original: spyir bzung nas reg pa dgag pa smras so //
analyzed: spyir bzung nas reg pa dgag pa smras so //
translated: The general refutation of contact is stated.

original: sa la sogs pa tsam la ni reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yang med la sa la sogs pa la reg pa gcig tu nges pa yang med de /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa tsam la ni reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa yang med la sa la sogs pa la reg pa gcig tu nges pa yang med de /
translated: There is no contact that has the characteristic of the apprehension of earth, etc., and there is no single, definite contact with earth, etc.

original: 'di ltar sa la sogs pa de la yang shing ba la dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa'i bye brag dag la de yod @35a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la sogs pa de la yang shing ba la dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa'i bye brag dag la de yod @35a * //
translated: For, even in earth, etc., there are various kinds of things, such as cotton, stone, leaves, etc.

original: kyang ; / sal sogs pa yod kyang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang ; / sal sogs pa yod kyang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And, even when earth, etc., exist, contact is seen to be different.

original: 'di ltar shing bal gyi reg pa ni 'jam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing bal gyi reg pa ni 'jam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: For, the contact of cotton is characterized by softness,

original: rdo ba la sogs ba'i ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rdo ba la sogs ba'i ni gzhan yin no //
translated: but the contact of stone, etc., is different.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i rog pa yang sa las gyur pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la srid par dogs par 'gyur ba phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i rog pa yang sa las gyur pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la srid par dogs par 'gyur ba phyir /
translated: And, even the contact that is neither hot nor cold is possible in some substance derived from earth, because of the suspicion of that possibility.

original: sa la sogs pa thams cad la ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis do ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa thams cad la ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis do ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to deny the existence of a tactile object that is neither hot nor cold, merely on the ground that one does not see it in all things such as earth, etc.

original: de lta bas na slob dpon rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag nges pa dang ma mthong btsam gyis dgag pa med pa gsungs pa na 'brel pa bzhed pa zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na slob dpon rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag nges pa dang ma mthong btsam gyis dgag pa med pa gsungs pa na 'brel pa bzhed pa zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the Acarya states that there is no negation by mere non-observation of positive concomitance and negative preclusion, he is speaking with a definite purpose.

original: 'on te 'on su zhig gis de skad du klan ka btsal zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'on su zhig gis de skad du klan ka btsal zhe na /
translated: But who is it that has raised such an objection?

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that way, etc.‚Äù

original: slob dpon pa slob dpon gyi slob ma slob kyi gzhung mngon par ma shes pa mi dmigs pas med pa smra ba 'ga' zhig gis de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i 'thad pa dag gi klan ka btsal ba yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon pa slob dpon gyi slob ma slob kyi gzhung mngon par ma shes pa mi dmigs pas med pa smra ba 'ga' zhig gis de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i 'thad pa dag gi klan ka btsal ba yin no //
translated: Some disciple of the Acarya, who does not understand the Acarya‚Äôs text, and who is a nihilist because of his non-apprehension, has raised the objection just stated.

original: gzhan yang mi dmigs pa las med pa khas len na rigs pas gnod pa gzhan 'di yang yod de 'di ltar yul la sogs pa'i khyad par la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dmigs pa las med pa khas len na rigs pas gnod pa gzhan 'di yang yod de 'di ltar yul la sogs pa'i khyad par la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las te /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that non-apprehension is non-existence, there is another logical refutation:

original: rdzas rigs gcig pa dag la yang nus pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag snang ngo //
analyzed: rdzas rigs gcig pa dag la yang nus pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyi ngo bo ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag snang ngo //
translated: In the case of substances of the same type, various different potencies appear, such as taste, potency, and the characteristic of ripening.

original: rdzas nus pa du ma dang ldan pa de la gcig mthong bas te /
analyzed: rdzas nus pa du ma dang ldan pa de la gcig mthong bas te /
translated: In that substance possessing many potencies, one is seen,

original: 'ga' zhig la rdzas kyi ngo bo gcig cig mthong bas yul la sogs pa gzhan na de yod par nges par byar ji ltar rdzas mthong ba 'di ngo bo nyid nges pa ltar byar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la rdzas kyi ngo bo gcig cig mthong bas yul la sogs pa gzhan na de yod par nges par byar ji ltar rdzas mthong ba 'di ngo bo nyid nges pa ltar byar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: but how can one see the substance? It is not logical that by seeing the substance‚Äôs nature, one can ascertain its existence in other places, such as in the object.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on teach that.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa med pa'i yang bsgrub par bya ba der 'khrul pa med par 'dod na ni de'i tshe 'ga' zhig tu rdzas mthong ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa gang yin pa
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa med pa'i yang bsgrub par bya ba der 'khrul pa med par 'dod na ni de'i tshe 'ga' zhig tu rdzas mthong ba'i ngo bo dmigs pa gang yin pa
translated: If you accept that the probandum is not confused with that which is unrelated to the reason, merely because the reason is not seen in the discordant side, then in that case, whatever is the nature that is observed as the substance in some place,

original: de de'i rdzas dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de de'i rdzas dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: that is similar to the substance of that,

original: de thams cad na gnas pa la rjes su dpag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de thams cad na gnas pa la rjes su dpag par 'gyur te /
translated: therefore, it would follow that it is inferred as being in all places.

original: de la yang de'i dus @35b na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam ni yod do //üîΩde yang rigs pa ma yin te 'di ltar yul 'ga' zhig na rdzas kha cig ci zhig ltar ro la sogs pa so sor nges pa nyid du mthong ba yang yul gzhan na gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa dang mi mthun par
analyzed: de la yang de'i dus @35b na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ma mthong ba tsam ni yod do // de yang rigs pa ma yin te 'di ltar yul 'ga' zhig na rdzas kha cig ci zhig ltar ro la sogs pa so sor nges pa nyid du mthong ba yang yul gzhan na gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa dang mi mthun par
translated: And in that case, there is merely the non-observation of the reason in the discordant side.üîΩThat is also unreasonable, because in some places, some substances are seen to be individually ascertained in terms of their taste and so on, and in other places, they appear in a way that is not concordant with what was seen,

original: yang snang ngo //
analyzed: yang snang ngo //
translated: such as in terms of their color and so on.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston te /
translated: For example, and so on, teaches just that.

original: nus pa ni nad sel ba'i mthu'o //
analyzed: nus pa ni nad sel ba'i mthu'o //
translated: potency is the power to cure disease.

original: khyad par du smin par byed pa ni yongs su 'ju bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du smin par byed pa ni yongs su 'ju bar byed pa ste /
translated: Ripening is the special ripening.

original: gang dag la ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa khyad par can yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag la ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa khyad par can yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that have a special flavor, potency, and ripening‚Äù is to be connected with each of the three terms.

original: gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zhing khyad par can las gzhan pa las te /
analyzed: gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zhing khyad par can las gzhan pa las te /
translated: They do not arise from other causes, that is, from causes other than special fields.

original: yul khyad par can las ji lta bar dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dag 'dra bar ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul khyad par can las ji lta bar dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dag 'dra bar ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa khyad par can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as they arise from special fields, they also arise from special times and special modes of performance.

original: legs par bya ba ni 'o mas bcu pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bya ba ni 'o mas bcu pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Special modes of performance are such things as the performance of a sacrifice with milk.üîΩThose who have that field see that the flavor, potency, and ripening are special.

original: yul de pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang dag la yul de yod pa de dag gis de ltar ro la sogs pa khyad par can dang ldan par mthong zhes te /
analyzed: yul de pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang dag la yul de yod pa de dag gis de ltar ro la sogs pa khyad par can dang ldan par mthong zhes te /
translated: Those who have that field are those persons who have that field. They see that the flavor, potency, and ripening are special.

original: yul de'i ma yin pa thams cad kyang de nyid du ste /
analyzed: yul de'i ma yin pa thams cad kyang de nyid du ste /
translated: and all that is not the object of that cognition is also that.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid du de lta bu yin par ji ltar gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang 'dra bar ni 'grub par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid du de lta bu yin par ji ltar gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang 'dra bar ni 'grub par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not established that all objects are just like the form, etc., that is grasped, as having a nature that is just like that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ro la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams ni rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par rnams ni rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the specific qualities of taste, etc., depend on the specific causes.

original: rgyu'i khyad par med na ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par med na ni /
translated: If there were no specific causes,

original: ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid du rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
translated: it would be possible to infer that they have the same nature.

original: rig byed kyi tshig gang la byed pa po ma mthong ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshig gang la byed pa po ma mthong ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: A Vedic statement is one in which the agent is not seen.

original: de yang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin zhing skyes bu'i rtsol ba'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: de yang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin zhing skyes bu'i rtsol ba'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is preceded by the activity of a person and is caused by the effort of a person.

original: 'di ni sgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the result to be accomplished.

original: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa'i tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no difference between the words that are accepted as being produced by a person and those that are not.

original: 'dis ni gtan tshigs bsnyad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan tshigs bsnyad do //
translated: This is the reason.

original: sbyor ba ni dngos po gang zhig gang dang rigs tha dad pa med pa de ni de dang rgyu mtshungs pa can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dngos po gang zhig gang dang rigs tha dad pa med pa de ni de dang rgyu mtshungs pa can yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not of a different type from something is similar to it in being a product,

original: dper na du ba 'ga' zhig du ba gzhan dang rigs mthun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na du ba 'ga' zhig du ba gzhan dang rigs mthun pa lta bu'o //
translated: like some smoke, which is similar to another smoke.

original: skyes bus ma byas par 'dod pa'i tshig rnams kyang skyes bus byas pa'i tshig dag las @36a * //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas par 'dod pa'i tshig rnams kyang skyes bus byas pa'i tshig dag las @36a * //
translated: The words that are held to be not made by a person are not of a different nature from the words that are made by a person.

original: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a reason based on effect.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar dug sel ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang dag gis rig byed rnams kyi khyad par du 'dod pa'i rnam pa de dag thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no // 'di ltar dug sel ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang dag gis rig byed rnams kyi khyad par du 'dod pa'i rnam pa de dag thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.üîΩBecause all the aspects of the Vedas, such as the removal of poison, are seen to be made by persons,

original: 'di ltar lo ma can la sogs pa'i gsang tshig dag kyang dug la sogs pa sel pa la sogs par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar lo ma can la sogs pa'i gsang tshig dag kyang dug la sogs pa sel pa la sogs par snang ngo //
translated: because the incantations of the leaf, etc., are seen to remove poison, etc.

original: gal te sgra'i ngo bo nyid mthun pa'i phyir byed pa po ma mthong ba yang skyes bus byas pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed na 'o na de ltar na ni smra ba po nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i ngo bo nyid mthun pa'i phyir byed pa po ma mthong ba yang skyes bus byas pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed na 'o na de ltar na ni smra ba po nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: If one infers that a sound is produced by a person because of the similarity of the nature of sound to a sound that is seen to be produced, then in that case, because of the similarity of being a speaker,üîΩwhy does one not infer that all persons are omniscient, etc., when one sees that some persons are not omniscient, etc.?

original: skyes bu rnams las skyes bu 'ga' zhig la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos mthong na yang thams cad la ci'i phyir rjes su mi dpag ce na legs par bya ba'i bye brag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams las skyes bu 'ga' zhig la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos mthong na yang thams cad la ci'i phyir rjes su mi dpag ce na legs par bya ba'i bye brag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reply is: because of the difference in the excellence of action.

original: legs par bya ba'i bye brag ni shes rab la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i goms pa ste /
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i bye brag ni shes rab la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i goms pa ste /
translated: The difference in the excellence of action is the cultivation that is in conformity with wisdom, etc.

original: de shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the realization of the difference in wisdom, etc.

original: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad la skyes bu'i so so'i khyad par mthong bas so //
analyzed: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad la skyes bu'i so so'i khyad par mthong bas so //
translated: Because of seeing the individual difference in persons with regard to all good qualities such as wisdom and intelligence.

original: tshig la sogs pa nyid cung zad tsam chos mthun pas te rtags des rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag par 'gyur pa ji ltar tshig dag la rgyu'i khyad par med pa de lta bu'i skyes bu dag ni rgyu'i khyad par med pa can yin pa nyid do
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa nyid cung zad tsam chos mthun pas te rtags des rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag par 'gyur pa ji ltar tshig dag la rgyu'i khyad par med pa de lta bu'i skyes bu dag ni rgyu'i khyad par med pa can yin pa nyid do
translated: By the mere slight similarity of the words, etc., all the aspects are inferred by that reason, just as the words are without a difference of cause, so are those persons without a difference of cause.

original: // gal te bstan bcos dang bzo dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa kho na la legs par bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab la sogs pa khyad zhugs par 'gyur grang gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs par ni mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: // gal te bstan bcos dang bzo dang sgyu rtsal la sogs pa kho na la legs par bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab la sogs pa khyad zhugs par 'gyur grang gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs par ni mi srid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that only in treatises, crafts, and arts, etc., there is a difference in wisdom, etc., as it is in good actions, but not in omniscience, etc.,

original: smras pa / de bzhin du gzhan thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa la yang khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / de bzhin du gzhan thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa la yang khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said: In the same way, in omniscience, etc., a difference is possible.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la legs par bya ba'i khyad par las khyad par rtogs pa yod pa de la legs par bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du shin tu khyad par du 'gro ba yang yod de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la legs par bya ba'i khyad par las khyad par rtogs pa yod pa de la legs par bya ba ci lta ba bzhin du shin tu khyad par du 'gro ba yang yod de /
translated: The application is this: where there is a special realization of a distinction from a special performance of an action, there is a special distinction in the performance of the action, just as it is.

original: dper na bud shing gi yul gyi me lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bud shing gi yul gyi me lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like fire in the domain of fuel.

original: shes rab la sogs pa la yang 'du bya ba'i khyad par las khyad par rtogs pa yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa la yang 'du bya ba'i khyad par las khyad par rtogs pa yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And there is a special realization of a distinction from a special performance of an action in the case of wisdom, etc. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar sgrub @36b par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan nas gnod pa can yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi srid par rjes su dpag pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub @36b par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan nas gnod pa can yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi srid par rjes su dpag pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having thus taught the validating cognition that establishes, in order to teach that there is no refutation, he says, ‚ÄúNor is there any inference of impossibility,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
translated: This is the seventh reason.

original: pha rol pos shes rab la sogs pa srid par rjes su dpag par bya ba la de'i rgyu mtshan gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol pos shes rab la sogs pa srid par rjes su dpag par bya ba la de'i rgyu mtshan gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reason for refuting the inference of the possibility of wisdom, etc.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs shig yod na ni des na de dag mi srid par rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs shig yod na ni des na de dag mi srid par rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a reason for refuting the free from attachment, etc., then one could infer their non-existence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnod par byed ba med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnod par byed ba med par bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from attachment‚Äù and so on indicates that there is no refutation.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong zhing mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong zhing mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the free from attachment is not seen, and because the seeing does not exist.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from attachment‚Äù is an example.üîΩBecause the non-seeing of the free from attachment does not establish the state of refutation and refutative reason.

original: gal te gang gis na gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs tshol bar 'gyur ba 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dngos su mi srid par rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gang gis na gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs tshol bar 'gyur ba 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dngos su mi srid par rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If one does not infer the non-existence of the free from attachment, etc., because they are not actually possible,üîΩthen why seek a refutative reason?

original: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: But those who desire to be free from attachment infer attachment, etc.

original: de dag rjes su dpag na shugs kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa bkag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag rjes su dpag na shugs kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa bkag par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i phyir /
translated: If they infer those, then by implication freedom from attachment, etc. are refuted.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain this, he says,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtags 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can ni med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtags 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can ni med do //
translated: There is no unmistaken effect of attachment, etc.

original: ji ste gal te shes rab la sogs pa shin tu khyad zhugs pa yod na ci'i phyir mi snad zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste gal te shes rab la sogs pa shin tu khyad zhugs pa yod na ci'i phyir mi snad zhe na /
translated: If there is a great difference in the sharpness of wisdom, etc., why is there no difference in the body?üîΩTo explain this, he says,

original: de'i phyir srid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Even if there were a difference, etc.

original: khyad par rnams zhes bya ba 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par rnams zhes bya ba 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The differences are freedom from attachment, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal pa rnams tshu rol mthong bas lta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal pa rnams tshu rol mthong bas lta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are naturally separated, they cannot be seen by those with limited vision.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir de spong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir de spong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you think that they are abandoned just because they are not perceived,

original: de lta bu dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúThose like that . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta bu dag ces bya ba ni bskal pa dag ste /
analyzed: de lta bu dag ces bya ba ni bskal pa dag ste /
translated: ‚Äú Those like that‚Äù refers to eons.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis spangs par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te ji ltar shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par bltar mi rung ba ltar rig byed @37a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis spangs par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te ji ltar shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par bltar mi rung ba ltar rig byed @37a * //
translated: They are not suitable to be abandoned just by not being perceived.üîΩJust as the difference between wisdom and so on is not seen, so too the words of the Vedas are like that.

original: kyi tshig dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: kyi tshig dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The words are not like that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the difference is seen.

original: 'di ltar rig byed kyi tshig rnams kyi khyad par ni bltar rung ba kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed kyi tshig rnams kyi khyad par ni bltar rung ba kho nar 'dod do //
translated: Thus the difference between the words of the Vedas is asserted to be seen.

original: 'on te mi 'dod na ni de lta na khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig tu khas len na yang khyad par mi dmigs pa des na rig byed kyi tshig khyad par ma mthong ba rnams 'jig rten pa'i tshig dag las rigs mi mthun pa nyid du
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dod na ni de lta na khyad par bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig tu khas len na yang khyad par mi dmigs pa des na rig byed kyi tshig khyad par ma mthong ba rnams 'jig rten pa'i tshig dag las rigs mi mthun pa nyid du
translated: But if you do not accept that, then it is contradictory to accept that the Vedic expressions that are not seen to be different are of a different type from worldly expressions,

original: khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not seen to be different.

original: gal te rig byed rnams kyi khyad par mnyan dka' ba dang smra dka' pa nyid la sogs pa bltar rung ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te rig byed rnams kyi khyad par mnyan dka' ba dang smra dka' pa nyid la sogs pa bltar rung ba kho na ste /
translated: If you say that the difference of the Vedas, such as that they are difficult to hear and difficult to speak, is indeed seen,

original: de dag ni skyes bus byas pa rnams dang / tha dad par 'gyur bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de dag ni skyes bus byas pa rnams dang / tha dad par 'gyur bar 'dod na /
translated: and you assert that they are different from those created by persons,

original: de'i khyad par rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i khyad par rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then you would have to say that their difference is seen, and so on.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa dag la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in other cases‚Äù means also in the case of those created by persons.

original: khyad par ma mthong ba rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid du khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par ma mthong ba rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid du khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: It is contradictory to accept that the expressions that are not seen to be different are of a different type.

original: khyad par rnams bltar mi rung ba nyid du mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: khyad par rnams bltar mi rung ba nyid du mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it unreasonable that the differences are not seen,

original: mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa 'gal ba 'di'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa 'gal ba 'di'i yang phyir te /
translated: but also because it is contradictory that what is directly perceived is not directly perceived.

original: gcig la ngo bo nyid 'gal ba gnyis ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig la ngo bo nyid 'gal ba gnyis ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for two contradictory natures to belong to one thing.

original: gal te khyad par rnams ni mngon sum pa kho na yin la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir dug la sogs pa ni nus pa bzhin du nges par mi zin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par rnams ni mngon sum pa kho na yin la 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir dug la sogs pa ni nus pa bzhin du nges par mi zin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the differences are only directly perceived, but they are not ascertained because there is a reason for error, like the potency of poison,

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: we say that there is no reason for error.

original: dug la sogs pa la ni gzugs 'dra ba snang ba 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: dug la sogs pa la ni gzugs 'dra ba snang ba 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: In the case of poison, etc., the appearance of a similar form is the reason for error.

original: rig byed rnams la ni de lta bu med do //
analyzed: rig byed rnams la ni de lta bu med do //
translated: But that does not exist in the case of the Vedas.

original: gal te ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar shes she na /
translated: If you ask, how do we know that?

original: gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: We say that error is not established because there is no reason for error.

original: gal te rig byed rnams kyi khyad par 'khrul pas /
analyzed: gal te rig byed rnams kyi khyad par 'khrul pas /
translated: If, on the other hand, the error in the specific features of the Vedas

original: mi dmigs ba las yang khyad par la dmigs pa'i tshad ma 'khrul pa la gnod par byed ba skyed na ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs ba las yang khyad par la dmigs pa'i tshad ma 'khrul pa la gnod par byed ba skyed na ni /
translated: were to invalidate the nonerroneous valid cognition that perceives the specific features,

original: de'i tshe 'khrul pa dang de'i rgyu mtshan yang nges par 'gyur ba zhig na de de ni med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khrul pa dang de'i rgyu mtshan yang nges par 'gyur ba zhig na de de ni med do //
translated: then at that time, the error and its reason would also be ascertained, but that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na rig byed rnams 'jig rten pa'i sgra dag dang khyad med par bsgrub par bya ba la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rig byed rnams 'jig rten pa'i sgra dag dang khyad med par bsgrub par bya ba la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no valid cognition that invalidates the establishment of the Vedas as being no different from worldly sounds.

original: 'o na skyes bu dag la gang gis na rnam pa thams @37b cad du yon tan 'dra ba nyid du sgrub ba la skyon du 'gyur ba gnod pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na skyes bu dag la gang gis na rnam pa thams @37b cad du yon tan 'dra ba nyid du sgrub ba la skyon du 'gyur ba gnod pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Well then, what is the fault that occurs when establishing that all aspects of persons are similar?

original: skyes bu dag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu dag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos te /
translated: He says, In the case of persons, etc.

original: shes rab la sogs pa ches khyad zhugs pa mthong ba gang yin pa de gnod par byed pa yin pa'i mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa ches khyad zhugs pa mthong ba gang yin pa de gnod par byed pa yin pa'i mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: The fact that wisdom, etc. are seen to be very different is not the same as an invalidation.

original: rig byed kyi tshig rjes su dpag par sgra mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa gal te khyad par rang gi ngo bor gyur pa zhig yin na ni nyes pa 'dir 'gyurüîΩba zhig na /
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshig rjes su dpag par sgra mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa gal te khyad par rang gi ngo bor gyur pa zhig yin na ni nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the specific words were the essence of the words, then this error would occur.

original: 'o na gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if they are the essence of something else,

original: de'i phyir tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the response is: ‚ÄúThe specific words are the essence of something else.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni gzhan gyi ngo bor red pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni gzhan gyi ngo bor red pa ste /
translated: The essence of something else is the essence of another.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with ‚Äúthe essence of another.‚ÄùüîΩBecause they are not specific words,

original: de'i khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshig khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshig khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not specific words.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de gang gi phyir tshig rnams la khyad par med pa de'i phyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus byas pa ma yin par 'dod pa thams cad skyes bus byed cing skyesüîΩbu dag gis byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de gang gi phyir tshig rnams la khyad par med pa de'i phyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus byas pa ma yin par 'dod pa thams cad skyes bus byed cing skyes bu dag gis byed do //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù concludes the chapter. Since there is no difference in the words, therefore, the nature of the difference is that all things that are held to be created by a person or not created by a person are created by a person and not created by a person.üîΩOr, they are created by persons.

original: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa yang skyes bus mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa yang skyes bus mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, they are created by neither.

original: de ltar slob dpon pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldag par 'dod pa la phan tshun 'gal bar bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldag par 'dod pa la phan tshun 'gal bar bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the mutual contradiction of the assertion that the reason is excluded from the discordant side merely by the non-observation of the master,

original: mu stegs can rnams la yang bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams la yang bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says to the tƒ´rthikas, ‚ÄúThe self, etc.‚Äù

original: sa la shes yod pa ni sa la shes pa yod ba ste 'di ni 'jig rten rgyad  pan pa'i lta ba yin no //
analyzed: sa la shes yod pa ni sa la shes pa yod ba ste 'di ni 'jig rten rgyad  pan pa'i lta ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúEarth has consciousness‚Äù means earth has consciousness. This is the view of the LokƒÅyatas.
