original: bdag dang sa la shes pa yod pa zhes zlas dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang sa la shes pa yod pa zhes zlas dbye ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cognition of self and earth‚Äù is a dvandva compound.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa yod pa bsdu'o //üîΩde dag med pa bsgrub par bya ba la gzhan gyis mi dmigs pa smras kyang /üîΩbdag la sogs pa smra ba dag gis mi dmigs pa tsam zhig ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes med pa de rab tu bsgrub pa ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa'i mi dmigs pa bdag la sogs pa dgag pa la tshad ma nyid du mi
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa yod pa bsdu'o // de dag med pa bsgrub par bya ba la gzhan gyis mi dmigs pa smras kyang / bdag la sogs pa smra ba dag gis mi dmigs pa tsam zhig ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes med pa de rab tu bsgrub pa ma yin par 'dod pa gang yin pa'i mi dmigs pa bdag la sogs pa dgag pa la tshad ma nyid du mi
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes such things as curd in milk.üîΩWhen proving that those do not exist, others may say that nonapprehension is not a valid means of knowledge.üîΩBut we do not assert that nonapprehension is a valid means of knowledge that proves the nonexistence of self and so on.

original: 'dod pa de ci gtan tshigs med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa de ci gtan tshigs med pa ste /
translated: Why is nonapprehension not asserted to be a valid means of knowledge that refutes self and so on?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa sgrub par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa sgrub par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Is it because it is not a reason that is the opposite of the discordant class?

original: ji ltar @38a * //
analyzed: ji ltar @38a * //
translated: How is that?

original: 'di bdag la sogs pa med par sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: 'di bdag la sogs pa med par sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma ma yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as nonapprehension is not a valid means of knowledge that proves the nonexistence of self and so on,

original: gtan tshigs med pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs med pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: the absence of a reason is also like that.

original: 'on te 'di gtan tshigs med pa la tshad ma nyid du 'dod na ni de mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa bye brag pa la sogs pa 'di'i bdag tu smra ba yang dmigs pa med cing rten med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di gtan tshigs med pa la tshad ma nyid du 'dod na ni de mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa bye brag pa la sogs pa 'di'i bdag tu smra ba yang dmigs pa med cing rten med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you maintain that this is a valid cognition without a reason, then the self of the Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on, which is asserted to be the cause of the activity of the body, would be non-apprehensible and without a basis, because the non-apprehension that is the valid cognition is impossible.

original: de la yang med pa sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang med pa sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that non-apprehension proves the non-existence of that.

original: 'di ltar bdag mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir bdag mngon sum du ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir bdag mngon sum du ni mi dmigs so //
translated: Thus, because the self is not directly perceived, the self is not directly perceived.

original: bdag ni tshu rol mthong ba'i dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni tshu rol mthong ba'i dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The self is not the object of the sense consciousnesses of those who see only a short distance,

original: de ni rang bzhin bskal pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin bskal pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is by nature beyond the scope of the sense consciousnesses.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba yid kyi mngon sum gang yin pa de yang dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i mjug thogs su 'byung ba yid kyi mngon sum gang yin pa de yang dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Also, the mental direct perception that arises immediately after the sense consciousness is an object that immediately follows the object of the sense consciousness.

original: rang rig pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not reflexive awareness,

original: de'i yul ni rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its object is its own nature.

original: gang zhig bdag ni nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa'i mngon sum yin no zhes zer ba de yang rnar mi 'ong ste /
analyzed: gang zhig bdag ni nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa'i mngon sum yin no zhes zer ba de yang rnar mi 'ong ste /
translated: Also, it is not reasonable to say that the self is the object of the direct perception that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag skem mo sbom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas lus kyi gnas skabs la kun du reg pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag skem mo sbom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pas lus kyi gnas skabs la kun du reg pa'i phyir te /
translated: Also, it is not reasonable to say that the self is the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù because that cognition is not direct perception, since it is associated with discursive thought, and because it is associated with the condition of the body, as in ‚ÄúI am thin‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am fat.‚Äù

original: bdag la ni skem pa la sogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la ni skem pa la sogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The self does not have thinness or fatness.

original: shes pa rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i yul gzhan yin pa ni med de ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i yul gzhan yin pa ni med de ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it the object of a cognition with a different aspect, because that would be absurd.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag la rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rtags kyang med do //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag la rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rtags kyang med do //
translated: Since it is not a direct perception, there is no sign of the self that is naturally established.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rtags kyang med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i rtags kyang med de /
translated: Nor is there a sign of the self that is an effect, because the effect is not established.

original: bdag mngon sum ma yin pa la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa bsgrubs pa 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po med do //
analyzed: bdag mngon sum ma yin pa la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa bsgrubs pa 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po med do //
translated: The non-existence of the effect and cause is established by the non-perception of the self which is not directly perceived.

original: de bas na rtags med pa'i phyir bdag ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rtags med pa'i phyir bdag ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no reason, the self is not an object of inference.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa rnams ji ltar 'bras bu rnam par shes pas rjes su dpog ce na /üîΩdbang po la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa rnams ji ltar 'bras bu rnam par shes pas rjes su dpog ce na / dbang po la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the eye, etc. are not direct perception, how is it that the effect, consciousness, is inferred from them?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúThe eye, etc. are the cause of consciousness, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dran pa'i sa bon la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dran pa'i sa bon la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the seeds of memory, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid 'bras bu ste /
translated: Consciousness itself is the effect,

original: de res 'ga' ba yin pa'i @38b phyir ro //
analyzed: de res 'ga' ba yin pa'i @38b phyir ro //
translated: because it is intermittent.

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed ba dag yod du zin kyang mig btsums pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir dang / yang mig phye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnam par shes ba rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed ba dag yod du zin kyang mig btsums pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir dang / yang mig phye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i phyir 'bras bu rnam par shes ba rgyu gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, even though form, light, and mental activity exist, consciousness is not established as a cause because it does not exist in the state of closed eyes, etc., and it does exist in the state of open eyes, etc. Therefore, the effect, consciousness, is established as having a cause that is dependent on other conditions.

original: de bas na 'di ltos pa dang bcas par grub pas dbang po la sogs pa rab tu 'grub par brjod de /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltos pa dang bcas par grub pas dbang po la sogs pa rab tu 'grub par brjod de /
translated: Thus, since it is established as having a cause, the sense faculties, etc., are established as causes.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa 'di ltos pa dang bcas shing res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis de nyid dbang po yin no zhes bya bar tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa 'di ltos pa dang bcas shing res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis de nyid dbang po yin no zhes bya bar tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: Since this consciousness is established as having a cause and as being intermittent, it is designated as the sense faculty, in the sense that ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of this consciousness? It is this sense faculty.‚Äù

original: 'di lta bur gyur ba zhig yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs can nyid la sogs pa gzugs kyi khyad par du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur ba zhig yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs can nyid la sogs pa gzugs kyi khyad par du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not that it is like this or like that. This means that it is not a particular of form, such as having form and so on.

original: 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa rab tu bsgrub pa ni de ltar don chung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed de zhes bya ba la de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ltar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa rab tu bsgrub pa ni de ltar don chung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed de zhes bya ba la de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ltar ro //
translated: The establishment of the result, such as pleasure, is not at all extended by that, in the way that consciousness is.

original: rgyu tsam la ltos pa dang bcas ba nyid kyis 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa bdag gi yon tan du 'dod pa rab tu bsgrub pa ni bdag tu smra ba'i don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed de bde ba la sogs pa rgyu gang yang rung
analyzed: rgyu tsam la ltos pa dang bcas ba nyid kyis 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa bdag gi yon tan du 'dod pa rab tu bsgrub pa ni bdag tu smra ba'i don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed de bde ba la sogs pa rgyu gang yang rung
translated: The establishment of the result, such as pleasure, as a quality of the self, which is dependent on a mere cause, does not at all extend the purpose of the proponents of a self, because pleasure and so on are not taught to be a particular of any cause.

original: ba khyad par ma bstan pas rgyu dang ldan par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba khyad par ma bstan pas rgyu dang ldan par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are accepted as possessing a cause,

original: bdag ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: the self is not like that.

original: rtag pa dang byed pa po dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang byed pa po dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted as having the attributes of permanence, being a creator, being an experiencer, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar khas blangs pa'i bdag la 'bras bu'i rtags med pa de lta yin dang / bdag mi dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur na /üîΩsangs rgyas ba la sogs pas bdag med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes mi dmigs pa des bdag de sel ba na ci ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar khas blangs pa'i bdag la 'bras bu'i rtags med pa de lta yin dang / bdag mi dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur na / sangs rgyas ba la sogs pas bdag med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes mi dmigs pa des bdag de sel ba na ci ste /
translated: Since the self as it is accepted does not have the attributes of a result, it is not observed at all.üîΩBut if you, the Buddhist, refute the self by that nonobservation, saying, ‚ÄúThe self does not exist because it is not observed,‚Äù

original: bdag tu smra bas mi dmigs pa tsam gyis bdag med pa yin no zhes bsal zhing spangs /
analyzed: bdag tu smra bas mi dmigs pa tsam gyis bdag med pa yin no zhes bsal zhing spangs /
translated: why do you, the proponent of the self, not refute the self by the mere nonobservation of the self, saying, ‚ÄúThe self does not exist because it is not observed‚Äù?

original: mi dmigs pa 'di bsgrub pa ma yin na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa ldog pa ji ltar sgrub par byed /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di bsgrub pa ma yin na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la sogs pa ldog pa ji ltar sgrub par byed /
translated: If this nonobservation is not established, then how do you establish the reason that the self does not possess life and so on, which is the opposite of the position that the self possesses life and so on?

original: rgyang pa na pa rnams ni shes pa yod pa na 'byung ba rnams kho na'i mthu @39a * //
analyzed: rgyang pa na pa rnams ni shes pa yod pa na 'byung ba rnams kho na'i mthu @39a * //
translated: The LokƒÅyatas say that when consciousness exists, it arises from the elements alone.

original: yin la / sa yang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod de de ltar 'jig rten rgyang pan pa sa la shes pa yod par mi dmigs par 'dod bzhin du yang ma mthong ba /
analyzed: yin la / sa yang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod de de ltar 'jig rten rgyang pan pa sa la shes pa yod par mi dmigs par 'dod bzhin du yang ma mthong ba /
translated: and the earth is of the nature of the elements.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa de nyid kyis tshig la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs par bsgrub pa'i phyir rtags nyid du nye bar bkod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par smra'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa de nyid kyis tshig la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs par bsgrub pa'i phyir rtags nyid du nye bar bkod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par smra'o //
translated: Thus, the Lokayata, while not observing the existence of consciousness in the earth, still, by that very nonvalid cognition, posits the very same nonvalid cognition as a logical reason to prove that the omniscience of words and so on is not omniscience and so on.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni grangs can te yang de nyid 'o ma la sogs pa zho la sogs pa mi dmigs par 'dod bzhin du yang mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni grangs can te yang de nyid 'o ma la sogs pa zho la sogs pa mi dmigs par 'dod bzhin du yang mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
translated: The Samkhya, who is called ‚Äúanother,‚Äù while not observing curd and so on in milk and so on, still says that the eye and so on are for the sake of another,

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras nas /
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras nas /
translated: because they are composites.

original: gzhan gyi don ma yin pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la 'dus pa nyid ma mthong bas ldog pa smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ma yin pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la 'dus pa nyid ma mthong bas ldog pa smra'o //
translated: And because he does not observe noncomposites, such as the horns of a rabbit, to be for the sake of another, he posits the reverse pervasion.

original: de ltar re zhig 'di'i phan tshun 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'di'i phan tshun 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Thus, for the time being, there is a contradiction between these two.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang gtan tshigs 'di'i khyab pa mi 'grub bo //üîΩ'di la gang gis na mig la sogs pa 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang gtan tshigs 'di'i khyab pa mi 'grub bo // 'di la gang gis na mig la sogs pa 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But the pervasion of this reason is not established by mere non-perception.üîΩWhat is the certainty here that the collection is necessarily for the sake of another,üîΩbecause of the collection of eyes, etc., which is established for the sake of the self of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya,

original: gzhan gyi don du 'grub pas grangs can gyi bdag gi don nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dus pa dag ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi don yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du 'grub pas grangs can gyi bdag gi don nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dus pa dag ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi don yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
translated: since it is established for the sake of another?

original: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa mi dmigs pa 'dod pa bzhin du yang zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa mi dmigs pa 'dod pa bzhin du yang zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de mi rung ste /
translated: As for what was said, ‚Äújust as you accept the non-perception of curd, etc. in milk, etc.,‚Äù that is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa dmigs pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa dmigs pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: For in this way, curd, etc. is perceived in milk, etc.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It is called inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mi nus pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mi nus pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bstan te /
translated: And inference does not arise from what is impossible.

original: gal te 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa'i nus pa med na /
analyzed: gal te 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa'i nus pa med na /
translated: If there were no potential for curd, etc. in milk, etc.,

original: 'o ma la sogs pa nus pa med pa de las zho la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa nus pa med pa de las zho la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But milk and so on, which are powerless, do not produce curd and so on.

original: sbyor ba ni gang gis gang zhig bskyed par mi nus pa de ni de las mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gis gang zhig bskyed par mi nus pa de ni de las mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is powerless to produce something does not arise from that.

original: dper na / s'a lu'i sa bon las nas kyi myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / s'a lu'i sa bon las nas kyi myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a rice sprout does not arise from a barley seed.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa las ni zho la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa las ni zho la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: But curd and so on do arise from milk and so on.

original: de lta bas na 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa'i nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa'i nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, milk and so on have the power to produce curd and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang 'dra ba chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang 'dra ba chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is a dissimilar application, similar to the inference from effect to cause.

original: nus pa nyid zho la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: nus pa nyid zho la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The power itself is curd and so on,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro @39b snyam du bsam pa yin no //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' smra bas yang nus pa 'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro @39b snyam du bsam pa yin no // grub pa'i mtha' smra bas yang nus pa 'di ci zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: because cause and effect are not different.üîΩThe proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúWhat is this power?‚Äù and so on.

original: ci zhig la sogs pa'i dngos po phyis dmigs pa yod pa de nyid nus pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci zhig la sogs pa'i dngos po phyis dmigs pa yod pa de nyid nus pa yin nam /
translated: Is the later observed entity, and so on, itself the power?

original: 'on te zho la sogs pa las don tha dad pa gzhan nyid cung zad cig yin /
analyzed: 'on te zho la sogs pa las don tha dad pa gzhan nyid cung zad cig yin /
translated: Or is it something else, a different object from yogurt and so on?

original: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni zho la sogs pa grub pa bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na dmigs par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ste gzhan zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te nus pa zho la sogs pa las don tha dad pa zhig yin no zhe na de'i tshe /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni zho la sogs pa grub pa bzhin du 'o ma la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na dmigs par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // ji ste gzhan zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te nus pa zho la sogs pa las don tha dad pa zhig yin no zhe na de'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù means that just as yogurt and so on are established, so too milk and so on would be observed at the time of their existence, because there would be no difference.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúIt is something else,‚Äù if you say that the potency is something else, different from yogurt and so on, then:

original: ji ltar gzhan yod na ste gzhan nus pa zhes bya ba yod na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan yod na ste gzhan nus pa zhes bya ba yod na /
translated: How could yogurt and so on exist when something else, that is, the so-called potency, exists?

original: zho la sogs pa de yod de med pa kho na'o snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: zho la sogs pa de yod de med pa kho na'o snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it would not exist at all.

original: zhol sogs pa bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhol sogs pa bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because milk and so on have the ability to produce yogurt and so on,

original: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa las nye bar gdags pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa las nye bar gdags pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
translated: yogurt and so on are merely imputed in dependence on milk and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa tshad mar ma byas la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tshad mar ma byas la /
translated: You do not take nonobservation as a valid means of knowledge,

original: yang de nyid tshad mar byed pa 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: yang de nyid tshad mar byed pa 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: and yet you take that very nonobservation as a valid means of knowledge. This is mutually contradictory.

original: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis te mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis te mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: The word only indicates that the reason is not established.

original: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa med pa de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa med pa de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: Since there is no cessation merely on the ground of nonperception, therefore, the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩThe word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.

original: gtan tshigs tsam dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa bdag nyid ldog pa na ngo bo nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa zlog par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'chad par
analyzed: gtan tshigs tsam dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa bdag nyid ldog pa na ngo bo nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du nye bar bkod pa zlog par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'chad par
translated: The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.

original: 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos pa yin no //üîΩdper na shing ldog pa na shing sha pa ldog pa lta bu'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ltos pa yin no // dper na shing ldog pa na shing sha pa ldog pa lta bu'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' kho na zhig la de skad du shing sha pa zhes grags pa'i phyir shing de ni shing sha pa zhes bya ba de'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' kho na zhig la de skad du shing sha pa zhes grags pa'i phyir shing de ni shing sha pa zhes bya ba de'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: The word merely indicates that the reason is related to the mere probandum.üîΩ The word merely indicates that the reason is

original: rang gi ngo bo shing yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar shing sha pa zhes bya ba yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo shing yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar shing sha pa zhes bya ba yod par 'gyur /
translated: But how could the existence of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree be possible, even after it has completely abandoned its own nature?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na shing gi rang gi bdag nyid kho na ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na shing gi rang gi bdag nyid kho na ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because its own nature is the very essence of the tree,

original: shing sha pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing sha pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the essence of the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: gtan tshigs de phyir sgrub pa shing sha pa la sogs sogs pa bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni rang bzhin 'brel pa kho na'i phyir te /üîΩrang bzhin bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa shing la sogs pa dang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas 'brel pa @40a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de phyir sgrub pa shing sha pa la sogs sogs pa bdag nyid du gyur pa de ni rang bzhin 'brel pa kho na'i phyir te / rang bzhin bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa shing la sogs pa dang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas 'brel pa @40a * //
translated: The reason is that the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree, etc., which are the probandum, are related to the essence, etc., which is the probans, only through intrinsic relatedness.

original: kho nas 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: kho nas 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Because the essence of the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree, etc., which are the probandum, is related to the essence, etc., which is the probans, only through intrinsic relatedness, there is no error.

original: rgyu yis ni zhes bya ba ldog pa na zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu yis ni zhes bya ba ldog pa na zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúby the reason‚Äù are to be taken as ‚Äúby the negation of the reason.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu zlog par 'gyur zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu zlog par 'gyur zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is negated‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no error.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do zhes bye ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do zhes bye ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The effect does not err with regard to the cause.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad do //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad do //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu log pa na 'bras bu mi ldog na de'i tshe 'bras bur 'dod pa de ni rgyu de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu log pa na 'bras bu mi ldog na de'i tshe 'bras bur 'dod pa de ni rgyu de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù if the effect does not cease when the cause ceases, then what is held to be the effect is not the effect of that cause.

original: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa yin na rgyu ldog pa ni 'bras bu gdon mi za bar zlog par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa yin na rgyu ldog pa ni 'bras bu gdon mi za bar zlog par byed do //
translated: Thus, if the nature of cause and effect is established, then the cessation of the cause necessarily brings about the cessation of the effect.

original: de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba ston te /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba ston te /
translated: This is what is shown by the statement, ‚ÄúThe nature of cause and effect is established. . . . ‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid nges par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid nges par byed de /
translated: The nature of cause and effect is established when the nature of the effect is ascertained in the cause.

original: der 'khrul pa med par byed do //
analyzed: der 'khrul pa med par byed do //
translated: It is made nonerroneous.

original: de bas na bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba log pas gtan tshigs ldog go //
analyzed: de bas na bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis gnyi gar zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba log pas gtan tshigs ldog go //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúin both ways‚Äù in the explanation just given means that the reason is reversed because the object of affirmation is reversed, due to the relation of intrinsic nature alone, in the sense of being of the same nature or arising from it.

original: de lta min na gcig log pas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma 'brel pa log pas /
analyzed: de lta min na gcig log pas zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma 'brel pa log pas /
translated: Otherwise, if the phrase ‚Äúbecause one is reversed‚Äù meant that the reason is reversed because the object of affirmation is reversed, then how could the other, the property of the thesis, not be reversed?

original: ji ltar gzhan mi ldog par 'gyur sgrub pa'i chos ma 'brel pa ldog par 'gyur mi 'gyur pa kho na ste 'di ltar mi la mi dag la rta mi bdog ces te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan mi ldog par 'gyur sgrub pa'i chos ma 'brel pa ldog par 'gyur mi 'gyur pa kho na ste 'di ltar mi la mi dag la rta mi bdog ces te /
translated: It would not be reversed, because the property of the thesis that is not related to the reason would be reversed. For example, when it is said that ‚Äúhumans do not have horses,‚Äù

original: rta med ces te phyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci /
analyzed: rta med ces te phyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci /
translated: do they not have cattle?

original: de bzhin gcig cig nye ba'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gcig cig nye ba'i phyir // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, because one is near.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang ma 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs nye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang ma 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs nye ba'i phyir /
translated: This means that because the reason is near to the object of affirmation,

original: ji ltar gzhan bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nye bar 'gyur nye bar mi 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nye bar 'gyur nye bar mi 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: how could the other, the property of the thesis, be near? It is not accepted that it is near.

original: 'di ltar mi la phyugs ni bdog / ces te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi la phyugs ni bdog / ces te /
translated: In the same way, one might say, ‚ÄúA man has cattle,‚ÄùüîΩor, ‚ÄúHe has horses,‚Äù because of the relation of ownership.

original: de bzhin rta yang bdog gam ci gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel ba kho nas bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin rta yang bdog gam ci gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel ba kho nas bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, the reason, by the relation of the property of the logical reason alone, makes known the probandum, because of the relation of the property of the logical reason alone with the thing that is to be established.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'brel pa'o //üîΩde'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'brel pa'o // de'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the relation of nature.üîΩ‚ÄúThe nature of that‚Äù and so on refers to the nature of the probandum.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It is either the nature of that or the characteristic of that.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba de nyid chos mthun pa pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dag @40b gis rab tu ston to //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba de nyid chos mthun pa pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dag @40b gis rab tu ston to //
translated: The relation of nature is shown by the example of the similar property and the dissimilar property, which are called ‚Äúthe invariable relation.‚Äù

original: de bas na chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i 'bras bu ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gtan tshigs med par ston to //
analyzed: de bas na chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i 'bras bu ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis gtan tshigs med par ston to //
translated: Therefore, the result of the dissimilar example shows that the reason is absent when the probandum is absent.

original: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag med na mi 'byung bar bsnyad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag med na mi 'byung bar bsnyad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the probandum and the proof are said to be invariably related.

original: de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la /
translated: Therefore, in the dissimilar example,

original: nges par 'di la gzhi chos can dngos por gyur pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: nges par 'di la gzhi chos can dngos por gyur pa mi 'dod do //
translated: we do not accept that the basis, the subject, is an existent entity.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la'o /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la'o /
translated: ‚Äú In this case‚Äù refers to the reasons based on nature and effect.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: In the case of the non-observation of nature, we do accept it.

original: de la ni bzlog ste dmigs pa bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ni bzlog ste dmigs pa bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the opposite of the non-observation must be taught.

original: ci'i phyir gzhi mi 'dod ce na de dag med na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhi mi 'dod ce na de dag med na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why do we not accept the basis? He says, ‚ÄúEven if they do not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag med na zhes bya ba rang bzhin dang rgyu dag med na /
analyzed: de dag med na zhes bya ba rang bzhin dang rgyu dag med na /
translated: ‚Äú If they do not exist‚Äù means if the nature and the cause do not exist.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i rtags de med ces bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar chos mi mthun pa brjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i rtags de med ces bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar chos mi mthun pa brjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir /
translated: The reason called ‚Äúnature‚Äù and ‚Äúeffect‚Äù do not exist, and that non-existence is not existent.

original: ldog pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the understanding of the contradistinction.

original: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove just that, he says, ‚ÄúIn this way, etc.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya ba de'i ngo bo sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya ba rgyu'i dngos po rgyu nyid du ston to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya ba de'i ngo bo sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya ba rgyu'i dngos po rgyu nyid du ston to //
translated: In the case of a reason of nature, the probandum is the nature of that which is to be established, and in the case of a reason of effect, the probandum is the causal entity of that which is to be established.

original: de dag mi shes la zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po mi shes pa'i mi la'o //
analyzed: de dag mi shes la zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po mi shes pa'i mi la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of one who does not know those‚Äù means in the case of a person who does not know the nature of that and the causal entity.

original: de ni dpe la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de ni dpe la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He shows that with ‚ÄúIn the case of an example, etc.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba chos ni de'i ngo bo nyid du ston to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba chos ni de'i ngo bo nyid du ston to //
translated: The property to be established is shown to be the nature of that.

original: rnam pa gang gis ston ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ston ce na /
translated: By what mode is it shown?

original: de tsam dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: de tsam dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: It is shown to be related to that extent.

original: byas pa tsam dang 'brel pas byas pa grub pa nyid na grub pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de lta bu des de'i ngo bor ston gyi /
analyzed: byas pa tsam dang 'brel pas byas pa grub pa nyid na grub pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid sgrub pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de lta bu des de'i ngo bor ston gyi /
translated: If the mere fact of being produced establishes it, then the impermanence that is established establishes the intrinsic reality of that thing, and that intrinsic reality of that thing shows its nature.

original: ji ltar kha cig log par rtog pa lta bu phyis rgyu mtshan gyis 'byung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig log par rtog pa lta bu phyis rgyu mtshan gyis 'byung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that later on, by a reason, impermanence arises, as it does in the case of some wrong conceptions.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbyas pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / byas pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says:üîΩThe cause that produces the intrinsic reality of the produced is the intrinsic reality of impermanence.

original: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo gnyid yin na skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo kho na skyed par byed de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo gnyid yin na skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo kho na skyed par byed de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cause that produces the intrinsic reality of the produced is the intrinsic reality of impermanence. It is the intrinsic reality of impermanence that produces it.

original: tshad ma de lta bu de yang dpes ston gyi ma mthong ba tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma de lta bu de yang dpes ston gyi ma mthong ba tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: That kind of valid knowledge is demonstrated by example, not by mere non-seeing.

original: sbyor ba ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The syllogism will be explained below.

original: de lta @41a * //
analyzed: de lta @41a * //
translated: If it were not so,

original: ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar tshad ma mi ston na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar tshad ma mi ston na de'i tshe /
translated: if it did not teach the valid cognition, then

original: chos gcig yod pa'i phyir sgrub ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gcig yod pa'i phyir sgrub ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the existence of one property, the property to be established,

original: de las gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar nges ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar nges ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of that, the other, the property to be established, would also exist.

original: sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be the doubt that the proof is mistaken with regard to the probandum.

original: de lta bas na dpes tshad ma nye bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dpes tshad ma nye bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the valid cognition is taught by means of an example.

original: tshad ma des kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi de tsam dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos tsam dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma des kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi de tsam dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos tsam dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: And by that valid cognition, the probandum is connected with just that much, i.e., it is connected with just the property to be established.

original: ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúfrom its own cause alone,‚Äù etc.

original: byas ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de kho na las byas pa 'jig pa'i ngang can dang skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos gang yin pa de lta bu skyes te /
analyzed: byas ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de kho na las byas pa 'jig pa'i ngang can dang skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos gang yin pa de lta bu skyes te /
translated: Whatever is a cause of creation, from that alone, creation is momentary and has the nature of destruction.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin gyi /
translated: It is momentary and has the nature of destruction.

original: dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not remain for another time.

original: yang ji ltar rang gi rgyu kho na las skyes shen /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rang gi rgyu kho na las skyes shen /
translated: Again, how is it that it is created from its own cause alone?

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúfrom another,‚Äù

original: rang gi rgyu las gzhan pa 'jig pa'i rgyu las byas pa de'i yod pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las gzhan pa 'jig pa'i rgyu las byas pa de'i yod pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of that which is created from a cause of destruction that is different from its own cause is refuted.

original: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nature of impermanence is refuted,

original: de yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that will be shown later.

original: yang na sgrub pa la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rgyu'i dngos por te /
analyzed: yang na sgrub pa la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rgyu'i dngos por te /
translated: Or, the probandum is the property of the probandum in the nature of the cause,

original: yang na dpe la bsgrub par bya ba'i de yod pa nyid yin na sgrub pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis rgyu nyid du rab tu ston to //
analyzed: yang na dpe la bsgrub par bya ba'i de yod pa nyid yin na sgrub pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis rgyu nyid du rab tu ston to //
translated: Or else, this indicates the cause by the form ‚ÄúIf the probandum exists, then the proof exists.‚Äù

original: yang na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo ston pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo ston pa la ltos nas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates that this is in reliance on the indication of the nature of a natural reason.

original: yang bsgrub par bya ba gang zhig rgyu'i dngos por rab tu ston ce na /
analyzed: yang bsgrub par bya ba gang zhig rgyu'i dngos por rab tu ston ce na /
translated: Now, what is the probandum that is indicated as the cause?

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúa different object.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa las don gzhan du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa las don gzhan du gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The probandum is a different object from the proof.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la rnam pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde ltar dpe nye bar bstan pa'i tshad mas de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu bsgrub na ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la rnam pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar dpe nye bar bstan pa'i tshad mas de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu bsgrub na ste /
translated: This is the form of a reason that is an effect.üîΩIf the nature and the causal entity of that are established by the valid knowledge that is the example,

original: bsgrub par bya ba rang bzhin de'i ngo bo sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu'i dngos por rab tu grub pa yin na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba rang bzhin de'i ngo bo sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu'i dngos por rab tu grub pa yin na'o //
translated: then the probandum‚Äîthe nature‚Äîis established as the nature of the proof and as the causal entity.

original: me med na yang du ba med do zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: me med na yang du ba med do zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no fire, there is no smoke‚Äù is to be supplied here.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang me de'i go rims bzhin du byas pa nyid dang / du ba de'i rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang me de'i go rims bzhin du byas pa nyid dang / du ba de'i rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin te /
translated: Because impermanence and fire are, respectively, the nature and cause of the smoke.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu @41b ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu @41b ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has a conjunctive sense.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin na ji ltar byas pa dang / du ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtag pa dang rgyu me med par yod par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin na ji ltar byas pa dang / du ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtag pa dang rgyu me med par yod par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Since this is the case, how could the nature and cause of smoke‚Äîthat is, impermanence and fire‚Äîexist without the other? They could not!

original: de lta bas na de ltar ldog pa yul ma bstan pa'i ngo bo brjod pa la gzhi med par yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog par rab tu 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar ldog pa yul ma bstan pa'i ngo bo brjod pa la gzhi med par yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog par rab tu 'grub po //
translated: Thus, in the absence of a stated basis, the mere expression of a difference in the nature of the two terms in a negative statement does not establish the pervasion in a negative example.

original: de ltar na re zhig de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: So, in order to demonstrate the nature and cause of smoke,

original: de dag mi shes pa la dpe brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mi shes pa la dpe brjod par bya'o //
translated: an example must be given for the sake of those who do not know this.

original: gang dag la de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po dag rang gi tshad ma ji lta bas rab tu grub la /
analyzed: gang dag la de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po dag rang gi tshad ma ji lta bas rab tu grub la /
translated: For those who have established the nature and cause of that by means of their own valid cognition,

original: phyogs kyi chos tsam ma nges pa'i mkhas pa de rnams la ni /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos tsam ma nges pa'i mkhas pa de rnams la ni /
translated: those wise ones who have not ascertained the mere property of the subject,

original: de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po'i phyir gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po'i phyir gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ste /
translated: for them, the reason is called ‚Äúmere property of the subject.‚Äù

original: phyogs kyi chos kho na'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos kho na'o //
translated: It is only the property of the subject.

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: For what purpose? For the purpose of ascertaining the positive and negative concomitance.

original: bstan par bya ba'i don de rang nyid kyis grub pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i don de rang nyid kyis grub pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa'i tshe /
translated: Since the object to be indicated is established by itself alone, at that time, when the positive and negative concomitance is ascertained,

original: de brjod pas dpe brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de brjod pas dpe brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of stating an example by mentioning it?üîΩMoreover, when a fool is to be taught by means of an example,

original: yang gang gi tshe blun po la dpe rab tu bstan par bya ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe blun po la dpe rab tu bstan par bya ba de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: de rab tu bstan na yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la gzhi med par yang ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa 'grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de rab tu bstan na yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la gzhi med par yang ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis ldog pa 'grub pa kho na ste /
translated: Even if it were taught, then as explained, the negation would be established without a basis for the dissimilar example.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhis ci zhig bya snyam du dgongs shing rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa las gzhi spong bar mdzad do //üîΩ'di ltar der 'di skad du 'o na gang gi tshe phyir rgol ba nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa khas mi len pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhis ci zhig bya snyam du dgongs shing rigs pa'i sgo la sogs pa las gzhi spong bar mdzad do // 'di ltar der 'di skad du 'o na gang gi tshe phyir rgol ba nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa khas mi len pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, what would the master do with a basis for the dissimilar example? Thinking this, he abandons the basis in the Door of Reasoning and so on.üîΩIn that way, it is said there: ‚ÄúWell, when the opponent does not assert permanent things such as space, then how is it that being made is negated in permanent things?‚Äù

original: ji ltar rtag pa las byas pa nyid ldog ces brgal ba dang / de la slob dpon gyis gzhi spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa las byas pa nyid ldog ces brgal ba dang / de la slob dpon gyis gzhi spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The master replies, ‚ÄúBecause the basis is abandoned,

original: de'i the tshom nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: de'i the tshom nyid kyang med de /
translated: there is no doubt about that.

original: de med pas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de med pas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because that does not exist, it is not engaged.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dpe dag gis 'brel ba brjod pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpe dag gis 'brel ba brjod pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the reason that the examples express a connection,

original: gtan tshigs 'brel bar shes na chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba smras pas /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'brel bar shes na chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba smras pas /
translated: If one knows the reason, then by stating either a similar or dissimilar example,

original: don gyis go bas cig shos la'ang de gnyis kho na las gang yang rung ba ma smras pa la yang dran pa yang dag skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: don gyis go bas cig shos la'ang de gnyis kho na las gang yang rung ba ma smras pa la yang dran pa yang dag skye bar 'gyur /
translated: the meaning is understood, and one correctly recalls that the other is also either a similar or dissimilar example.

original: de yang slob dpon gyis tshig dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon gyis tshig dang sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: And this is because the master has applied the words.

original: yang na don gyis go bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang na don gyis go bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Or else, by the meaning being understood,

original: gzhung 'di ni rigs pa'i sgo las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhung 'di ni rigs pa'i sgo las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: this passage occurs in the Door of Reasoning.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni @42a * //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni @42a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù

original: 'di nyid las rnam par rtag pa snga ma 'byung ba la ltos ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid las rnam par rtag pa snga ma 'byung ba la ltos ba yin te /
translated: refers to the previous analysis in this text.

original: 'ga' zhig rab tu grags par 'gyur bas gang yang rung ba smras pa yang sgrub pa yin no zhes bshad nas /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rab tu grags par 'gyur bas gang yang rung ba smras pa yang sgrub pa yin no zhes bshad nas /
translated: Since some are well known, it is established that by stating either one,

original: yang don gyis go ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang don gyis go ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the meaning is understood, and then ‚Äúby the meaning being understood‚Äù and so on occurs.

original: gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'am /
translated: Either one means either a similar or dissimilar example.

original: chos mi mthun pas so //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pas so //
translated: By the dissimilar dharma.

original: gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba smras pa yang sgrub pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba smras pa yang sgrub pa yin pas so //
translated: Because both are taught, that is, because the proof is stated in either way.

original: gzhung der yang slob dpon dpes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la go rims bzhin du de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu ston par byed kyi /
analyzed: gzhung der yang slob dpon dpes rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la go rims bzhin du de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu ston par byed kyi /
translated: In that text, the master DignƒÅga thought that, respectively, a reason of nature and a reason of effect teach the nature of that and the state of cause,

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tsam ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs te /
translated: but not merely seeing and not seeing.

original: don gyi go bas dpe gcig brjod pas dpe cig shos 'grub par bshad do /üîΩ// / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: don gyi go bas dpe gcig brjod pas dpe cig shos 'grub par bshad do / // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: He explained that the other example is established by stating one example through understanding the meaning.

original: yang gal te ji ltar na don gyis go bas cig shos 'grub par 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: yang gal te ji ltar na don gyis go bas cig shos 'grub par 'gyur zhen /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is the other established through understanding the meaning?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is like this,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni ril smos pas byas pa thams cad yongs su bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni ril smos pas byas pa thams cad yongs su bsdus pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the whole, and ‚Äúall‚Äù includes everything that is produced.

original: byas pa gang ci yang rung ste de ni mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes smras na /üîΩgsal bar gdon ma za bar mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni byas pa nyid 'di'i ngo bo nyid de tsam dang 'brel par byas pa nyid tsam dang 'brel pa tshad mas mthong ba zhes bya ba tshad mas nges pa kho na yin no zhes bya
analyzed: byas pa gang ci yang rung ste de ni mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes smras na / gsal bar gdon ma za bar mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni byas pa nyid 'di'i ngo bo nyid de tsam dang 'brel par byas pa nyid tsam dang 'brel pa tshad mas mthong ba zhes bya ba tshad mas nges pa kho na yin no zhes bya
translated: Whatever is produced is impermanent.üîΩIt is certain that the nature of this impermanence is related to this production alone, and that the relation of production alone is seen by valid cognition.

original: bar nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is certain that it is ascertained by valid cognition.

original: 'bras bu la yang rgyu gdon mi za bar yod ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang rgyu gdon mi za bar yod ba ma yin nam /
translated: And isn't there necessarily a cause for an effect?

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not the nature of that.

original: de'i phyir don tha dad pa med na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don tha dad pa med na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, If there is no difference in meaning.

original: tshad ma gang gis mthor ba de bstan pa'i phyir de yod par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma gang gis mthor ba de bstan pa'i phyir de yod par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show by what valid cognition it is seen, it says, Because its existence is ascertained.

original: byas pa yod na gdon mi za par mi rtag pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byas pa yod na gdon mi za par mi rtag pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that if there is production, impermanence necessarily exists.

original: sbyor ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin la /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin la /
translated: The application is that the thing is not a cause and effect.

original: gang zhig yod na gang zhig gdon mi za bar yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yod na gang zhig gdon mi za bar yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: That which exists when something exists without a doubt is its nature,

original: dper na de nyid kyi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de nyid kyi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, its own entity.

original: byas pa yod na yang gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa nyed yod pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshegs so //
analyzed: byas pa yod na yang gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa nyed yod pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshegs so //
translated: When the produced exists, the impermanent exists without a doubt. Therefore, it is a logical proof of nature.üîΩThus, one who knows the nature of the produced as impermanent knows the nature of the produced as impermanent. By implication, one who knows the impermanent as the nature of the produced knows that the probandum, impermanence, does not exist when the produced does not exist.

original: de ltar na de'i ngo bor shes pas ni byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par shes ba'i mis ni don gyis go bas @42b bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do zhes bya ba de ltar
analyzed: de ltar na de'i ngo bor shes pas ni byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par shes ba'i mis ni don gyis go bas @42b bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do zhes bya ba de ltar
translated: In that case,

original: nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: one would ascertain that.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtag pa nyid med par de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba byas pa nyid yod par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtag pa nyid med par de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba byas pa nyid yod par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, without the impermanent as its nature, the produced would not exist as its nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the probandum and the proof.

original: de ltar na re zhig chos mthun pas sbyor ba la shugs kyis chos mi mthun pa rtogs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig chos mthun pas sbyor ba la shugs kyis chos mi mthun pa rtogs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the case of a proof by positive example, the negative concomitance is understood by implication.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba la yang chos mthun par rtogs par 'gyur bas de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba la yang chos mthun par rtogs par 'gyur bas de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the case of a proof by negative example, the positive concomitance is understood. Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúIn the same way,‚Äù and so on.

original: de med na zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid gdon mi za bar med do zhes smras na chos mi mthun pa brjod pa de kho nas de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa la /
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid gdon mi za bar med do zhes smras na chos mi mthun pa brjod pa de kho nas de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa la /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIf there is no impermanence, then there is no doubt that there is no production,‚Äù then, by that very statement of the negative concomitance, one understands that the nature of the probandum is the nature of the proof.

original: sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig pa'i mi la rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo zhes 'chad par 'gyur pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig pa'i mi la rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo zhes 'chad par 'gyur pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Then, for a person who understands that, the recollection of the positive concomitance occurs.

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i chos mi mthun pa brjod pas ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid du rigs par 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa'i chos mi mthun pa brjod pas ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyid du rigs par 'gyur zhen /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it that the nature of the probandum is understood by the statement of the negative concomitance as explained?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: mi rtag ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni byas pa nyid 'di'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni byas pa nyid 'di'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This phenomenon called ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is the intrinsic reality of that which is produced.

original: des na de med na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do //
analyzed: des na de med na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, if that does not exist, impermanence does not exist, and if that does not exist, that which is produced does not exist.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par ma gyur na de'i tshod med na byas pa nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par ma gyur na de'i tshod med na byas pa nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if impermanence were not its intrinsic reality, then it would not be tenable to say that if that does not exist, that which is produced does not exist.

original: rgyu de'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo //
translated: For that reason, because it is understood that it is its intrinsic reality, the memory of the invariable concomitance arises through understanding that that which is produced has impermanence as its intrinsic reality.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la gang la gang yang rung ba'i sbyor bas gnyi gas rtogs par bshad nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la gang la gang yang rung ba'i sbyor bas gnyi gas rtogs par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained that in the case of a reason of nature, the invariable concomitance is understood through the application of either the positive or negative concomitance,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in the case of a reason of effect, he says, ‚ÄúIn the same way,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang na zhes bya ba ni ri la brjod pas thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba ni ri la brjod pas thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere‚Äù refers to the mountain, and so includes everything.

original: de ni gdon mi za par me yod do zhes smras na /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za par me yod do zhes smras na /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is fire‚Äù is the statement of the invariable concomitance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba smos ba de kho nas /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba smos ba de kho nas /
translated: By mentioning the invariable concomitance,

original: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba de ltar nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba de ltar nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is ascertained that ‚Äúsmoke is the effect of fire.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: des na du ba yod na gdon mi za bar me yod do //
analyzed: des na du ba yod na gdon mi za bar me yod do //
translated: Because when there is smoke, there is invariably fire.üîΩOtherwise, if fire were not the cause of smoke, then fire would be

original: de lta ma yin na gal te me de du ba'i rgyu ma yin na de'i tshe don gzhan @43a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te me de du ba'i rgyu ma yin na de'i tshe don gzhan @43a * //
translated: a different object,

original: me ni de dang 'brel bar nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: me ni de dang 'brel bar nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because there would be no certainty that fire is related to smoke.

original: du ba dang 'brel ba khyab pa gang der nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba dang 'brel ba khyab pa gang der nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no certainty that the pervasion by the relation with smoke is limited to that.

original: de bas na ngo bo du ba'i ngo bo nyid rang dbang can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ngo bo du ba'i ngo bo nyid rang dbang can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, smoke would be independent, having the nature of its own entity.

original: rang dbang can yin pa des na de med kyang me med kyang du ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir med par mi 'gyur gyi yod ba kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rang dbang can yin pa des na de med kyang me med kyang du ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir med par mi 'gyur gyi yod ba kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Since it is independent, even if fire does not exist, since the nature of smoke is not incomplete, it would not be nonexistent, but would exist alone.

original: de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na du ba ni 'bras bu yin par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na du ba ni 'bras bu yin par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, smoke should be accepted as the effect.

original: 'di ltar du ba 'bras bu yin par khas len na ni gdon mi za bar de'i rgyu me yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba 'bras bu yin par khas len na ni gdon mi za bar de'i rgyu me yod do //
translated: Thus, if smoke is accepted as the effect, then without doubt its cause, fire, exists.

original: 'di kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs ba yin no //
translated: The phrase only this, etc. establishes the text.

original: don gzhan yod na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur 'dod pa yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar 'jog cing bdag nyid ngo bo so sor nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan yod na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur 'dod pa yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar 'jog cing bdag nyid ngo bo so sor nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
translated: If the other object exists, i.e., if the effect that is accepted exists, then its own nature is posited, and its own nature is posited separately.

original: 'bras bu 'bras bu nyid yin pa yang de yod pa nyid na rgyu yod pa de nyid na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'bras bu nyid yin pa yang de yod pa nyid na rgyu yod pa de nyid na yod pa yin no //
translated: The existence of the effect as effect exists only when its cause exists.

original: rgyu yod pa nyid na yod pa de yang du ba la yod de /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa nyid na yod pa de yang du ba la yod de /
translated: That existence when the cause exists exists in smoke.

original: de lta bas na du ba ni 'bras bu yin no zhes de ltar rjes su 'gro bas de'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa'i mis me med na du ba med do zhes bya bar shugs kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na du ba ni 'bras bu yin no zhes de ltar rjes su 'gro bas de'i 'bras bu nyid shes pa'i mis me med na du ba med do zhes bya bar shugs kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since smoke is the effect, one who knows that it is the effect through positive concomitance will understand by implication that if there is no fire, there is no smoke.

original: de ni chos mi mthun pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de ni chos mi mthun pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: In the same way, one who understandsüîΩthe absence of fire through the absence of smokeüîΩwill understand by implication that if there is no fire, there is no smoke.

original: me med na du ba med do zhes smras na /
analyzed: me med na du ba med do zhes smras na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIf there is no fire, there is no smoke,‚ÄùüîΩthis statement of the counter-positive

original: ldog pa brjod pa 'dis me las du ba gdon mi za bar 'byung ngo zhes /üîΩzhes bya ba de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos bo nges par 'gyur ro //üîΩme las gdon mi za bar 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ldog pa brjod pa 'dis me las du ba gdon mi za bar 'byung ngo zhes / zhes bya ba de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos bo nges par 'gyur ro // me las gdon mi za bar 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: makes it certain that smoke definitely arises from fire.üîΩOne should add ‚Äúsmoke definitely arises from fire.‚Äù

original: me kho na las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: me kho na las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it arises only from fire.

original: de ltar na de las 'byung bar nges na /
analyzed: de ltar na de las 'byung bar nges na /
translated: Thus, if it is certain that it arises from that,

original: shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will understand positive concomitance by implication.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te chos mi mthun pa smos pas du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba de mi brjod na de'i tshe de med na du ba ji ste yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te chos mi mthun pa smos pas du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba de mi brjod na de'i tshe de med na du ba ji ste yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, then if it were not stated that ‚Äúsmoke is the effect of fire‚Äù by mentioning a dissimilar instance, then at that time, how could smoke exist when that does not exist?

original: yod pa kho nar 'gyur bas ldog pa nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta bas na don gzhan nyid yin la gang zhig med na gang zhig gdon mi za bar med pa de ni /
analyzed: yod pa kho nar 'gyur bas ldog pa nges pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro // de lta bas na don gzhan nyid yin la gang zhig med na gang zhig gdon mi za bar med pa de ni /
translated: Since it would exist, the certainty of the negative concomitance would not be established.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since they are different objects, that which does not exist when this does not exist is the effect of this.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa brjod pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa brjod pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Therefore, this statement that ‚Äúthe positive concomitance is understood by stating the negative concomitance‚Äù is correct.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis 'khrul pa rtag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis 'khrul pa rtag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Here, another says, ‚ÄúThe error is in the case of permanence, etc.‚Äù

original: rtag pa @43b dang mi rtag pa dag gi don dag gi 'bras bu ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rtag pa @43b dang mi rtag pa dag gi don dag gi 'bras bu ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of objects that are permanent and impermanent is the effect of objects that are permanent and impermanent.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de de ma yin yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de de ma yin yang ngo //
translated: That nature is just that, and it is not that.

original: 'di ltar nyan pa'i shes pa ni sgra kho na'i chos yin pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa yin na de la ci nyan pa'i shes pa sgra rtag pa zhig gi 'bras bu yin nam /üîΩ'on te mi rtag pa zhig gi yin zhes bya ba ni mi shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan pa'i shes pa ni sgra kho na'i chos yin pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa yin na de la ci nyan pa'i shes pa sgra rtag pa zhig gi 'bras bu yin nam / 'on te mi rtag pa zhig gi yin zhes bya ba ni mi shes so //
translated: Thus, if the consciousness that hears is the property of sound alone, it is not shared in common. But how could it be known whether the consciousness that hears is the effect of a permanent sound or the effect of an impermanent sound?

original: de'i phyir nyan pa'i shes pa ni rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan pa'i shes pa ni rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that hears is not the effect of a permanent object,

original: mi rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: nor is it the effect of an impermanent object.

original: 'on kyang de dag med na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don med na nyan pa'i shes pa med de /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag med na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don med na nyan pa'i shes pa med de /
translated: But if those do not exist, then the permanent object and the impermanent object do not exist, and the consciousness that hears does not exist.

original: de dag log na ldog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩre zhig rtag pa'i don med pa la ni med de /üîΩbum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag log na ldog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // re zhig rtag pa'i don med pa la ni med de / bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that if they cease, it ceases.üîΩIt does not exist in the absence of a permanent object.üîΩIt does not exist in the absence of an impermanent object.

original: mi rtag pa'i don med pa la yang med de nam mkha' la sogs pa la rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don med pa la yang med de nam mkha' la sogs pa la rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if the impermanent object does not exist, then the permanent object does not exist, because impermanence does not exist in a permanent object such as a pot.üîΩIf the permanent object does not exist, then the impermanent object does not exist, because permanence does not exist in an impermanent object such as space.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas med pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas med pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIt is not non-existent.‚Äù

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid 'di ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med na med do zhes bya bar de ltar shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid 'di ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa med na med do zhes bya bar de ltar shes par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot know that this state of being audible does not exist if permanence and impermanence do not exist.

original: gal te de dag med na med do zhes bya ba de ltar nges par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de 'bras bu nyid yin par nges par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te de dag med na med do zhes bya ba de ltar nges par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de 'bras bu nyid yin par nges par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were certain that ‚Äúif those do not exist, this does not exist,‚Äù then at that time it would be certain that it is the effect of those.

analyzed: 'on kyang de dag med na med do zhes bya ba nyid ni med do //
translated: However, it is not certain that ‚Äúif those do not exist, this does not exist.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /

translated: Why is that?

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid de las rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don de dag nyid la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
